job_description: Cavaliers Holdings LLC is committed to delivering epic experiences for our fans, team members, community, and the world. Fueled by a diverse, equitable and inclusive culture, we strive to recruit individuals that will be enthusiastic and purposeful in carrying out our vision as Transformative Leaders in Sports and Entertainment. If you are ready to work in the fast-paced and high-energy setting of the Cavs, Monsters, Charge, Legion and Rocket Mortgage FieldHouse— then we want to talk to YOU!Position SummaryThe Cleveland Monsters and Rocket Entertainment Group Franchise Properties are looking for a talentedDigital Content Coordinatorand editor who can help drive engaging and impactful content through the Cleveland Monsters digital and social media channels and maintain a professional appearance to team digital communications. The ideal fit for this role is a creative content mind who is a self-starter, is organized, understands the online culture of the sport and keeps a close eye on the evolving trends of social media and video development. The ideal fit recognizes the important role digital content plays in support all areas of our business, and has aspirations to grow as a well-rounded marketer.This position, based at Rocket Mortgage FieldHouse, will report to the Director of Communications & Community Impact, Cleveland Monsters. This role will work closely with creative teams and counterparts in digital content, graphic design, FieldHouse Creative, and communications, as well as digital leads within the organization, on an on-going basis.A main focus area for this position will be assisting with content creation as directed by team leads. Content may include social posts, webpages on clevelandmonsters.com, the Monsters Mobile App, graphics, video, e-mail communications, and game coverage. This person will work with existing brand guidelines to create content that fits the brand’s voice and aesthetic. This individual will be relied upon to contribute ideas and best practices relative to the digital space. This position will work with departmental leads to help populate and maintain a digital content calendar for the Cleveland Monsters. Another key focus of this position will be providing general support for the Monsters Communications team and lending similar support as directed for Cleveland Charge initiatives.This person is required to be at all Cleveland Monsters home games at Rocket Mortgage FieldHouse and will be asked to help with select road game coverage remotely (no travel required). On game days, this position will support the needs of the Monsters PR & Communications team.TheDigital Content Coordinatorshould be proficient with a number of creative applications that will be key to the role, including but not limited to Adobe Premiere, Adobe Photoshop, TikTok, Twitter, Facebook, and Instagram.This is anentry-level roleseeking minimum 6 months experience.Essential Duties & ResponsibilitiesConsistently meets, works with, and develops strong relationships with team members across departments by being engaged and involved with team activities. Has finger on the pulse of these initiatives and executes through proactive thinking, creativity and innovation.Possesses an overall positive attitude while managing multiple projects across different franchises and departments.Helps to provide social media and PR coverage for roughly 50% of Monsters away games from home.Actively seeks out new and innovative ways to engage with our fans in the digital space.Provides new ideas of how to compliment or elevate team initiatives through digital activation.Supports the efforts of our Ticket Sales and Corporate Partnerships teams by promoting key initiatives and activation of contractually obligated partnership elements.Actively recaps and communicates the impact of the team’s digital activity, including regular reporting to team leaders.Exhibit compelling storytelling through all content and platforms.Captures, produces, and edits video and photo content for team social media and digital channels.Ensure all content is on-brand, consistent in style, quality, and voice.Contribute to digital, marketing, and creative brainstorming sessions.Works with corporate partnerships team to plan, execute, and track contracted partnership activation in the digital space.Maintains and builds library of high quality images for marketing & social useRequired QualificationsBachelor’s degree in communications, marketing, social media or related field is required.Minimum 1 year experience in Premiere, After Effects and Photoshop.Must provide link to portfolio or relevant work for consideration.Experience in managing social accounts for a brand, especially in sports, is a plus.Strong creative thinking and ability to plan and propose new ideas.Ability to act as on-camera talent at in-market events a plus.Creative and strategic in nature with an understanding of how to turn access into content.Desire to seize opportunities and take initiative without needing to be told.Must be organized, highly motivated and team oriented.Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented workplace.Maturity, professionalism, and a strong work ethic are essential.Must be able to work non-traditional hours including evenings, weekends, and holidays on short notice as required.Must provide link to portfolio or relevant work for consideration.We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, age, disability, gender identity, marital or veteran status, or any other protected class.Apply Now
about_sum: Cavaliers Holdings LLC is committed to delivering epic experiences for our fans, team members, community, and the world. If you are ready to work in the fast-paced and high-energy setting of the Cavs, Monsters, Charge, Legion and Rocket Mortgage FieldHouse— then we want to talk to YOU!

job_description: About The TeamThe Zillow Group Talent Management organization drives the overall strategy and execution of learning initiatives for all employees, including but not limited to onboarding programs, professional development and performance, and leadership development. Our team is a talented group of leaders, consultants, facilitators, designers, program operation leads, program managers and learning technology specialists. Together, we work to enrich the career and learning experience of our employees so they can develop personally and professionally in alignment with company goals.About The RoleThe Instructional Designer, reporting to the Delivery Team Manager as part of the Talent Management organization, partners closely with project team members, subject-matter experts, leaders, and cross-functional project teams to integrate learning solutions as the business rapidly moves forward. The Instructional Designer is a contributor to various project teams, and owns design and delivery of learning solutions to ensure our employees have an exceptional learning experience.You will get to:Apply human-centered design principles and contemporary methods of adult learning theory to design and develop high-quality, learning solutions (courses, videos, job aids, and other training resources)Collaborate with Program Managers, Program Operations Leads, trainers, and subject matter experts to understand project objectives, conduct needs analysis, and align solution documents (learning plans, instructional plans, storyboards, etc.)Design and develop assessments and evaluation strategies to measure the effectiveness of training programs and make data-driven improvementsUtilize industry-standard authoring tools, multimedia software, and AI tools to create interactive and visually appealing learning contentParticipate in cross-functional project teams to support a wide variety of business lines and create learning solutions for employees across Zillow GroupWrite observable, measurable, and relevant learning objectivesApply human-centered design principles to reimagine and improve the learner experience and enhance knowledge retentionCreate engaging learning materials, such as presentations, virtual learning solutions, learner guides, facilitator guides, leader guides and toolkits, assessments, and videosDevelop effective instructional exercises and assessments that support the desired learning outcomes and objectivesAdhere to accessibility standards and Talent Management design standardsUpdate, curate, and maintain learning contentHandle multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality training materialsStay up-to-date with industry trends and standard methodologies in learning and development, incorporating innovative approaches to enhance program effectivenessComplete small project requests that are in-scope, but do not need the support of a full project teamThis role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.In California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington the standard base pay range for this role is $81,600.00 - $130,400.00 Annually. This base pay range is specific to California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington and may not be applicable to other locations.In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location.Who you areYou show strength in Google Suite, AI tools, Articulate 360, Camtasia, Vyond, Adobe Creative Cloud, or equivalent rapid eLearning and video creation toolsYou have proficiency in audio editing using tools such as Audacity or AuditionYou have intermediate proficiency in visual design programs such as Photoshop, Dreamweaver, or IllustratorYou have intermediate experience publishing and tracking eLearning SCORM or Tin Can-compliant courses in a Learning Management SystemYou have experience creating scripts, providing voiceovers, and creating closed captions for videosYou are skilled in developing prototypes and storyboardsYou can modify vector graphics and create light artwork when necessaryYou are an exceptional collaborator who prioritizes teamworkQualificationsBachelor's degree in instructional design, education technology, or related field3 years' experience in a learning or talent development roleExcellent written and verbal communication skillsExcellent knowledge and application of adult learning theories and instructional design modelsExperience in publishing and tracking eLearning courses in a Learning Management SystemProficient in video and audio production, graphic design, and facilitating meetings in Zoom or other platformsAbility to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly evolving environmentCollaborative and entrepreneurial mentalityGet to know usZillow is reimagining real estate to make home a reality for more and more people.As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow® and its affiliates help movers find and win their home through digital solutions, first class partners, and easier buying, selling, financing and renting experiences. Millions of people visit Zillow Group sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help make it easier to move. The work we do helps people get home and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making home a reality for more and more people.Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction are supported by a deep-rooted culture of innovation, our passion to redefine the employee experience, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life, and disability coverages as well as parental leave, family benefits, retirement contributions, and paid time off. We’re also setting the standard for work experiences of the future, where our employees are supported in doing their best work and living a flexible, well-balanced life. But don’t just take our word for it. Read recent reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: the 100 Best Companies to Work For, Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index, and TIME 100 Most Influential Companies list.Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at RecruitingAccessibility@zillowgroup.com.Applicants who receive job offers from Zillow Group will be asked to sign a Proprietary Rights Agreement which includes confidentiality, intellectual property assignment, customer and employee non-solicitation, and non-competition provisions. If you are contacted for a role at Zillow Group and wish to review a copy of the Proprietary Rights Agreement prior to receiving an offer, you may request a copy from your Recruiter.
about_sum: The Instructional Designer partners closely with project team members, subject-matter experts, leaders, and cross-functional project teams to integrate learning solutions. The Zillow Group Talent Management organization drives the overall strategy and execution of learning initiatives for all employees. This role has been categorized as a Remote position.

job_description: Job DescriptionGENERAL DUTIES:The Training + Design Specialist will be responsible for developing and delivering sexual and reproductive health training (both in-person and virtual) and technical assistance to health care professionals and other key stakeholders across the country; organizing and facilitating webinars on sexual and reproductive health and justice topics; designing workshops; developing new curriculum, training tools, and e-learning content; and other special projects as assigned. The Training + Design Specialist will be a member of the capacity building division of the organization (The Learning Exchange). This position is based in the organization’s Los Angeles office with a hybrid remote/in-office work schedule. The salary range for this is position $80-85kSPECIFIC DUTIES + RESPONSIBILITIES:Design, develop and deliver in-person and virtual trainings and workshops in the field of sexual and reproductive health (SRH) in both English and Spanish (preferred) for diverse internal and external audiences.Provide support for implementation of capacity building efforts (training, webinars, technical assistance etc.) through developing agendas, coordinating with partners, scheduling trainings, managing registrations, maintaining training records etc.Contribute to the design and production of training materials in English and Spanish (preferred) including participant manuals, visual aids, job aids, tool kits, videos and e-learning modules, etc.Assist in the development, planning and launch and marketing of new Spanish-language trainings, webinars, and resources. Bilingual candidates to assist in the translation and facilitation of Spanish-language trainings and resources.Support division-wide efforts in data collection, evaluation and project planning including review of course evaluation feedback and by implementing quality assurance reviews.Support our annual Sexual Health Update Conference planning team with development of agenda and negotiations with speakers; write bios and workshop descriptions; coordinate and collect presenter materials, handouts and presentation; moderate conference sessions and panels.Monitor project and contract scopes of work, timelines and budgets as assigned.Collaborate with internal teams in the Programs + Strategic Initiatives Department to assist in the development of course content as well as training staff around best practices in public speaking and training facilitation skills.Knowledgeable in the tenants of health literacy in order to convert complex medical information into accessible and understandable content for diverse audiences.Responsible for staying up-to-date on evidence-based best practices in the field of SRH through conference and webinar attendance and regular review of journal articles and new and emerging data.Evaluate, amend and revise division-wide materials with relevant clinical updates, evidence-based approaches and new best practices as needed and on an ongoing basis.Assist with assessment of learner feedback and implementation of improvement plans to address learner needs.Complete assigned reports as required. Support marketing of programs and other LE-related services.Coordinate continuing education reporting for Certified Health Education Specialist (CHES) in conjunction with our agency Continuing Education Committee.Additional duties, as assigned.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES:To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required to perform this job.Fluent in English and Spanish (preferred).Degree (Bachelor’s or Masters) in public health, health education, nursing, or related field; or equivalent years of experience.2-3 years’ experience in the field of sexual and reproductive health or related field.2-3 years’ experience developing course materials and delivering training for adult learners.Proficient with Zoom platform (meetings, webinars, recordings, team chat, whiteboard, etc.)Experience with course authoring tools (e.g., Camtasia, Storyline, Captivate) and learning management systems for developing and hosting interactive e-learning modules.Proficiency with Microsoft (Excel, Word, Power Point) and Adobe Creative Cloud (InDesign, Photoshop, Acrobat) computer software.Experience developing, implementing and evaluating training programs for adults.Demonstrate independent decision making per scope of work.Work with culturally and linguistically diverse groups.Management of meeting logistics.Ability to create positive working relationships.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Ability to work independently and/or in a team setting.Excellent organizational skills and adept at working on multiple projects.CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS:A current California Driver’s License, current registration and current automobile insurance coverage is required if you drive on company business. Certified Health Education Specialist (CHES) certified applicant preferred.Company DescriptionAbout Essential Access HealthMission: Essential Access Health champions and promotes quality sexual + reproductive health care for allEssential Access Health (Essential Access) achieves its mission and advances health equity through a wide range of programs and services including clinic support initiatives, provider training, advanced clinical research, advocacy, and public awareness campaigns. Essential Access operates the Title X federal family planning program in California and Hawai'i and serves as the lead fiscal and program administrator for state-supported funding streams that support access to abortion and birth control for individuals with low-incomes seeking these essential services in California.Commitment to Equity, Diversity, Justice + InclusionEssential Access was established in 1968, grounded in the belief that everyone has the right to access the health services and information they want – with dignity and respect. Although significant gains have been made in expanding access to essential health services over the past 50 years, true progress cannot be attained without confronting and addressing racism, advocating for equity and justice for all, including the LGBTQ+ community and individuals with disabilities. We are committed to integrating a health equity lens into our policies and broad range of programs and services and taking meaningful action to promote equitable and optimal sexual and reproductive health outcomes for all.Join UsWith offices in Northern and Southern California, our dedicated staff are leading experts in the field of sexual and reproductive health – as researchers, trainers, health care leaders, and more.About Essential Access Health Mission: Essential Access Health champions and promotes quality sexual + reproductive health care for all Essential Access Health (Essential Access) achieves its mission and advances health equity through a wide range of programs and services including clinic support initiatives, provider training, advanced clinical research, advocacy, and public awareness campaigns. Essential Access operates the Title X federal family planning program in California and Hawai'i and serves as the lead fiscal and program administrator for state-supported funding streams that support access to abortion and birth control for individuals with low-incomes seeking these essential services in California. Commitment to Equity, Diversity, Justice + Inclusion Essential Access was established in 1968, grounded in the belief that everyone has the right to access the health services and information they want – with dignity and respect. Although significant gains have been made in expanding access to essential health services over the past 50 years, true progress cannot be attained without confronting and addressing racism, advocating for equity and justice for all, including the LGBTQ+ community and individuals with disabilities. We are committed to integrating a health equity lens into our policies and broad range of programs and services and taking meaningful action to promote equitable and optimal sexual and reproductive health outcomes for all. Join Us With offices in Northern and Southern California, our dedicated staff are leading experts in the field of sexual and reproductive health – as researchers, trainers, health care leaders, and more.

job_description: Director, People Success Partner (HRBP)Toast is driven by building the restaurant platform that helps restaurants adapt, take control, and get back to what they do best: building the businesses they love.Bready* to make a change?People Success Partners (PSPs) are at the intersection of business strategy and talent strategy, – they influence, design and execute organizational and talent solutions in order to drive business outcomes with Toast’s senior leaders. Engaging as trusted advisors to (generally) Sr. Director+ leaders, PSPs leverage HR expertise to advance organizational health engagement and performance, management capability, and equitable and effective people strategies. PSPs are impact-driven individuals and strong partners to People Team peers and to the business. They are able to boil down complexity and ambiguity to create simplicity and clarity, and they lead the way on organizational transformation.About thisroll* (Responsibilities)Partner directly with the Chief Revenue Officer and their respective leadership teams to design and implement value-led talent strategies that help achieve business goals.Build trusted relationships with senior leaders, providing individual and team executive coaching, feedback and advice that strengthen high performing teams.Lead with strong business acumen to design people-centered talent solutions and strategies that drive business outcomes.Lead the development and execution of talent management processes for Toast’s Revenue team such as performance and talent reviews, succession planning, strategic geo/site planning, commission planning, and engagement exercises in partnership with COEs.Drive organizational effectiveness and business outcomes through healthy organizational design, change leadership, executive coaching, and orchestrating talent solutions.Leverage quantitative and qualitative people trends, insights, and data to build and implement talent-related strategies, solutions, projects and programs.Collaborate with all areas of the People organization to deliver an aligned, effective people-centric approach to the business.Act as a culture mirror and truth teller for the organization, helping leaders build and foster organizational culture that aligns with Toast Values.Ensure policies, practices, and programs are administered in an equitable and consistent manner.Roll sleeves up with willingness to balance strategy with execution given where Toast is in our People Team model evolution.Do you have the right ingredients*? (Requirements)Proven ability to coach, partner with, and influence executive leadership, including at founder-led companyDemonstrated success performing in a high-growth organization with multiple stakeholders, each with varying needsExceptional experience leading change globally and at scale, comfortable managing ambiguity.Demonstrated ability to show excellent judgment, creative problem-solving, and training/coachingWillingness to help build – exemplify future state, build on foundation, and bring others along as we continue to evolve our People Team model.Strong teamwork, communication & cross-functional collaboration skillsAbility to influence and lead through complex/matrix organizational structuresOrganizational design & development expertiseStrong DEI-QCourageous communication and truth tellingSolid understanding of HR practices, policies, and employment lawStrong experience in performance management and people strategyBachelor’s degree in an HR-related field and/or HR certification preferredExperience working in the Technology/SaaS industry is a plusOurSpread*of Total RewardsFlexible Time OffSabbatical opportunity after five yearsProfessional Development Reimbursement ProgramCommitment to Employee Wellness through resources such as a quarterly Wellness StipendVarious peer and company recognition programs401(k) and matchingMedical, Dental, & Vision CoverageMental Health BenefitsSubsidized backup childcareBread puns encouraged but not requiredOur Spread* of Total RewardsWe strive to provide competitive compensation and benefits programs that help to attract, retain, and motivate the best and brightest people in our industry. Our total rewards package goes beyond great earnings potential and provides the means to a healthy lifestyle with the flexibility to meet Toasters’ changing needs. Learn more about our benefits at https://careers.toasttab.com/toast-benefits.The base salary range for this role is listed below. The starting salary will be determined based on skills and experience. In addition to base salary, our total rewards components include cash compensation (overtime, bonus/commissions if eligible), equity, and benefits.Pay Range$188,000—$301,000 USDWe are ToastersDiversity, Equity, and Inclusion is Baked into our Recipe for Success.At Toast our employees are our secret ingredient. When they are powered to succeed, Toast succeeds.The restaurant industry is one of the most diverse industries. We embrace and are excited by this diversity, believing that only through authenticity, inclusivity, high standards of respect and trust, and leading with humility will we be able to achieve our goals.Baking inclusive principles into our company and diversity into our design provides equitable opportunities for all and enhances our ability to be first in class in all aspects of our industry.Bready* to make a change? Apply today!Toast is committed to creating an accessible and inclusive hiring process. As part of this commitment, we strive to provide reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities to enable them to access the hiring process. If you need an accommodation to access the job application or interview process, please contact candidateaccommodations@toasttab.com.
about_sum: Director, People Success Partner (HRBP) Toast is a restaurant platform that helps restaurants adapt, take control, and get back to what they do best: building the businesses they love. Toast is committed to creating an inclusive and accessible hiring process.

job_description: About UsPepper Foster Consulting is a strategy and project execution consulting firm headquartered in Portland, OR, with offices in Portland; Minneapolis-St. Paul, Minnesota; Atlanta, Georgia; and an M&A practice. We are a values-driven firm with a focus on utilizing local people for local work while also having the ability to provide services coast to coast in the United States internationally as needed. We specialize in helping our clients turn their ideas and concepts into transformative realities, and we exist to make a difference - for our clients, our people, and our communities. Founded in 2015, our consultants have been trusted to advise, elaborate, and lead the strategy, analysis, and execution of a host of mission-critical initiatives and projects for our clients.DEI Vision StatementPepper Foster recognizes that diversity, equity and inclusion extends but is not limited to culture, race, religion, veterans, gender, sexual orientation and physical ability. We are inspired by the unique communities where we live and work, and embrace diversity as vital to the health of our organization. We are driven by relentless curiosity and a strong desire to educate ourselves, build awareness and encourage continuous learning. We strive to provide a culture that is open, compassionate and respectful of all people.The Position:Operations ManagerTo support our growth as one of the Inc 5000 fastest growing companies in America, we are creating the new position of Operations Manager.You’ll be part of the HQ team and work directly with the founder and CEO of Pepper Foster Consulting and our executive leadership team to manage and execute our day-to-day operations and critical back office functions.This is a hands-on, multifaceted role where you will be responsible for invoicing, bookkeeping, financial reporting, payroll, new employee onboarding, HR and benefits administration, website and marketing administration, new laptop setup, and administering our Google, Microsoft, SalesForce, Employee Navigator, and Bamboo IT systems.You will be an invaluable and integral part of the team, at the center of everything, and probably the first person people go to when they need help or have a question.You’ll get to experience and grow your skills in just about all of the critical back office functions of a business including Marketing, IT, HR, Finance, Payroll, Employee Growth & Development, and Training.As the company grows, so will the operations functions, providing you with opportunities to grow your career; maybe by focusing on one of the functional areas like HR, IT, Finance or Marketing; or maybe by staying in a multifaceted operations role that could one day lead to you becoming a CAO or COO.The Person:Fun, Smart, Collaborative, Detail-Oriented, Flexible, DedicatedMinimum RequirementsYou have at least 2 years of professional experience in a similar multifaceted role within a professional office environment.Experience with bookkeeping, payroll, benefits, marketing, and/or IT administration is a big plus.Located in the greater Portland area or willing to relocateMust be authorized to work in the US without sponsorshipPreferred QualificationsYou are fun, smart, honest, passionate, collaborative, humble, thoughtful, flexible, confident, generous, inspiring, great, and happy.You are naturally detail-oriented and have high standards for the quality and accuracy of your work.You are a fast learner and enjoy figuring stuff out, getting stuff done, and tackling a wide variety of tasks.You relish tracking down and fixing problems, working out how to make something work in a system or process, or fit and look good on a website, and sometimes, you lose track of time when you’re writing copy, creating spreadsheets, developing reports, making graphics, or updating websites.You are ambitious and keen to grow your career and understand that you have to build your skills and abilities and prove that you have the right stuff to move ahead.You naturally look for ways to improve things, streamlining processes and creating reusable templates to make your work easier and more efficient.You care about how things are received and look and take pride in making sure your work is received well, looks great, and is of the highest quality it can be.You have a natural eye for design and are a great communicator with a writing style that is easily consumed by all and inspires curiosity, interest, and confidence.You are flexible and comfortable being uncomfortable, enjoy helping people, and your energy is contagious.The Opportunity:To grow your skills and career at a forward-thinking and rapidly growing firm, working with great people who enjoy making a differenceThe reason you’ll join the Pepper Foster team (apart from the fact that we’re awesome) is that you’ll gain visibility into and experience in all of the critical back office functions of a business.You’ll be able to grow your skills in a wide variety of functions, work out what you enjoy the most, and take your career forward in a host of different ways.Your role will be what keeps the company moving forward and, as a result, you will be at the center of everything. You will get to work directly with and learn from senior leadership and the whole team.You’ll be joining a firm that has an amazing culture, great team, celebrated leadership, and a vision for one day being one of the largest and most important companies of the 21st century.Benefits of Working for PFCHealth, Dental, and Vision InsuranceLife & Disability InsuranceFlexible Paid Time Off8 Flexible HolidaysPaid Volunteer TimeAnnual Performance BonusFSA Plan401(k) Plan with Employer ContributionCell Phone ReimbursementPaid Parental Leave & Adoption BenefitStock OptionsProfit Share Points$2,500 Annual Professional Development per EmployeeAll Expenses Paid Annual Retreat + Monthly Social ActivitiesBase Salary Range$65,000-$85,000/AnnuallyPepper Foster Consulting is an equal opportunity employer. provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.

No guarantee of immediate placement, and we only consider applications from US/Canada residents during the application process.Hiring Type:Full-TimeBase Salary:$57K-$67K Per Annum.Responsibilities:Develop and implement high-quality, scalable, and maintainable React components for our web applications.Collaborate with the development team to translate design mock-ups into functional features.Participate in code reviews and provide constructive feedback to enhance the overall code quality.Debug and resolve software defects and issues.Stay updated with the latest industry trends and best practices in front-end development.Requirements:Proficiency in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.Strong understanding of React and its ecosystem.Experience working with RESTful APIs and integrating backend services.Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git).Good problem-solving and analytical skills.Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.Ability to learn quickly and adapt to new technologies and frameworks.

job_description: A Goldman Sachs | Everstone company, Cprime is a global consulting firm helping transforming businesses get in sync. Cprime is the partner of choice for Fortune 100 companies looking to achieve value and agility. We help visionary business leaders compose solutions, execute implementations, and exceed against business goals. With our key partnership recognitions, including Atlassian Platinum, AWS Advanced, and SAFe Gold partner, our industry-leading software and services work in synergy to deliver transformations. Cprime is headquartered in Cary, North Carolina with offices in Chicago, Philadelphia, and Leeds, UK. We are growing our global footprint in Canada, the United Kingdom, Ukraine, EMEA, India, and Australia.Cprime US has adopted a remote-first/full-remote work environment from most US-based locations. Occasionally, our teams have the option to meet in-person for team meetings, collaboration, or social events.Notice Of E-Verify ParticipationThis employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. If E-Verify cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, this employer is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so you can begin to resolve the issue before the employer can take any action against you, including terminating your employment. Employers can only use E-Verify once you have accepted a job offer and completed the Form I-9. E-Verify Works for Everyone For more information on E-Verify, or if you believe that your employer has violated its E-Verify responsibilities, please contact DHS.Right To Work NoticeIf you have the skills, experience, and legal right to work, your citizenship or immigration status shouldn’t get in the way. Neither should the place you were born or another aspect of your national origin. A part of U.S. immigration laws protects legally-authorized workers from discrimination based on their citizenship status and national origin. You can read this law at 8 U.S.C.1324b. The Immigrant and Employee Rights Section (IER) may be able to help if an employer treats you unfairly in violation of this law. The law that IER enforces is 8 U.S.C.1324b. The regulations for this law are at 28 C.F.R. Part 44. Call IER if an employer: Does not hire you or fires you because of your national origin or citizenship status (this may violate a part of the law at 8 U.S.C.1324b(a)(1)) Treats you unfairly while checking your right to work in the U.S., including while completing the Form I-9 or using E-Verify (this may violate the law at 8 U.S.C.1324b(a)(1) or (a)(6)) Retaliates against you because you are speaking up for your right to work as protected by this law (the law prohibits retaliation at 8 U.S.C.1324b(a)(5))We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive HR Operations Assistant to join our team. The HR Operations Assistant will support our HR department in various administrative tasks and ensure smooth day-to-day operations.We are looking for someone who lives in the US will be able to work remotely from the US Central time zone.What You Will DoMaintain employee records and ensure all information is accurate and up to data in all HR systemsCoordinate new employee onboarding activities, including paperwork, orientation sessions, and compliance trainingAssist with employee offboarding procedures, including exit interviews and paperwork.Handle administrative tasks related to payroll processing, benefits administration, and employee inquiries.Maintain compliance with company policies and procedures, as well as legal regulations related to HR functions.Assist with HR projects and initiativesProvide support to HR team members as needed, including preparing reports, organizing events, and managing calendars.Ensure confidentiality and security of employee information at all times.Stay updated on HR best practices and industry trends to contribute to continuous improvement initiatives within the HR department.Qualifications And Skills1+ years(s) prior experience in an HR role or relevant administrative experienceStrong organizational skills and attention to detail.Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.Proficiency in MS Office suite and HRIS systems.Ability to handle confidential information with discretion and professionalism.Proactive problem solver with a positive attitude and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.Education And CertificationsBachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.What We Believe InAt Cprime we believe in facilitating social justice action internally, in industry, and within our communities. We believe part of our mission is to expand the minds, hearts, and opportunities of our Cprime teammates and within the broader community to include those who have been historically marginalized.Equal Employment Opportunity StatementCprime is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.Compensation at Cprime varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the role, skill set, and level of experience. As required by local law, Cprime provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in California, Colorado, New York, New Jersey, Rhode Island, or Washington as set forth above. Benefits (Salaried employees): Medical/Vision/Dental: Cprime offers plans through Cigna. Paid Holidays: Cprime provides ten (10) paid standard Holidays. Paid Time Off or Vacation: Cprime provides up to seventeen (19) days of paid time off per year (to be used for both vacation and/or sick time). Parental Leave: Cprime provides four (4) weeks of paid parental leave if certain eligibility requirements are met. Retirement Plans: Cprime offers the opportunity to participate in our 401(K) plan. Employees are eligible to enroll thirty (30) days after their official start date. A company match may be offered annually on a discretionary basis if certain eligibility requirements are met. Other Compensation: Our bonus programs reward our people for their achievements and their contributions to our business. Cprime provides a monthly cell phone stipend and an annual health and wellness stipend to all full-time employees. Benefits (Hourly employees): Medical/Vision/Dental: Cprime offers plans through Cigna. Sick Leave: Cprime provides the statutory required sick leave depending on the state of residence. Retirement Plans: Cprime offers the opportunity to participate in our 401(K) plan. Employees are eligible to enroll thirty (30) days after their official start date.

We always strive to hire the best employees and empower our team-members to be driven and enabled to succeed.Position: Customer Service Manager - AtlantaSummary:This role is pivotal in managing and supporting our portfolio of existing and newly onboarded customer accounts, with a keen focus on the hospitality sector. Monitor industry trends to keep the service offering competitive.Quality Assurance and Performance Metrics: Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) for the customer service team to ensure high standards of service are consistently met. Implement quality assurance practices to identify areas for improvement and celebrate successes.Conflict Resolution and Escalation Management: Serve as the point of escalation for complex customer issues or complaints, demonstrating problem-solving leadership to achieve resolutions that align with company values and customer satisfaction goals.Budget Management and Resource Allocation: Oversee the customer service department’s budget, ensuring optimal allocation of resources to meet operational needs while achieving financial objectives.Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with other departments (e.g., Sales, Marketing, Product Development) to ensure a cohesive customer journey and leverage insights from customer feedback to drive product and service improvements.Training and Onboarding: Oversee the training and onboarding of new customer service team members, ensuring they are fully equipped with the necessary knowledge and skills to excel in their roles.Change Management: Lead change management initiatives within the customer service department, ensuring changes are smoothly implemented and that the team remains adaptable and responsive to business needs.Employee Engagement: Actively work to maintain high levels of team engagement and morale. Implement initiatives to promote a positive work environment and recognize outstanding team achievements.Customer Relationship Management: Take an active role in managing key customer accounts, building and maintaining strong relationships with strategic partners and stakeholders to ensure long-term customer loyalty and satisfaction.Experience/Skills:Exceptional Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to clearly convey information and effectively negotiate and persuade when necessary.Analytical Thinking: Ability to analyze data, understand trends, and make data-driven decisions to improve customer service performance and strategy.Customer-Centric Mindset: Deep commitment to understanding and meeting customer needs, with a focus on creating exceptional customer experiences.Leadership and Team Building: Proven ability to inspire, motivate, and lead a team, fostering an environment of growth, accountability, and support.Adaptability and Resilience: Comfortable with change and ambiguity, able to lead teams through transitions and challenges with a positive and solution-focused approach.Organizational and Time Management: Excellent organizational skills, with the capacity to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively in a fast-paced environment.Emotional Intelligence: High level of emotional intelligence, with the ability to build strong relationships, empathize with team members and customers, and manage interpersonal dynamics effectively.Experience: 3-5 years in a customer service management role. job_description: Job DescriptionOur client is an established and fast-growing global manufacturer of hydraulic accessories serving various industries in which hydraulic equipment is used (construction, agriculture, manufacturing, industrial, etc.). The Company offers an extensive product portfolio including ready-to-install standard products and custom applications for end users, as well as a strong OEM business. Our client maintains an extensive global presence with over 40 subsidiaries across five continents and more than 5,000 employees.TH Bender has been retained to search for a sales-focused, hands-on, proactive CEO to lead the US subsidiary, directing all aspects of the company’s activities in the USA, including sales, business development, and key account management, as well as corporate development and operations.The location of this role is in the Houston, TX-area.Key Responsibilities:Provide leadership and vision to the US organization and participate in the development and execution of mid- and long-term plans.Review the existing sales and organizational structure; develop and refine processes and structures to increase the company’s market share, sales revenue, and profitability.Drive sales and strategic targeting of key markets and clients and leverage existing connections in the industry for business growth opportunities.Actively engage in the acquisition of new key customers while maintaining relationships with existing clients and partners.Initiate, lead, and manage the implementation of action plans to grow existing markets and penetrate new markets.Effectively manage the U.S. subsidiary’s P&L and provide guidance and leadership to the US team.Promote effective communication on all levels of the organization and regularly evaluate processes to drive improvement initiatives.Maintain a positive team-based environment to achieve optimum results. Ensure efficiency, quality, service, and cost-effective management of resources.Interface regularly with the global headquarters and its international channels and cooperate closely with the colleagues of the global sales management team.Represent the organization in important external business relationships with major clients, joint venture partners, and the public.Support and participate in local and global trade fairs, conferences, etc.Perform other duties as assigned.Key Qualifications:Several years of leadership experience in sales management, business development and/or key account management coupled with a general management capacity.An extensive background or experience in the hydraulics industry (or related) is required, ideally with suppliers of hydraulic accessories.Strong knowledge of the targeted markets and applications and an existing network of industry contacts in relevant industries would be desirable.Excellent sales-related skills set, including knowledge of sales process, ability to develop and execute effective sales strategiesProven track record managing a branch, business unit, group or company with P&L responsibility, ideally within a medium-sized organization.Show success in maintaining and establishing new business, negotiating contracts, and closing deals.Direct experience working across diverse business cultures with previous experience working for foreign-owned companies is considered a clear advantage.
about_sum: Sales-focused, hands-on, proactive CEO to lead the US subsidiary. Responsible for all aspects of the company’s activities in the USA.

job_description: About us:Welcome to the heartbeat of Echelon Fitness, where we're not just raising the bar; we're rewriting the entire fitness playbook. job_description: A US-based company is recruiting for the position of Senior Vice President Field Operations.The Senior Vice President Field Operations, a senior executive role, oversees the day-to-day operations of a company, ensuring its overall efficiency and effectiveness.Operational Leadership: Senior Vice President Field Operations is responsible for providing strategic leadership and direction to all operational departments within the organization, including production, sales, marketing, finance, human resources, and logistics. They oversee the execution of operational plans and ensure that goals and objectives are achieved.Process Optimization: Senior Vice President Field Operations identifies opportunities for process improvement and implements strategies to enhance operational efficiency. This includes streamlining workflows, eliminating bottlenecks, reducing costs, and implementing best practices to drive productivity and quality.Performance Monitoring: Senior Vice President Field Operations establishes key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to measure the performance of various operational areas. They regularly monitor and analyze these metrics to assess the company's overall performance and make data-driven decisions to optimize operations.Strategic Planning: Working closely with the Senior Vice President Field Operations and other executives, the Senior Vice President Field Operations participates in the development and execution of the company's strategic plans and initiatives. They provide input on operational feasibility, scalability, and resource allocation to support the company's growth objectives.Cross-Functional Collaboration: Senior Vice President Field Operations fosters collaboration and alignment across different departments and functions within the organization. They work closely with other senior leaders to ensure seamless coordination and integration of operational activities, promoting a unified approach to achieving organizational goals.Risk Management: Senior Vice President Field Operations identifies and manages operational risks and develops strategies to mitigate potential threats to the company's operations. They establish robust internal controls, compliance processes, and contingency plans to ensure business continuity.Team Management: The senior Vice President Field Operations is responsible for building and leading a high-performing operational team. They recruit, train, mentor, and evaluate team members, promoting a culture of excellence, collaboration, and continuous improvement.Stakeholder Management: Senior Vice President Field Operations interacts with various stakeholders, including board members, investors, clients, suppliers, and regulatory bodies. They represent the company in external forums and build strong relationships to support the organization's strategic objectives.Overall, the Senior Vice President Field Operations plays a critical role in overseeing the operational aspects of a company, driving efficiency, and ensuring that all functions work together harmoniously to achieve the organization's goals.
about_sum: The Senior Vice President Field Operations oversees the day-to-day operations of a company. They are responsible for providing strategic leadership and direction to all operational departments. They oversee the execution of operational plans and ensure that goals and objectives are achieved.

job_description: We are inviting professionals in high-growth industries who are thinking about their next move or looking for a new opportunity to join our expanding talent pool.The F4S Talent Pool is a pilot project designed to:Help job seekers get discovered by our partners based on their anticipated hiring needs.Provide optional support and resources for job seekers in their career endeavors.Help individuals understand, and bring out the best in themselves and each other.The F4S Talent Pool process:Once you express your interest, you will be asked to complete the F4S work style assessment which measures 48 key attitudes and motivations in the context of work. On completion, you will be automatically added to our growing talent pool and contacted as new opportunities arise.About Fingerprint For Success (F4S)Backed by 20+ years of research, F4S’s revolutionary predictive analytics have achieved over 90% reliability in forecasting personal and team motivations, behaviors, and performance. Ultimately, we help people find purpose and fulfillment at work, and help build and scale high-performing teams.Keep in mind, joining our talent pool does not guarantee a job offer. We aim to balance your technical skills with the results of your F4S work style assessment to match the hiring needs of our partners.Your feedback is a gift! Write to us via: to help co-create the future of recruitment, together.Powered by JazzHROccAokLrNN
about_sum: The F4S Talent Pool is a pilot project designed to help job seekers get discovered by our partners based on their anticipated hiring needs. We are inviting professionals in high-growth industries to join our expanding talent pool.

Examples of reasonable accommodations include but are not limited to:Documents in alternate formats or read aloud to youHaving interviews in an accessible locationBeing accompanied by a service dogHaving a sign language interpreter present for the interviewA request for an accommodation will be responded to within three business days. However, non-disability related requests, such as following up on an application, will not receive a response.LinkedIn will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. job_description: Corbett Inc. is a commercial interiors consultant & manufacturers rep group for KI furniture (www.ki.com) and other top lines. We are looking to bring on a results-oriented Client Advisor who specializes in preparing client specific proposals & quotations utilizing our internal database to serve clients in the Pennsylvania, New Jersey, Delaware & New York area.Our Client Advisory team is looking for an energetic, coachable & hard-working individual to help support our Project Managers. This role will serve as an overflow utility player for our Client Advisory team to perform as efficiently as possible!Our ideal candidate will demonstrate superior customer service by combining system knowledge, sales, product & problem-solving skills to exceed customer expectations. They will also possess excellent time management & organization skills with the ability to meet important deadlines in a fast-paced environment.This individual will work cross functionally with multiple manufacturers & internal team members to ensure quotes are accurate, up to date and modified as necessary. This candidate should have strong communication skills and ability to work in a collaborative environment.Corbett Inc.’s mission is to create better learning, working & healing spaces for our clients.Desired Skills & Experience:- Bachelor's degree- Entry level position with growth opportunities- Strong attention to detail- Strong numerical skills- Enjoys a consistent daily work routine- Team player- Independently performs tasks to completion- Strong oral & written communication- Flexible work schedule- Interest in commercial interiors, design, or architecture is a plus
about_sum: Corbett Inc. is a commercial interiors consultant & manufacturers rep group for KI furniture (www.ki.com) We are looking to bring on a results-oriented Client Advisor who specializes in preparing client specific proposals & quotations.

job_description: Client OverviewOur client is a leading large-cap fund specializing in technology investments, with a primary focus on Tech-Enabled Services and Software.Position OverviewWe are seeking a talented and motivated Associate to join our client's dynamic team. The successful candidate will play a key role in evaluating potential investment opportunities, conducting due diligence, and supporting portfolio company management teams to drive value creation and achieve strategic objectives.QualificationsBachelor's degree in finance, business administration, or a related field; MBA or advanced degree preferred.3 years of experience in an M&A function at an Investment Bank or LBO experience at a Private Equity Firm.Strong financial modeling, valuation, and analytical skills, with proficiency in Excel and financial modeling software.Deep understanding of the technology industry, with specific knowledge of Tech-Enabled Services and SoftwareExcellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with senior executives and investment professionals.Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and work effectively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.Self-starter with a strong work ethic, attention to detail, and a passion for investing and technology.

job_description: SummaryJob DescriptionThis position will establish, control, and oversee the activities for Kärcher Municipal Dealer Development, Sales, Marketing and Dealer Product Training. The primary focus will be the sale of Kärcher Municipal Equipment in the assigned Area of Responsibility (APR) in the AFL Dealer Territory for Kärcher Municipal. Secondary will be the establishment of an Industrial dealer network across the United States. (Dealer Network not currently established)This position is for an individual that is looking to take their entrepreneurial expertise to a whole new level. This is a new industry for Atlanta Fork Lifts, Inc. and it creates the opportunity to build out a new business unit. It is a unique opportunity for someone that wants to create something from scratch and grow it into a thriving dealer network across the US.Job DescriptionThe position will develop and implement goals and objectives to meet strategic planning and profitable growth objectives for our company. This includes working with management on business planning, forecasting, budgeting, and expense control. This position will also assist with developing marketing material to promote equipment sales.This position will also work with Parts, Service, Rental, and Used Equipment Sales to develop a fully rounded dealership and dealer network. Dealer network will require warranty, technical support, parts support, and distribution, etc. Position will be supported locally by Atlanta Fork Lifts, Inc., and Internationally by our manufacturer, Kärcher Municipal North America (KMNA) who is headquartered in Canada, and Boston, MA.Work Experience/RequirementsBachelor’s degree in business related field preferred5+ years’ experience in Material Handling Equipment or Industrial SalesSkills·3+ years’ experience in managing/mentoring others.3+ years’ experience in managing/mentoring others.Extensive knowledge of Industrial Floor Cleaning & Street Cleaning EquipmentDemonstrate good leadership and decision-making skills.Work effectively and interact with multiple levels within our organization.Ability to read and interpret financial reports.Excellent oral and written communication, organization, and presentation skillsGood knowledge of Microsoft Business ProgramsGood driving recordAbility to work in a fast-paced environment.Competitive spiritCompany DescriptionToyota Material Handling Systems is a Family owned business that was founded in 1973. We represent Toyota Industrial Equipment, the world’s largest forklift brand. We pride ourselves on providing world-class service to our customers at four facilities in Georgia. We have been recognized by Toyota for 15 consecutive years of Service Excellence and the prestigious ASEC award for outstanding customer service facilities and customer service.Toyota Material Handling Systems is a Family owned business that was founded in 1973. We represent Toyota Industrial Equipment, the world’s largest forklift brand. We pride ourselves on providing world-class service to our customers at four facilities in Georgia. We have been recognized by Toyota for 15 consecutive years of Service Excellence and the prestigious ASEC award for outstanding customer service facilities and customer service.
about_sum: The position will establish, control, and oversee the activities for Kärcher Municipal Dealer Development, Sales, Marketing and Dealer Product Training. Secondary will be the establishment of an Industrial dealer network across the United States. The position will also assist with developing marketing material to promote equipment sales.

job_description: About us:Welcome to the heartbeat of Echelon Fitness, where we're not just raising the bar; we're rewriting the entire fitness playbook. Think of us as the rebels of the fitness worldthe ones who dare to blur the lines between sweat sessions and entertainment extravaganzas.Here at Echelon, we're more than just a company; we're a movement. Picture a team of driven individuals who eat challenges for breakfast and wash them down with a protein shake. We're the tech junkies, the fitness fanatics, the creative sparks, and the unapologetic dreamers, all converging to create something truly extraordinary.The Opportunity:Echelon is currently on the lookout for a creative director to join our team. The ideal candidate will have prior experience in a leadership role, preferably in the field of creative efficiency and will be responsible for providing strategic creative direction, designing innovative solutions that meet business goals and managing our talented creative team.Job ResponsibilitiesOverseeing all creative projects from inception to completion.Working closely with the marketing team to develop creative strategies.Leading and inspiring the creative team to deliver top-notch, detail-oriented work.Staying updated on industry trends and implementing best practices for efficiency and creativity.Coordinating directly with clients and stakeholders to capture and realize their vision and objectives.Desired Qualifications:SkillsMinimum 5 years of experience in a creative director role or similar.Bachelors degree in design, marketing, or a relevant field.Strong leadership skills, with a proven ability to manage creative teams.Excellent communication and presentation skills.Strong understanding of industry trends and creative tools.Nice-to-Haves:Experience in the energy sector.A master's degree in a relevant field.Proven ability to work with various teams across an organization.Experience working with a diverse client base.Ability to travel as needed.Powered by JazzHRPI14ba99fccb6a-26289-34023666
about_sum: Echelon Fitness is on the lookout for a creative director to join our team. The ideal candidate will have prior experience in a leadership role. The creative director will be responsible for providing strategic creative direction, designing innovative solutions and managing our talented creative team.

job_description: Job Title:Senior Talent Acquisition SpecialistPosition Type:Full-timeLocation:West Covina, CA; 5 Days on-siteSalary Range / Rate (Currency):$90k-150kJob ID#:138171Position Summary:The Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist will be responsible for designing and implementing effective recruitment strategies to attract, evaluate, and hire qualified candidates. This role requires a high level of expertise in recruitment processes, a strong network of talent and recruitment resources, and the ability to manage multiple job openings simultaneously. Retail industry experience and a strong grasp of talent identification are highly preferred.Key Responsibilities:Develop and execute innovative recruitment strategies to meet the company's staffing needs, with a strong focus on retail positions.Leverage a variety of sourcing methods including direct sourcing, social media, networking, employee referrals, job fairs, and recruitment agencies to build a pipeline of high-quality candidates.Manage the full recruitment lifecycle for at least 10 open positions at any given time, ensuring a smooth and positive experience for candidates.Work closely with hiring managers to understand their hiring needs and job specifications and provide guidance on market trends and talent acquisition best practices.Utilize strong assessment skills to screen and shortlist candidates effectively, ensuring a match with company culture and job requirements.Maintain a strong network of industry contacts, recruitment agencies, and headhunters to source passive and active candidates.Stay up to date with advancements in sourcing technologies and recruitment trends, particularly within the retail industry.Ensure compliance with all federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations throughout the recruitment process.About Us:Founded in 2009, IntelliPro stands as a global leader in talent acquisition and HR solutions. Our commitment to delivering unparalleled service to clients, fostering employee growth, and building enduring partnerships sets us apart. With a dynamic presence in the USA, China, Canada, Singapore, Philippines, UK, India, Netherlands, and Germany, we continue to lead the way in global talent solutions.IntelliPro, a global leader in connecting individuals with rewarding employment opportunities, is dedicated to understanding your career aspirations. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, IntelliPro values diversity and does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or any other legally protected group status. Moreover, our Inclusivity Commitment emphasizes embracing candidates of all abilities and ensures that our hiring and interview processes accommodate the needs of all applicants. Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusivity atCompensation: The pay offered to a successful candidate will be determined by various factors, including education, work experience, location, job responsibilities, certifications, and more. Additionally, IntelliPro provides a comprehensive benefits package, all subject to eligibility.Powered by JazzHRujmK4PIj1n

This role requires a high level of expertise in recruitment processes. Retail industry experience and a strong grasp of talent identification are highly preferred.

job_description: Help HelpRequirementsConditions of EmploymentYou must be a U.S. citizen to apply for this position.You must successfully pass a background investigation. This may include a credit check, a review of financial issues, as well as certain criminal offenses and illegal use or possession of drugs.Males born after 12/31/59 must be registered or exempt from Selective Service (see http://www.sss.gov/).One-year probationary period may be required.Must meet Time-In-Grade requirements.A pre-employment drug test will be required.If you receive a conditional offer of employment for this position, you will be required to complete an Optional Form 306, Declaration for Federal Employment, and to sign and certify the accuracy of all information in your application.DHS uses e-Verify, an Internet-based system, to confirm the eligibility of all newly hired employees to work in the United States.All Federal employees are required to have Federal salary payments made by direct deposit to a financial institution of their choosing.License required: Yes, Driver's LicensePre-employment physical required: YesThis is a non-bargaining unit position.Permanent Change of Duty Station (PCS) Expenses will not be paid.Promotion Potential: This position is at the full performance level.This position may be designated as essential personnel. Essential personnel must be able to serve during continuity of operation events without regard to declarations of unscheduled leave or government closures due to weather, protests, and acts of terrorism or lack of funding. Failure to report for or remain in this position may result in disciplinary or adverse action in accordance with applicable laws, rules, and regulations (5 U.S.C.7501-7533 and 5 CFR Part 752, as applicable).This position is subject to random drug testing.This position may require the incumbent to be reassigned to a different geographic location. Accordingly, the incumbent will be required to sign a mobility agreement, which will remain in effect while assigned to this position as a criminal investigator.Incumbent must possess and maintain a valid motor vehicle operator's license. Motor vehicles must be driven and managed in accordance with the Office of Personnel Management (OPM) and Federal Protective Service, (FPS) policies and guidance.QualificationsApplicants must demonstrate the specialized experience requirement below.Specialized ExperienceGS-12:Applicant must have at least one full year of specialized experience comparable in scope and responsibility to the GS-11 level in the Federal service (obtained in either the public or private sectors) performing the following duties:Using investigative techniques such as electronic surveillance and monitoring, interrogation, polygraph examinations, physical and technical surveillance, documentary searches and/or cultivation and use of informants to carry out investigations;Utilizing law enforcement databases to conduct mandatory searches on subjects under investigation;Participating with local state and federal law enforcement officials to ensure exchange of accurate crime data and related information; andPreparing reports on internal affairs investigations to inform management on findings.NOTE: Your resume must explicitly indicate how you meet this requirement, otherwise you will be found ineligible.Only the first five pages of your resume will be used to make an eligibility/qualifications determination.Time-in-Grade Requirements:Under competitive merit promotion procedures, any individual who is currently holding, or who has held within the previous 52 weeks, a General Schedule position under a non-temporary appointment in the competitive or excepted service, must meet "time-in-grade" requirements (have served 52 weeks at the next lower grade of the grade for which you are applying). Time-In-Grade requirements also apply to current employees applying for a Veterans Employment Opportunities Act of 1998 (VEOA) appointment.NOTE: All current or former Federal employees must provide a copy of their SF-50 (you may need to submit more than one), "Notice of Personnel Action" that indicates proof of status and time-in-grade eligibility. The SF-50 must include your position, title, series, grade, step, tenure (1 or 2), and type of service (Competitive or Excepted).All qualification requirements must be met by the closing date of this announcement. Qualification claims will be subject to verification.NOTE:Experience refers to paid and unpaid experience, including volunteer work done through National Service programs (e.g., Peace Corps, AmeriCorps) and other organizations (e.g., professional; philanthropic; religious; spiritual; community, student, social). Volunteer work helps build critical competencies, knowledge, and skills and can provide valuable training and experience that translates directly to paid employment. You will receive credit for all qualifying experience, including volunteer experience.Additional Conditions Of EmploymentLaw Enforcement Availability Pay (LEAP): Incumbent is subject to work unscheduled duty hours and must be available for unscheduled duty based upon the needs of the agency. Therefore, the incumbent is eligible for Law Enforcement Availability Pay (LEAP) of an additional 25% and is subject to the provisions of the LEAP Act of 1994.Firearms Requirement: The incumbent must carry firearms and maintain proficiency in their care and use in accordance with FPS policy and standards.Lautenberg Amendment: This position is covered by the 1996 Lautenberg Amendment to the Gun Control Act of 1968. Persons convicted of a misdemeanor or felony crime of domestic violence are not eligible for the position.Training Requirement: Incumbent must successfully complete the Federal Law Enforcement Training Center's Criminal Investigator Training Program, or its equivalent.Medical: The person selected for this position must be determined physically fit by an authorized government physician to perform strenuous and physically demanding duties. This position may be subject to periodic incumbent examinations in the future.Age Requirement: There is a maximum entry age of the day before your 37th birthday (except for veterans' preference eligible) for entry into law enforcement officer positions. Applicants who have previously been employed in a Federal law enforcement officer position covered by 5 U.S.C. 8336(c) or 5 U.S.C. 84l2(d) are not restricted from applying.Medical Requirement: The duties of positions in this series require moderate to arduous physical exertion involving walking and standing, use of firearms, and exposure to inclement weather. Manual dexterity with comparatively free motion of finger, wrist, elbow, shoulder, hip, and knee joints is required. Arms, hands, legs, and feet must be sufficiently intact and functioning in order that applicants may perform the duties satisfactorily. Sufficiently good vision in each eye, with or without correction, is required to perform the duties satisfactorily. Near vision, corrective lenses permitted, must be sufficient to read printed material the size of typewritten characters. Hearing loss, as measured by an audiometer, must not exceed 35 decibels at 1000, 2000, and 3000 Hz levels. Since the duties of these positions are exacting and responsible, and involve activities under trying conditions, applicants must possess emotional and mental stability. Any physical condition that would cause the applicant to be a hazard to himself/herself, or others is disqualifying.EducationAdditional InformationNote: DHS continues to take necessary steps to keep our workforce safe amid the COVID-19 pandemic. If you receive a final job offer to onboard, please complete the onboarding forms and submit them electronically in an expeditious manner. Your start date may be delayed if the action above is not completed.Background Investigation:To ensure the accomplishment of its mission, the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) requires every employee to be reliable and trustworthy. To meet those standards, all selected applicants must undergo and successfully complete a background investigation for a Top Secret/SCI clearance as a condition of placement in this Special Sensitive position. This review includes financial issues such as delinquency in the payment of debts, child support and/or tax obligations, as well as certain criminal offenses and illegal use or possession of drugs.Pursuant to Executive Order 12654 and DHS policy, DHS is committed to maintaining a drug-free workplace and, therefore, conducts random and other drug testing of its employees in order to ensure a safe and healthy work environment. Headquarters personnel in safety- or security-sensitive positions are subject to random drug testing and all applicants tentatively selected for employment at DHS Headquarters are subject to drug testing resulting in a negative test result.Current or Former Political Appointees: The Office of Personnel Management (OPM) must authorize employment offers made to current or former political appointees. If you are currently, or have been within the last 5 years, a political Schedule A, Schedule C, Non-career SES or Presidential Appointee employee in the Executive Branch, you must disclose this information to the Human Resources Office.Interagency/Career Transition Assistance Program (ICTAP/CTAP):This program applies to Federal service employees whose positions have been deemed surplus or no longer needed, or employees who have been involuntarily separated from a Federal service position within the competitive service. To receive selection priority for this position, you must: 1) meet eligibility criteria for CTAP or ICTAP; 2) be rated well-qualified for the position; and 3) submit the appropriate documentation to support your CTAP or ICTAP eligibility. Well-Qualified includes those applicants whose knowledge, skills, and abilities clearly exceed the minimum qualification requirements for the position. For information on eligibility criteria and required documentation, go to: http://www.opm.gov/rif/employee_guides/career_transition.aspSelective Service:Males born after 12/31/59 must be registered or exempt from Selective Service (see http://www.sss.gov/ ).If you are unable to apply online contact Philadelphia@opm.gov.Read moreHelp Help A career with the U.S. government provides employees with a comprehensive benefits package. As a federal employee, you and your family will have access to a range of benefits that are designed to make your federal career very rewarding. Opens in a new window Learn more about federal benefits .Review our benefitsEligibility for benefits depends on the type of position you hold and whether your position is full-time, part-time or intermittent. Contact the hiring agency for more information on the specific benefits offered.
about_sum: You must be a U.S. citizen to apply for this position. Males born after 12/31/59 must be registered or exempt from Selective Service (see http://www.sss.gov/). One-year probationary period may be required. Must meet Time-In-Grade requirements. Must have at least one full year of specialized experience.
