job_description: Benefits:401(k)401(k) matchingDental insuranceFree uniformsHealth insuranceOpportunity for advancementPaid time offStock options planTraining & developmentVision insuranceBuilding Tomorrow’s SustainabilityDanimer Scientific is a pioneer in creating more sustainable, more natural ways to make plastic products. For more than a decade, our renewable and sustainable biopolymers have helped create plastic products that are biodegradable and compostable.Our technology can be found in a vast array of plastic end products that people use every day. Applications for our biopolymers include additives, aqueous coatings, fibers, filaments, films, hot-melt adhesives and injection-molded articles, among others. These products offer all the advantages of our bioplastics, including:Reduced dependency on petrochemicals.Adherence to ASTM and EN requirements for biodegradability and compostability.FDA approved for food contact.Biodegradation in a fraction of the time it takes for petro-based plastic decomposition.Virtually no carbon footprint.Danimer Scientific imagines a cleaner, healthier world: a world without the massive plastic pollution that litters our planet today. In fact, we’re doing more than imagining it. We’re creating it. Do you want to help?Mission Statement:Out of concern for the environment, Danimer Scientific provides sustainable biopolymer solutions to plastic pollution, through innovative technologies.Description:The Quality Assurance - Quality Control Microbiology Technician is involved in a variety of laboratory and manufacturing activities within the microbiological, chemical, and/or analytical areas by carrying out collecting and testing samples, measuring, recording results, and analyzing microbiological data as part of a lab serving the manufacturing process. This essential role participates in short- and long-term projects and assist in the decision-making process for fermentation, process improvement, and release of products.This position performs fermentation/microbiological quality assurance and control activities to support manufacturing and sustaining of existing products and provide critical information/support to appropriate teams in the process. They will implement proven microbiological quality methodologies to meet company requirements and ensure the integrity of product through proven best practices.Fundamental Components:Prepare various microbiological media for growing cultures and testing raw and in-process materials.Prepare micro lab samples for testing.Quality control by industrial sampling of raw material, process intermediates and finished products to be analyzed.Operate several types of laboratory equipment such as, but not limited to, pH meter, autoclave, microscope, colony counter, etc.Perform tasks according to Standard Operating Procedures.Interact with lab personnel and the quality assurance department for material issues.Maintain neat, accurate, and complete records in laboratory notebooks and on log sheets and other forms of documentation such that they are defendable through an audit.Demonstrate strong attention to detail in documentation and observations of materials.Perform other lab-related duties or tests as assigned by the immediate supervisor.Follow OSHA, HACCP, TTB guidelines and recording requirements.Required Education/Background Experience:Bachelor’s degree in a scientific field—, microbiology, biochemistry, or a closely related field preferred.Basic understanding of microbiology. and the impact that people and the environment can have on finished product results.Ability Familiar with to operate laboratory equipment proficiently (e.g., pH meter, balances, microscope, and spectrophotometer.)Proficient in laboratory documentation, and experience conducting/interpreting lab tests.Proficient in Microsoft Office Suites.Experience with administrative duties such as filing, checking and entering required information into the computer system data entry, and record keeping.Experience in keeping records, files and finished goods.Experience in effectively multi-tasking, organizing and prioritizing tasks.Knowledge of 5S or similar system.Preferred Education/Background Experience:1-2 years of experience in manufacturing environment A PLUS!Experienced in cross training for other laboratory areas, such as the product analytical lab.Experience working in a cGMP regulated environment preferred.Knowledge of 5S or similar organization system.Experience working in a cGMP regulated environment preferred.Expected Hours of Work:The plant is a 24/7/365 operation and shift, weekend and holiday work will be required. Full-time position. Must be willing to work a 12-hour shift, must be willing to work day shift or night shift including weekends and holidays. Overtime is required. (2-2-3 schedule: 2 days/nights on 2 days/nights off 3 days/nights on 2 days/nights off 2 days/night on 3 days/nights off and repeat).Percent of Travel Required:0-10%Benefit Eligibility:Medical, dental, vision, 401-K, paid vacationsWork Authorization:Must be authorized to work in the United StatesEEO Statement:Danimer Scientific provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Danimer Scientific complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.Danimer Scientific expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of Danimer Scientific’s employees to perform their job duties may result in discipline up to and including discharge.Other Duties:Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.
about_sum: The Quality Assurance - Quality Control Microbiology Technician is involved in a variety of laboratory and manufacturing activities. This essential role participates in short and long-term projects and assist in the decision-making process for fermentation, process improvement, and release of products.

job_description: Job DescriptionDuties/Responsibilities:Post-process Position/Orientation System (POS) and LIDAR dataPost-process PPK data, execute workflow processing software for point cloud, orthophoto production, data classification and volumetric analysis.Provide end-to-end customer workflow training for various GeoCue drone mapping systems and software.Must be comfortable meeting clients, discussing the technical merits of the process and the general benefits of sUAS collected data as compared to traditional methods.Must be adept with computer operations and willing to learn imagery/LIDAR point cloud data processing workflows.Operate fixed and rotary wing small Unmanned Aerial Systems (sUAS)Assist clients with developing drone mapping plans.Set control targets using GNSS equipment.Calibrate mapping cameras and LIDAR systems.Conduct drone repairs.Drive a company-supplied work truck to customer sites (drive distances can be long)This is a traveling job. Approximately 25% of the time will be spent traveling to and performing services/training at customer sites, often in inclement weather (hot, cold, rainy, etc.). The remaining time will be spent in our Huntsville, Alabama office processing and analyzing data and providing technical support to GeoCue’s global customer base.Key Experience/Skills:Experience with industry standard LIDAR, GIS, survey, and CAD software packages such as GeoCue, LP360, Civil3D, MicroStation, ArcGIS, QGIS, and Trimble Business Center is preferred.Familiarity with orthophoto production workflows and related software tools would be an asset.A degree in Engineering or Earth Sciences preferred but not required.Able to self-study to pass the FAA Part 107 UAS pilot exam (if not already qualified)Surveying experience a significant plus. Licensure is a plus but not required.College degree is a plus but not required.Basic proficiency in mathematicsHandy with on-the-spot repairsAbility to work under pressure (carrying out an sUAS flight in front of customers)Physically able to work outdoors in a wide range of weather conditions, carry photogrammetry targets, drones, and survey equipment through rough terrain, etc.Must have a valid driver's license with a clean driving record; this position is subject to random drug testing.Excellent written and verbal communication skillsMust be organized and able to take concise, readable notes as well as maintain accurate flight logs.Must be able to adhere to rigorous safety protocols.Must be able to travel internationally.Company DescriptionGeoCue is a global technology company headquartered in Huntsville, AL. It is positioned to become the US market leader in Aerial Surveying/Mapping with a very wide range of products including Microdrones fully integrated drone solutions, TrueView LiDAR payloads and LP360 software. We work with the industry’s leading companies to deploy and build scalable LiDAR and drone mapping software and hardware.GeoCue is a global technology company headquartered in Huntsville, AL. It is positioned to become the US market leader in Aerial Surveying/Mapping with a very wide range of products including Microdrones fully integrated drone solutions, TrueView LiDAR payloads and LP360 software. We work with the industry’s leading companies to deploy and build scalable LiDAR and drone mapping software and hardware.
about_sum: GeoCue is a global technology company headquartered in Huntsville, AL. It is positioned to become the US market leader in Aerial Surveying/Mapping. We work with the industry’s leading companies to deploy and build LiDAR and drone mapping software and hardware.

job_description: The Brand Manager will develop and implement both long-term and short-term strategies and tactics as agreed with the brand principles and management. The Brand Manager will generate volume building programs for the U.S. market and deliver budgeted yearly sales and profit commitments. The Brand Manager will also perform research and analysis to guide future brand development and awareness and work on developing strategic brand positioning and communication.DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIESWork with cross functional team (marketing, sales, research and development, operations, agencies, and finance) to support the development and execution of brand planAnalyze and interpret market trends, syndicated data, and consumer research to track brand performance and inform better sales and marketing team decisionsBuild brand loyalty, drive trial, and repeat purchase for new productsDevelop strategies, project creative briefs, and manage brand social media to ensure messaging and creative planning are consistent with brand strategyLeverage consumer and industry insights to develop more powerful consumer communications, brand programming, and new productsAnalyze and interpret market trends, syndicated data, and consumer research to track brand performance and inform better sales and marketing team decisionsTrack and manage the marketing budget to ensure the company hits its annual business plan goalsInteract with customers in order to influence their programming, planning, and merchandising during annual business planning processDevelop new insights into solutions that result in organizational improvementsFocus on the critical few objectives that add the most value and consistently deliver results that meet or exceed expectationsIdentify meaningful and relevant programs that will have the most impact on specific target audiences.Participate in ongoing education and professional development opportunities.· Additional duties as assigned by management.
about_sum: The Brand Manager will develop and implement both long-term and short-term strategies and tactics as agreed with the brand principles and management. The Brand manager will generate volume building programs for the U.S. market and deliver budgeted yearly sales and profit commitments.

job_description: This is a remote position.Junior Product Designer(1 year experience, remote)Be part of our future! This job posting builds our talent pool for potential future openings. We'll compare your skills and experience against both current and future needs. If there's a match, we'll contact you directly. No guarantee of immediate placement, and we only consider applications from US/Canada residents during the application process.Hiring Type:Full-TimeBase Salary:$58K-$68K Per Annum.Summary:You will work with our operations and technology teams to define and execute products that delight our members and automate our workflows.Liabilities:Conducting research with users, internal and external, to inform design decisionsCollaborating with PMs to balance business and user needs, from problem definition through multiple release cyclesCollaborating with Engineering to balance technical constraints with user needs to deliver polished and scalable solutionsContributing to and working within a design system to deliver consistent experiences across the design teamCredentials:1 year experience working in technology as a Product DesignerExperience shipping products with a cross-functional team of PMs and engineers, throughout all stages of product developmentStrong communication skills to articulate design decisions and drive stakeholder alignmentExperience building internal tools as well as consumer-facing experiencesComfort in a startup environment - You're adaptable to ambiguity and change and can work on more than one project at a time in a fast-paced environmentYou approach research and design with rigor and craft but can execute pragmatically to find the simplest solution.The full stack ability to uncover user needs with research, explore UX possibilities, and execute visually polished, engineering-ready designBonus: You also have experience in marketing web design

job_description: Our large, Fortune Technology client is ranked as one of the best companies to work with, in the world. As a global leader in 3D design, engineering, and entertainment software, they foster progressive culture, creativity, and a flexible work environment. They use cutting-edge technologies to keep themselves ahead of the curve. Diversity in all aspects is respected. Integrity, experience, honesty, people, humanity, and passion for excellence are some other adjectives that define this global technology leader.You will be responsible for supporting event management and execution with the goal of deepening relationships and building trust with senior customer decision makers. You will be responsible for supporting the team to deliver a memorable conversation and exceptional events/experiences. Events may be in-person or virtual, host or third party, and be of multiple formats including roundtables, hospitality experiences, executive summits and more. Work on partnering with Sales, Account Based Marketing and Content teams.Required Qualifications3 – 5 years of experience in end-to-end event project management or marketingExperience in marketing, advertising, event marketing, or executive engagement.Vendor and agency management experienceBachelor’s degree or equivalent experienceAbility to travel up to 30% and potentially on weekends.Job ResponsibilitiesWork in a fast-paced environment and execute or support multiple events with competing and ever-changing prioritiesCreate unique event experiences that communicate our key messages. Lead, influence, and collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders, with operational efficiency and a solution-oriented mindset.Perform extensive research on hospitality aspects of corporate events, such as meeting venues, hotels, restaurants, food and beverage, gifts, and transportationHelp drive event planning milestones and ongoing project management scheduleOversees production process for print and digital projects, including managing project initiation, developing effective creative briefs, and communicating status of project to business partner.Takes initiative and can provides business partners with strategic direction and recommendations based on industry best practices.Help plan international executive travel,Demonstrates understanding of marketing and event plan development processCollaborates with extended Marketing, Sales and Customer Success teams strategicallyManages budget allocation and tracking for specific events/engagementsInfuse customized, out-of-the-box ideas and solutions for events. Implement processes, standards and measurements across all events.Prepare and comply with event budgets, negotiation with vendors, and ensure payments & reconciliations take place in a timely manner.Solicit internal and external feedback and manage post event program evaluations to ensure learnings, results, ROI, and areas for improvement are effectively captured.The ideal candidate will have excellent event strategy, collaboration, communication, storytelling and budget management skills. They should be a self-starter who has demonstrated strong prioritization and project management skills and has the ability to navigate complex organizations. They should be highly energetic, adaptable, and have a proven track record of executing at a high level in fast-paced environments – all while interfacing with leadership teams and all levels at the company.
about_sum: Our large, Fortune Technology client is ranked as one of the best companies to work with, in the world. You will be responsible for supporting the team to deliver a memorable conversation and exceptional events/experiences. The ideal candidate will have excellent event strategy, collaboration, communication, storytelling and budget management skills.

job_description: We are inviting professionals in high-growth industries who are thinking about their next move or looking for a new opportunity to join our expanding talent pool.The F4S Talent Pool is a pilot project designed to:Help job seekers get discovered by our partners based on their anticipated hiring needs.Provide optional support and resources for job seekers in their career endeavors.Help individuals understand, and bring out the best in themselves and each other.The F4S Talent Pool process:Once you express your interest, you will be asked to complete the F4S work style assessment which measures 48 key attitudes and motivations in the context of work. On completion, you will be automatically added to our growing talent pool and contacted as new opportunities arise.About Fingerprint For Success (F4S)Backed by 20+ years of research, F4S’s revolutionary predictive analytics have achieved over 90% reliability in forecasting personal and team motivations, behaviors, and performance. Think of us as the rebels of the fitness worldthe ones who dare to blur the lines between sweat sessions and entertainment extravaganzas.Here at Echelon, we're more than just a company; we're a movement. job_description: About this RoleAgility Partners is looking for a qualified Scrum Master for an Enterprise leading retailer.In this role, the Scrum Master will do the following:Guide, coach and motivate the team with the goal of increasing productivity• Organize and lead Scrum ceremonies• Oversee and manage scope, timeline, quality, goals and deliverables that support business goals• Remove impediments or guide the team to remove impediments• Build a trusting and safe environment where problems can be raised without fear of blame, retribution, or being judged, with an emphasis of productive conflict resolution and problem solving• Facilitate discussions, decision making, and conflict resolution• Prepare and present reports on the progress and success• Coordinate activities with other teams across the program• Partner with and support the Product Owner• Participate in the Scrum of Scrums and partner with other Scrum Masters• Coach the team to higher levels of maturity, at a pace that is sustainable and comfortable for the team and organization• Organize and facilitate planning and coordination including release / Potentially Shippable Increments planning, iteration planning, daily stand-ups, iteration review/demos, and retrospectives• Ensure teams are held accountable to agile SDLC (Software Delivery Life Cycle) tenants and their internal working agreements including use of appropriate tools, standards and best practicesBenefits and PerksIf you have experience in an agile environment and a passion for using servant leadership to deliver amazing solutions, apply to be a part of our innovative culture built on the foundation of generations of success.Working for an organization that focuses on company culture, inclusion and diversity50% medical coverage for you and your entire family, short/long term disability and life insurance options401(k)Life InsuranceThe Ideal CandidateSkills Needed:• Scrum master experience in a complex large-scale enterprise• Experience in an agile environment in other roles; such as quality assurance, development, product owner, or as an agile coach• Proven knowledge and experience with agile software development methodologies, values, and procedures• Demonstrated leadership ability to coach and mentor the team to reach their highest potential. job_description: About The TeamThe Zillow Group Talent Management organization drives the overall strategy and execution of learning initiatives for all employees, including but not limited to onboarding programs, professional development and performance, and leadership development. Our team is a talented group of leaders, consultants, facilitators, designers, program operation leads, program managers and learning technology specialists. Together, we work to enrich the career and learning experience of our employees so they can develop personally and professionally in alignment with company goals.About The RoleThe Instructional Designer, reporting to the Delivery Team Manager as part of the Talent Management organization, partners closely with project team members, subject-matter experts, leaders, and cross-functional project teams to integrate learning solutions as the business rapidly moves forward. The Instructional Designer is a contributor to various project teams, and owns design and delivery of learning solutions to ensure our employees have an exceptional learning experience.You will get to:Apply human-centered design principles and contemporary methods of adult learning theory to design and develop high-quality, learning solutions (courses, videos, job aids, and other training resources)Collaborate with Program Managers, Program Operations Leads, trainers, and subject matter experts to understand project objectives, conduct needs analysis, and align solution documents (learning plans, instructional plans, storyboards, etc.)Design and develop assessments and evaluation strategies to measure the effectiveness of training programs and make data-driven improvementsUtilize industry-standard authoring tools, multimedia software, and AI tools to create interactive and visually appealing learning contentParticipate in cross-functional project teams to support a wide variety of business lines and create learning solutions for employees across Zillow GroupWrite observable, measurable, and relevant learning objectivesApply human-centered design principles to reimagine and improve the learner experience and enhance knowledge retentionCreate engaging learning materials, such as presentations, virtual learning solutions, learner guides, facilitator guides, leader guides and toolkits, assessments, and videosDevelop effective instructional exercises and assessments that support the desired learning outcomes and objectivesAdhere to accessibility standards and Talent Management design standardsUpdate, curate, and maintain learning contentHandle multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality training materialsStay up-to-date with industry trends and standard methodologies in learning and development, incorporating innovative approaches to enhance program effectivenessComplete small project requests that are in-scope, but do not need the support of a full project teamThis role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.In California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington the standard base pay range for this role is $81,600.00 - $130,400.00 Annually. This base pay range is specific to California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington and may not be applicable to other locations.In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location.Who you areYou show strength in Google Suite, AI tools, Articulate 360, Camtasia, Vyond, Adobe Creative Cloud, or equivalent rapid eLearning and video creation toolsYou have proficiency in audio editing using tools such as Audacity or AuditionYou have intermediate proficiency in visual design programs such as Photoshop, Dreamweaver, or IllustratorYou have intermediate experience publishing and tracking eLearning SCORM or Tin Can-compliant courses in a Learning Management SystemYou have experience creating scripts, providing voiceovers, and creating closed captions for videosYou are skilled in developing prototypes and storyboardsYou can modify vector graphics and create light artwork when necessaryYou are an exceptional collaborator who prioritizes teamworkQualificationsBachelor's degree in instructional design, education technology, or related field3 years' experience in a learning or talent development roleExcellent written and verbal communication skillsExcellent knowledge and application of adult learning theories and instructional design modelsExperience in publishing and tracking eLearning courses in a Learning Management SystemProficient in video and audio production, graphic design, and facilitating meetings in Zoom or other platformsAbility to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly evolving environmentCollaborative and entrepreneurial mentalityGet to know usZillow is reimagining real estate to make home a reality for more and more people.As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow® and its affiliates help movers find and win their home through digital solutions, first class partners, and easier buying, selling, financing and renting experiences. Millions of people visit Zillow Group sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help make it easier to move. The work we do helps people get home and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making home a reality for more and more people.Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction are supported by a deep-rooted culture of innovation, our passion to redefine the employee experience, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life, and disability coverages as well as parental leave, family benefits, retirement contributions, and paid time off. We’re also setting the standard for work experiences of the future, where our employees are supported in doing their best work and living a flexible, well-balanced life. But don’t just take our word for it. Read recent reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: the 100 Best Companies to Work For, Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index, and TIME 100 Most Influential Companies list.Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at RecruitingAccessibility@zillowgroup.com.Applicants who receive job offers from Zillow Group will be asked to sign a Proprietary Rights Agreement which includes confidentiality, intellectual property assignment, customer and employee non-solicitation, and non-competition provisions. If you are contacted for a role at Zillow Group and wish to review a copy of the Proprietary Rights Agreement prior to receiving an offer, you may request a copy from your Recruiter.

job_description: Job DescriptionGENERAL DUTIES:The Training + Design Specialist will be responsible for developing and delivering sexual and reproductive health training (both in-person and virtual) and technical assistance to health care professionals and other key stakeholders across the country; organizing and facilitating webinars on sexual and reproductive health and justice topics; designing workshops; developing new curriculum, training tools, and e-learning content; and other special projects as assigned. The Training + Design Specialist will be a member of the capacity building division of the organization (The Learning Exchange). This position is based in the organization’s Los Angeles office with a hybrid remote/in-office work schedule. The salary range for this is position $80-85kSPECIFIC DUTIES + RESPONSIBILITIES:Design, develop and deliver in-person and virtual trainings and workshops in the field of sexual and reproductive health (SRH) in both English and Spanish (preferred) for diverse internal and external audiences.Provide support for implementation of capacity building efforts (training, webinars, technical assistance etc.) through developing agendas, coordinating with partners, scheduling trainings, managing registrations, maintaining training records etc.Contribute to the design and production of training materials in English and Spanish (preferred) including participant manuals, visual aids, job aids, tool kits, videos and e-learning modules, etc.Assist in the development, planning and launch and marketing of new Spanish-language trainings, webinars, and resources. Bilingual candidates to assist in the translation and facilitation of Spanish-language trainings and resources.Support division-wide efforts in data collection, evaluation and project planning including review of course evaluation feedback and by implementing quality assurance reviews.Support our annual Sexual Health Update Conference planning team with development of agenda and negotiations with speakers; write bios and workshop descriptions; coordinate and collect presenter materials, handouts and presentation; moderate conference sessions and panels.Monitor project and contract scopes of work, timelines and budgets as assigned.Collaborate with internal teams in the Programs + Strategic Initiatives Department to assist in the development of course content as well as training staff around best practices in public speaking and training facilitation skills.Knowledgeable in the tenants of health literacy in order to convert complex medical information into accessible and understandable content for diverse audiences.Responsible for staying up-to-date on evidence-based best practices in the field of SRH through conference and webinar attendance and regular review of journal articles and new and emerging data.Evaluate, amend and revise division-wide materials with relevant clinical updates, evidence-based approaches and new best practices as needed and on an ongoing basis.Assist with assessment of learner feedback and implementation of improvement plans to address learner needs.Complete assigned reports as required. Support marketing of programs and other LE-related services.Coordinate continuing education reporting for Certified Health Education Specialist (CHES) in conjunction with our agency Continuing Education Committee.Additional duties, as assigned.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES:To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required to perform this job.Fluent in English and Spanish (preferred).Degree (Bachelor’s or Masters) in public health, health education, nursing, or related field; or equivalent years of experience.2-3 years’ experience in the field of sexual and reproductive health or related field.2-3 years’ experience developing course materials and delivering training for adult learners.Proficient with Zoom platform (meetings, webinars, recordings, team chat, whiteboard, etc.)Experience with course authoring tools (e.g., Camtasia, Storyline, Captivate) and learning management systems for developing and hosting interactive e-learning modules.Proficiency with Microsoft (Excel, Word, Power Point) and Adobe Creative Cloud (InDesign, Photoshop, Acrobat) computer software.Experience developing, implementing and evaluating training programs for adults.Demonstrate independent decision making per scope of work.Work with culturally and linguistically diverse groups.Management of meeting logistics.Ability to create positive working relationships.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Ability to work independently and/or in a team setting.Excellent organizational skills and adept at working on multiple projects.CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS:A current California Driver’s License, current registration and current automobile insurance coverage is required if you drive on company business. Certified Health Education Specialist (CHES) certified applicant preferred.Company DescriptionAbout Essential Access HealthMission: Essential Access Health champions and promotes quality sexual + reproductive health care for allEssential Access Health (Essential Access) achieves its mission and advances health equity through a wide range of programs and services including clinic support initiatives, provider training, advanced clinical research, advocacy, and public awareness campaigns. Essential Access operates the Title X federal family planning program in California and Hawai'i and serves as the lead fiscal and program administrator for state-supported funding streams that support access to abortion and birth control for individuals with low-incomes seeking these essential services in California.Commitment to Equity, Diversity, Justice + InclusionEssential Access was established in 1968, grounded in the belief that everyone has the right to access the health services and information they want – with dignity and respect. Although significant gains have been made in expanding access to essential health services over the past 50 years, true progress cannot be attained without confronting and addressing racism, advocating for equity and justice for all, including the LGBTQ+ community and individuals with disabilities. We are committed to integrating a health equity lens into our policies and broad range of programs and services and taking meaningful action to promote equitable and optimal sexual and reproductive health outcomes for all.Join UsWith offices in Northern and Southern California, our dedicated staff are leading experts in the field of sexual and reproductive health – as researchers, trainers, health care leaders, and more.About Essential Access Health Mission: Essential Access Health champions and promotes quality sexual + reproductive health care for all Essential Access Health (Essential Access) achieves its mission and advances health equity through a wide range of programs and services including clinic support initiatives, provider training, advanced clinical research, advocacy, and public awareness campaigns. Essential Access operates the Title X federal family planning program in California and Hawai'i and serves as the lead fiscal and program administrator for state-supported funding streams that support access to abortion and birth control for individuals with low-incomes seeking these essential services in California. Commitment to Equity, Diversity, Justice + Inclusion Essential Access was established in 1968, grounded in the belief that everyone has the right to access the health services and information they want – with dignity and respect. Although significant gains have been made in expanding access to essential health services over the past 50 years, true progress cannot be attained without confronting and addressing racism, advocating for equity and justice for all, including the LGBTQ+ community and individuals with disabilities. We are committed to integrating a health equity lens into our policies and broad range of programs and services and taking meaningful action to promote equitable and optimal sexual and reproductive health outcomes for all. Join Us With offices in Northern and Southern California, our dedicated staff are leading experts in the field of sexual and reproductive health – as researchers, trainers, health care leaders, and more.

job_description: A Goldman Sachs | Everstone company, Cprime is a global consulting firm helping transforming businesses get in sync. Cprime is the partner of choice for Fortune 100 companies looking to achieve value and agility. We help visionary business leaders compose solutions, execute implementations, and exceed against business goals. With our key partnership recognitions, including Atlassian Platinum, AWS Advanced, and SAFe Gold partner, our industry-leading software and services work in synergy to deliver transformations. Cprime is headquartered in Cary, North Carolina with offices in Chicago, Philadelphia, and Leeds, UK. We are growing our global footprint in Canada, the United Kingdom, Ukraine, EMEA, India, and Australia.Cprime US has adopted a remote-first/full-remote work environment from most US-based locations. Occasionally, our teams have the option to meet in-person for team meetings, collaboration, or social events.Notice Of E-Verify ParticipationThis employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S. If E-Verify cannot confirm that you are authorized to work, this employer is required to give you written instructions and an opportunity to contact Department of Homeland Security (DHS) or Social Security Administration (SSA) so you can begin to resolve the issue before the employer can take any action against you, including terminating your employment. Employers can only use E-Verify once you have accepted a job offer and completed the Form I-9. E-Verify Works for Everyone For more information on E-Verify, or if you believe that your employer has violated its E-Verify responsibilities, please contact DHS.Right To Work NoticeIf you have the skills, experience, and legal right to work, your citizenship or immigration status shouldn’t get in the way. Neither should the place you were born or another aspect of your national origin. A part of U.S. immigration laws protects legally-authorized workers from discrimination based on their citizenship status and national origin. You can read this law at 8 U.S.C.1324b. The Immigrant and Employee Rights Section (IER) may be able to help if an employer treats you unfairly in violation of this law. The law that IER enforces is 8 U.S.C.1324b. The regulations for this law are at 28 C.F.R. Part 44. Call IER if an employer: Does not hire you or fires you because of your national origin or citizenship status (this may violate a part of the law at 8 U.S.C.1324b(a)(1)) Treats you unfairly while checking your right to work in the U.S., including while completing the Form I-9 or using E-Verify (this may violate the law at 8 U.S.C.1324b(a)(1) or (a)(6)) Retaliates against you because you are speaking up for your right to work as protected by this law (the law prohibits retaliation at 8 U.S.C.1324b(a)(5))We are seeking a detail-oriented and proactive HR Operations Assistant to join our team. The HR Operations Assistant will support our HR department in various administrative tasks and ensure smooth day-to-day operations.We are looking for someone who lives in the US will be able to work remotely from the US Central time zone.What You Will DoMaintain employee records and ensure all information is accurate and up to data in all HR systemsCoordinate new employee onboarding activities, including paperwork, orientation sessions, and compliance trainingAssist with employee offboarding procedures, including exit interviews and paperwork.Handle administrative tasks related to payroll processing, benefits administration, and employee inquiries.Maintain compliance with company policies and procedures, as well as legal regulations related to HR functions.Assist with HR projects and initiativesProvide support to HR team members as needed, including preparing reports, organizing events, and managing calendars.Ensure confidentiality and security of employee information at all times.Stay updated on HR best practices and industry trends to contribute to continuous improvement initiatives within the HR department.Qualifications And Skills1+ years(s) prior experience in an HR role or relevant administrative experienceStrong organizational skills and attention to detail.Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities.Proficiency in MS Office suite and HRIS systems.Ability to handle confidential information with discretion and professionalism.Proactive problem solver with a positive attitude and ability to work in a fast-paced environment.Education And CertificationsBachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, or related field.What We Believe InAt Cprime we believe in facilitating social justice action internally, in industry, and within our communities. We believe part of our mission is to expand the minds, hearts, and opportunities of our Cprime teammates and within the broader community to include those who have been historically marginalized.Equal Employment Opportunity StatementCprime is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.Compensation at Cprime varies depending on a wide array of factors, which may include but are not limited to the role, skill set, and level of experience. As required by local law, Cprime provides a reasonable range of compensation for roles that may be hired in California, Colorado, New York, New Jersey, Rhode Island, or Washington as set forth above. Benefits (Salaried employees): Medical/Vision/Dental: Cprime offers plans through Cigna. Paid Holidays: Cprime provides ten (10) paid standard Holidays. Paid Time Off or Vacation: Cprime provides up to seventeen (19) days of paid time off per year (to be used for both vacation and/or sick time). Parental Leave: Cprime provides four (4) weeks of paid parental leave if certain eligibility requirements are met. Retirement Plans: Cprime offers the opportunity to participate in our 401(K) plan. Employees are eligible to enroll thirty (30) days after their official start date. A company match may be offered annually on a discretionary basis if certain eligibility requirements are met. Other Compensation: Our bonus programs reward our people for their achievements and their contributions to our business. Cprime provides a monthly cell phone stipend and an annual health and wellness stipend to all full-time employees. Benefits (Hourly employees): Medical/Vision/Dental: Cprime offers plans through Cigna. Sick Leave: Cprime provides the statutory required sick leave depending on the state of residence. Retirement Plans: Cprime offers the opportunity to participate in our 401(K) plan. Employees are eligible to enroll thirty (30) days after their official start date.

job_description: M&A Development DirectorSão Paulo, BrazilOur client is a multinational company specialized in the corporate service industry, operating worldwide. Based on innovation, ambition, and integrity, it’s an expanding company active in more than 120 countries with over 70,000 FTE´s globally.Due to their expansion, they are now looking for an M&A Development Director (job creation) who will be responsible for identifying and evaluating potential M&A targets that align with North America's strategic goals. Key responsibilities involve market screenings, strategic and financial analysis, negotiations, pre-selection processes, stakeholder management, discussion facilitation, internal collaboration, and senior management reporting.Key Responsibilities:Conduct comprehensive market screenings to identify potential M&A targets in accordance with company objectives and growth strategies.Lead the pre-selection process of potential targets through strategic fit analysis, considering factors such as market positioning, product portfolio, geographic presence, and synergies.Perform initial financial profile analysis of potential targets, including financial statements, valuation metrics, and potential risks.Initiate one-to-one negotiations with pre-selected targets, demonstrating a clear understanding of their business operations, objectives, and value propositions.Develop and maintain relationships with key stakeholders at target companies, including executives, owners, and advisors.Develop and maintain relationships with key industry associations and groups to promote continuous identification of potential M&A targetsFacilitate discussions and negotiations regarding potential acquisitions, addressing concerns, and identifying areas of alignment.Collaborate with internal teams, including legal, finance, and strategy, to assess the feasibility and implications of potential acquisitions.Prepare and present comprehensive reports and recommendations to senior management regarding potential M&A opportunities.Monitor industry trends, competitor activities, and market dynamics to identify emerging opportunities and potential threats.Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and internal policies throughout the M&A process.Manage the one-to-one M&A pipeline for North AmericaQualifications:Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Finance, Economics, or a related field; MBA or equivalent preferred.Strong understanding of financial analysis, including valuation methodologies, financial modelling, and due diligence processes.Strategic thinker with the ability to analyze complex situations, identify opportunities, and develop innovative solutions.High level of professionalism, integrity, and discretion when dealing with sensitive information.This is really a great opportunity for a driven professional that wants to be part of an ambitious organization and highly motivated team, with lots of opportunities for personal and professional growth.Location: Houston, Texas.Powered by JazzHRDXjP84O8zM

job_description: Peachtree Foods, (Our mission is built around three key points that inspire excellence in everything we do, and our commitment to that mission has driven us to become a leader in the hospitality and commercial foodservice space.To challenge the common breakfast.To create experiences with every new product we develop.To deliver what is beyond expected.No matter a person’s role in our organisation, Peachtree Foods puts its people first by providing a safe and engaging atmosphere where team members can grow professionally and personally. As employees of Peachtree Foods, we’re driven by a unifying goal: to build a company that we’re proud to be a part of by continuing to be the best at what we do. We always strive to hire the best employees and empower our team-members to be driven and enabled to succeed.Position: Customer Service Manager - AtlantaSummary:This role is pivotal in managing and supporting our portfolio of existing and newly onboarded customer accounts, with a keen focus on the hospitality sector. Responsibilities encompass the comprehensive onboarding of individual hotels, ensuring exceptional ongoing customer support, efficiently tracking and processing orders, and conducting product training and maintenance troubleshooting via phone. While the position is primarily phone-based, ensuring a high-touch, personalized experience, it strictly excludes cold-calling, as all outbound communications are directed towards our established clientele.Primary duties and responsibilities:Team Leadership and Development: Lead and inspire the customer service team, fostering a culture of excellence, accountability, and continuous improvement. Conduct regular performance reviews and identify development opportunities to enhance team skills and motivation.Strategic Planning and Execution: Develop and implement strategic plans to enhance customer service operations, including the adoption of new technologies, process improvements, and service innovation. Monitor industry trends to keep the service offering competitive.Quality Assurance and Performance Metrics: Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) for the customer service team to ensure high standards of service are consistently met. Implement quality assurance practices to identify areas for improvement and celebrate successes.Conflict Resolution and Escalation Management: Serve as the point of escalation for complex customer issues or complaints, demonstrating problem-solving leadership to achieve resolutions that align with company values and customer satisfaction goals.Budget Management and Resource Allocation: Oversee the customer service department’s budget, ensuring optimal allocation of resources to meet operational needs while achieving financial objectives.Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with other departments (e.g., Sales, Marketing, Product Development) to ensure a cohesive customer journey and leverage insights from customer feedback to drive product and service improvements.Training and Onboarding: Oversee the training and onboarding of new customer service team members, ensuring they are fully equipped with the necessary knowledge and skills to excel in their roles.Change Management: Lead change management initiatives within the customer service department, ensuring changes are smoothly implemented and that the team remains adaptable and responsive to business needs.Employee Engagement: Actively work to maintain high levels of team engagement and morale. Implement initiatives to promote a positive work environment and recognize outstanding team achievements.Customer Relationship Management: Take an active role in managing key customer accounts, building and maintaining strong relationships with strategic partners and stakeholders to ensure long-term customer loyalty and satisfaction.Experience/Skills:Exceptional Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to clearly convey information and effectively negotiate and persuade when necessary.Analytical Thinking: Ability to analyze data, understand trends, and make data-driven decisions to improve customer service performance and strategy.Customer-Centric Mindset: Deep commitment to understanding and meeting customer needs, with a focus on creating exceptional customer experiences.Leadership and Team Building: Proven ability to inspire, motivate, and lead a team, fostering an environment of growth, accountability, and support.Adaptability and Resilience: Comfortable with change and ambiguity, able to lead teams through transitions and challenges with a positive and solution-focused approach.Organizational and Time Management: Excellent organizational skills, with the capacity to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively in a fast-paced environment.Emotional Intelligence: High level of emotional intelligence, with the ability to build strong relationships, empathize with team members and customers, and manage interpersonal dynamics effectively.Experience: 3-5 years in a customer service management role. job_description: Job DescriptionOur client is an established and fast-growing global manufacturer of hydraulic accessories serving various industries in which hydraulic equipment is used (construction, agriculture, manufacturing, industrial, etc.). The Company offers an extensive product portfolio including ready-to-install standard products and custom applications for end users, as well as a strong OEM business. Our client maintains an extensive global presence with over 40 subsidiaries across five continents and more than 5,000 employees.TH Bender has been retained to search for a sales-focused, hands-on, proactive CEO to lead the US subsidiary, directing all aspects of the company’s activities in the USA, including sales, business development, and key account management, as well as corporate development and operations.The location of this role is in the Houston, TX-area.Key Responsibilities:Provide leadership and vision to the US organization and participate in the development and execution of mid- and long-term plans.Review the existing sales and organizational structure; develop and refine processes and structures to increase the company’s market share, sales revenue, and profitability.Drive sales and strategic targeting of key markets and clients and leverage existing connections in the industry for business growth opportunities.Actively engage in the acquisition of new key customers while maintaining relationships with existing clients and partners.Initiate, lead, and manage the implementation of action plans to grow existing markets and penetrate new markets.Effectively manage the U.S. subsidiary’s P&L and provide guidance and leadership to the US team.Promote effective communication on all levels of the organization and regularly evaluate processes to drive improvement initiatives.Maintain a positive team-based environment to achieve optimum results. Ensure efficiency, quality, service, and cost-effective management of resources.Interface regularly with the global headquarters and its international channels and cooperate closely with the colleagues of the global sales management team.Represent the organization in important external business relationships with major clients, joint venture partners, and the public.Support and participate in local and global trade fairs, conferences, etc.Perform other duties as assigned.Key Qualifications:Several years of leadership experience in sales management, business development and/or key account management coupled with a general management capacity.An extensive background or experience in the hydraulics industry (or related) is required, ideally with suppliers of hydraulic accessories.Strong knowledge of the targeted markets and applications and an existing network of industry contacts in relevant industries would be desirable.Excellent sales-related skills set, including knowledge of sales process, ability to develop and execute effective sales strategiesProven track record managing a branch, business unit, group or company with P&L responsibility, ideally within a medium-sized organization.Show success in maintaining and establishing new business, negotiating contracts, and closing deals.Direct experience working across diverse business cultures with previous experience working for foreign-owned companies is considered a clear advantage.
about_sum: Sales-focused, hands-on, proactive CEO to lead the US subsidiary. Responsible for all aspects of the company’s activities in the USA.

job_description: Company DescriptionLinkedIn is the world’s largest professional network, built to create economic opportunity for every member of the global workforce. Our products help people make powerful connections, discover exciting opportunities, build necessary skills, and gain valuable insights every day. We’re also committed to providing transformational opportunities for our own employees by investing in their growth. You will be responsible for helping our customers effectively engage with our solutions (Talent & Learning). communication style and content to fit the needs of different stakeholdersLeads with Solutions, not products, when making recommendations aligned to Customer objectivesSells with IntegrityDrives customer decision making by achieving shared vision and proactively considering the value props that tie all stakeholders togetherThinks commercially and applies business acumen when crafting & negotiating commercial agreementsUses data and insights to support investment recommendations or overcome customer objectionsProactively mitigates churn risk by adopting a smart, customer-centric strength of the account relationship and create account outreach strategyAgrees to joint accountability with colleagues and cross-functional teams for optimal customer successPractices humility and asks for help from colleagues when faced with a challenge or unknownIs disciplined in Territory and Account Planning, Forecasting, and Quota AttainmentFollows best practices when using CRM and other othersAbility to assess business opportunities and read prospective buyersAbility to orchestrate the closure of business with an accurate understanding of prospect needsAbility to include multiple partners and members of the company management team using competitive selling to position company products against direct and indirect competitorsSuggested Skills:Sales ProspectingBusiness Case PreparationMultithreadingInfluence at all levelsActive ListeningLinkedIn is committed to fair and equitable compensation practices.The pay range for this role is $122,000 to $175,000. job_description: SummaryJob DescriptionThis position will establish, control, and oversee the activities for Kärcher Municipal Dealer Development, Sales, Marketing and Dealer Product Training. The primary focus will be the sale of Kärcher Municipal Equipment in the assigned Area of Responsibility (APR) in the AFL Dealer Territory for Kärcher Municipal. Secondary will be the establishment of an Industrial dealer network across the United States. (Dealer Network not currently established)This position is for an individual that is looking to take their entrepreneurial expertise to a whole new level. This is a new industry for Atlanta Fork Lifts, Inc. and it creates the opportunity to build out a new business unit. It is a unique opportunity for someone that wants to create something from scratch and grow it into a thriving dealer network across the US.Job DescriptionThe position will develop and implement goals and objectives to meet strategic planning and profitable growth objectives for our company. This includes working with management on business planning, forecasting, budgeting, and expense control. This position will also assist with developing marketing material to promote equipment sales.This position will also work with Parts, Service, Rental, and Used Equipment Sales to develop a fully rounded dealership and dealer network. Dealer network will require warranty, technical support, parts support, and distribution, etc. Position will be supported locally by Atlanta Fork Lifts, Inc., and Internationally by our manufacturer, Kärcher Municipal North America (KMNA) who is headquartered in Canada, and Boston, MA.Work Experience/RequirementsBachelor’s degree in business related field preferred5+ years’ experience in Material Handling Equipment or Industrial SalesSkills·3+ years’ experience in managing/mentoring others.3+ years’ experience in managing/mentoring others.Extensive knowledge of Industrial Floor Cleaning & Street Cleaning EquipmentDemonstrate good leadership and decision-making skills.Work effectively and interact with multiple levels within our organization.Ability to read and interpret financial reports.Excellent oral and written communication, organization, and presentation skillsGood knowledge of Microsoft Business ProgramsGood driving recordAbility to work in a fast-paced environment.Competitive spiritCompany DescriptionToyota Material Handling Systems is a Family owned business that was founded in 1973. We represent Toyota Industrial Equipment, the world’s largest forklift brand. We pride ourselves on providing world-class service to our customers at four facilities in Georgia. We have been recognized by Toyota for 15 consecutive years of Service Excellence and the prestigious ASEC award for outstanding customer service facilities and customer service.Toyota Material Handling Systems is a Family owned business that was founded in 1973. We represent Toyota Industrial Equipment, the world’s largest forklift brand. We pride ourselves on providing world-class service to our customers at four facilities in Georgia. We have been recognized by Toyota for 15 consecutive years of Service Excellence and the prestigious ASEC award for outstanding customer service facilities and customer service.

job_description: Job Title:Senior Talent Acquisition SpecialistPosition Type:Full-timeLocation:West Covina, CA; 5 Days on-siteSalary Range / Rate (Currency):$90k-150kJob ID#:138171Position Summary:The Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist will be responsible for designing and implementing effective recruitment strategies to attract, evaluate, and hire qualified candidates. This role requires a high level of expertise in recruitment processes, a strong network of talent and recruitment resources, and the ability to manage multiple job openings simultaneously. Retail industry experience and a strong grasp of talent identification are highly preferred.Key Responsibilities:Develop and execute innovative recruitment strategies to meet the company's staffing needs, with a strong focus on retail positions.Leverage a variety of sourcing methods including direct sourcing, social media, networking, employee referrals, job fairs, and recruitment agencies to build a pipeline of high-quality candidates.Manage the full recruitment lifecycle for at least 10 open positions at any given time, ensuring a smooth and positive experience for candidates.Work closely with hiring managers to understand their hiring needs and job specifications and provide guidance on market trends and talent acquisition best practices.Utilize strong assessment skills to screen and shortlist candidates effectively, ensuring a match with company culture and job requirements.Maintain a strong network of industry contacts, recruitment agencies, and headhunters to source passive and active candidates.Stay up to date with advancements in sourcing technologies and recruitment trends, particularly within the retail industry.Ensure compliance with all federal, state, and local employment laws and regulations throughout the recruitment process.About Us:Founded in 2009, IntelliPro stands as a global leader in talent acquisition and HR solutions. Our commitment to delivering unparalleled service to clients, fostering employee growth, and building enduring partnerships sets us apart. With a dynamic presence in the USA, China, Canada, Singapore, Philippines, UK, India, Netherlands, and Germany, we continue to lead the way in global talent solutions.IntelliPro, a global leader in connecting individuals with rewarding employment opportunities, is dedicated to understanding your career aspirations. As an Equal Opportunity Employer, IntelliPro values diversity and does not discriminate based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, disability, or any other legally protected group status. Moreover, our Inclusivity Commitment emphasizes embracing candidates of all abilities and ensures that our hiring and interview processes accommodate the needs of all applicants. job_description: Job DescriptionVision Metering, LLC, has been in business for 33 years and has an immediate opening for a Regional Sales Manager. The company sells products and services to the Electric, Gas and Water Utilities. Vision Metering is in the Smart Grid Space with its offering of LoRa communications systems and 4G LTE/Cat M1 modems in our meters. We sell throughout the U.S., Latin America and Asia. It is an exciting time for our company and the Growth cycle can is extrordinary. Our business is growing rapidly and this is an excellent opportunity for someone motivated to excel and succeed.The Company is seeking a qualified Sales Manager capable of representing the company with its customers in 17 states. Travel is required 17 weeks per year. The Company pays all reasonable travel expenses and sales calls will only be made with an appointment. Our preference would be to have a candidate with some electrical background, but a good technical aptitude will be considered. We will provide the training necessary to be successful.The selected candidate will have an outgoing personality and be easy to talk to as this is relationship based selling. It is expected that the selected candidate will learn the products and services offered by the Vision and be able to portray this information to the customer. The position is located in York, SC which is about 45 minutes from downtown Charlotte and will be required to report to York when not traveling. This is not a remote position.The position offers a base salary of $70,000 and a 1% commission will be paid on all sales generated in that territory. Commissions are paid quarterly. The Company offers health benefits, 401K program after 6 months, all normal holidays off and two weeks vacation after one year of service. Spanish is a plus but not required.For more information about the Company, you can visit www.visionmetering.com,Vision Metering is a Veteran and Women owned business.Company DescriptionVision Metering is a dynamic fast paced Company producing products and software for the Electric, Gas & Water Industries. We have been in business for 30+ years and have always been profitable. While we are a small company, we compete with the likes of Honeywell, Itron, Landis + Gyr, Aclara, Sensus and others. These are all multinational, multi billion companies. We can move quickly to make things happen which impresses our customers. Our engineers operate with minimal direction allowing them to us their creativeness for the best interest of the Company and themselves.Vision Metering is a dynamic fast paced Company producing products and software for the Electric, Gas & Water Industries. We have been in business for 30+ years and have always been profitable. While we are a small company, we compete with the likes of Honeywell, Itron, Landis + Gyr, Aclara, Sensus and others. These are all multinational, multi billion companies. We can move quickly to make things happen which impresses our customers. Our engineers operate with minimal direction allowing them to us their creativeness for the best interest of the Company and themselves.

job_description: About The TeamThe Zillow Group Talent Management organization drives the overall strategy and execution of learning initiatives for all employees, including but not limited to onboarding programs, professional development and performance, and leadership development. Our team is a talented group of leaders, consultants, facilitators, designers, program operation leads, program managers and learning technology specialists. Together, we work to enrich the career and learning experience of our employees so they can develop personally and professionally in alignment with company goals.About The RoleThe Instructional Designer, reporting to the Delivery Team Manager as part of the Talent Management organization, partners closely with project team members, subject-matter experts, leaders, and cross-functional project teams to integrate learning solutions as the business rapidly moves forward. The Instructional Designer is a contributor to various project teams, and owns design and delivery of learning solutions to ensure our employees have an exceptional learning experience.You will get to:Apply human-centered design principles and contemporary methods of adult learning theory to design and develop high-quality, learning solutions (courses, videos, job aids, and other training resources)Collaborate with Program Managers, Program Operations Leads, trainers, and subject matter experts to understand project objectives, conduct needs analysis, and align solution documents (learning plans, instructional plans, storyboards, etc.)Design and develop assessments and evaluation strategies to measure the effectiveness of training programs and make data-driven improvementsUtilize industry-standard authoring tools, multimedia software, and AI tools to create interactive and visually appealing learning contentParticipate in cross-functional project teams to support a wide variety of business lines and create learning solutions for employees across Zillow GroupWrite observable, measurable, and relevant learning objectivesApply human-centered design principles to reimagine and improve the learner experience and enhance knowledge retentionCreate engaging learning materials, such as presentations, virtual learning solutions, learner guides, facilitator guides, leader guides and toolkits, assessments, and videosDevelop effective instructional exercises and assessments that support the desired learning outcomes and objectivesAdhere to accessibility standards and Talent Management design standardsUpdate, curate, and maintain learning contentHandle multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality training materialsStay up-to-date with industry trends and standard methodologies in learning and development, incorporating innovative approaches to enhance program effectivenessComplete small project requests that are in-scope, but do not need the support of a full project teamThis role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.In California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington the standard base pay range for this role is $81,600.00 - $130,400.00 Annually. This base pay range is specific to California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington and may not be applicable to other locations.In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location.Who you areYou show strength in Google Suite, AI tools, Articulate 360, Camtasia, Vyond, Adobe Creative Cloud, or equivalent rapid eLearning and video creation toolsYou have proficiency in audio editing using tools such as Audacity or AuditionYou have intermediate proficiency in visual design programs such as Photoshop, Dreamweaver, or IllustratorYou have intermediate experience publishing and tracking eLearning SCORM or Tin Can-compliant courses in a Learning Management SystemYou have experience creating scripts, providing voiceovers, and creating closed captions for videosYou are skilled in developing prototypes and storyboardsYou can modify vector graphics and create light artwork when necessaryYou are an exceptional collaborator who prioritizes teamworkQualificationsBachelor's degree in instructional design, education technology, or related field3 years' experience in a learning or talent development roleExcellent written and verbal communication skillsExcellent knowledge and application of adult learning theories and instructional design modelsExperience in publishing and tracking eLearning courses in a Learning Management SystemProficient in video and audio production, graphic design, and facilitating meetings in Zoom or other platformsAbility to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly evolving environmentCollaborative and entrepreneurial mentalityGet to know usZillow is reimagining real estate to make home a reality for more and more people.As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow® and its affiliates help movers find and win their home through digital solutions, first class partners, and easier buying, selling, financing and renting experiences. Millions of people visit Zillow Group sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help make it easier to move. The work we do helps people get home and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making home a reality for more and more people.Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction are supported by a deep-rooted culture of innovation, our passion to redefine the employee experience, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life, and disability coverages as well as parental leave, family benefits, retirement contributions, and paid time off. We’re also setting the standard for work experiences of the future, where our employees are supported in doing their best work and living a flexible, well-balanced life. But don’t just take our word for it. Read recent reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: the 100 Best Companies to Work For, Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index, and TIME 100 Most Influential Companies list.Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at RecruitingAccessibility@zillowgroup.com.Applicants who receive job offers from Zillow Group will be asked to sign a Proprietary Rights Agreement which includes confidentiality, intellectual property assignment, customer and employee non-solicitation, and non-competition provisions. If you are contacted for a role at Zillow Group and wish to review a copy of the Proprietary Rights Agreement prior to receiving an offer, you may request a copy from your Recruiter.
