job_description: About The TeamThe Zillow Group Talent Management organization drives the overall strategy and execution of learning initiatives for all employees, including but not limited to onboarding programs, professional development and performance, and leadership development. Our team is a talented group of leaders, consultants, facilitators, designers, program operation leads, program managers and learning technology specialists. Together, we work to enrich the career and learning experience of our employees so they can develop personally and professionally in alignment with company goals.About The RoleThe Instructional Designer, reporting to the Delivery Team Manager as part of the Talent Management organization, partners closely with project team members, subject-matter experts, leaders, and cross-functional project teams to integrate learning solutions as the business rapidly moves forward. The Instructional Designer is a contributor to various project teams, and owns design and delivery of learning solutions to ensure our employees have an exceptional learning experience.You will get to:Apply human-centered design principles and contemporary methods of adult learning theory to design and develop high-quality, learning solutions (courses, videos, job aids, and other training resources)Collaborate with Program Managers, Program Operations Leads, trainers, and subject matter experts to understand project objectives, conduct needs analysis, and align solution documents (learning plans, instructional plans, storyboards, etc.)Design and develop assessments and evaluation strategies to measure the effectiveness of training programs and make data-driven improvementsUtilize industry-standard authoring tools, multimedia software, and AI tools to create interactive and visually appealing learning contentParticipate in cross-functional project teams to support a wide variety of business lines and create learning solutions for employees across Zillow GroupWrite observable, measurable, and relevant learning objectivesApply human-centered design principles to reimagine and improve the learner experience and enhance knowledge retentionCreate engaging learning materials, such as presentations, virtual learning solutions, learner guides, facilitator guides, leader guides and toolkits, assessments, and videosDevelop effective instructional exercises and assessments that support the desired learning outcomes and objectivesAdhere to accessibility standards and Talent Management design standardsUpdate, curate, and maintain learning contentHandle multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality training materialsStay up-to-date with industry trends and standard methodologies in learning and development, incorporating innovative approaches to enhance program effectivenessComplete small project requests that are in-scope, but do not need the support of a full project teamThis role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.In California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington the standard base pay range for this role is $81,600.00 - $130,400.00 Annually. job_description: Job DescriptionGENERAL DUTIES:The Training + Design Specialist will be responsible for developing and delivering sexual and reproductive health training (both in-person and virtual) and technical assistance to health care professionals and other key stakeholders across the country; organizing and facilitating webinars on sexual and reproductive health and justice topics; designing workshops; developing new curriculum, training tools, and e-learning content; and other special projects as assigned. The Training + Design Specialist will be a member of the capacity building division of the organization (The Learning Exchange). This position is based in the organization’s Los Angeles office with a hybrid remote/in-office work schedule. The salary range for this is position $80-85kSPECIFIC DUTIES + RESPONSIBILITIES:Design, develop and deliver in-person and virtual trainings and workshops in the field of sexual and reproductive health (SRH) in both English and Spanish (preferred) for diverse internal and external audiences.Provide support for implementation of capacity building efforts (training, webinars, technical assistance etc.) through developing agendas, coordinating with partners, scheduling trainings, managing registrations, maintaining training records etc.Contribute to the design and production of training materials in English and Spanish (preferred) including participant manuals, visual aids, job aids, tool kits, videos and e-learning modules, etc.Assist in the development, planning and launch and marketing of new Spanish-language trainings, webinars, and resources. Bilingual candidates to assist in the translation and facilitation of Spanish-language trainings and resources.Support division-wide efforts in data collection, evaluation and project planning including review of course evaluation feedback and by implementing quality assurance reviews.Support our annual Sexual Health Update Conference planning team with development of agenda and negotiations with speakers; write bios and workshop descriptions; coordinate and collect presenter materials, handouts and presentation; moderate conference sessions and panels.Monitor project and contract scopes of work, timelines and budgets as assigned.Collaborate with internal teams in the Programs + Strategic Initiatives Department to assist in the development of course content as well as training staff around best practices in public speaking and training facilitation skills.Knowledgeable in the tenants of health literacy in order to convert complex medical information into accessible and understandable content for diverse audiences.Responsible for staying up-to-date on evidence-based best practices in the field of SRH through conference and webinar attendance and regular review of journal articles and new and emerging data.Evaluate, amend and revise division-wide materials with relevant clinical updates, evidence-based approaches and new best practices as needed and on an ongoing basis.Assist with assessment of learner feedback and implementation of improvement plans to address learner needs.Complete assigned reports as required. Support marketing of programs and other LE-related services.Coordinate continuing education reporting for Certified Health Education Specialist (CHES) in conjunction with our agency Continuing Education Committee.Additional duties, as assigned.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES:To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required to perform this job.Fluent in English and Spanish (preferred).Degree (Bachelor’s or Masters) in public health, health education, nursing, or related field; or equivalent years of experience.2-3 years’ experience in the field of sexual and reproductive health or related field.2-3 years’ experience developing course materials and delivering training for adult learners.Proficient with Zoom platform (meetings, webinars, recordings, team chat, whiteboard, etc.)Experience with course authoring tools (e.g., Camtasia, Storyline, Captivate) and learning management systems for developing and hosting interactive e-learning modules.Proficiency with Microsoft (Excel, Word, Power Point) and Adobe Creative Cloud (InDesign, Photoshop, Acrobat) computer software.Experience developing, implementing and evaluating training programs for adults.Demonstrate independent decision making per scope of work.Work with culturally and linguistically diverse groups.Management of meeting logistics.Ability to create positive working relationships.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Ability to work independently and/or in a team setting.Excellent organizational skills and adept at working on multiple projects.CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS:A current California Driver’s License, current registration and current automobile insurance coverage is required if you drive on company business. Certified Health Education Specialist (CHES) certified applicant preferred.Company DescriptionAbout Essential Access HealthMission: Essential Access Health champions and promotes quality sexual + reproductive health care for allEssential Access Health (Essential Access) achieves its mission and advances health equity through a wide range of programs and services including clinic support initiatives, provider training, advanced clinical research, advocacy, and public awareness campaigns. Essential Access operates the Title X federal family planning program in California and Hawai'i and serves as the lead fiscal and program administrator for state-supported funding streams that support access to abortion and birth control for individuals with low-incomes seeking these essential services in California.Commitment to Equity, Diversity, Justice + InclusionEssential Access was established in 1968, grounded in the belief that everyone has the right to access the health services and information they want – with dignity and respect. Although significant gains have been made in expanding access to essential health services over the past 50 years, true progress cannot be attained without confronting and addressing racism, advocating for equity and justice for all, including the LGBTQ+ community and individuals with disabilities. We are committed to integrating a health equity lens into our policies and broad range of programs and services and taking meaningful action to promote equitable and optimal sexual and reproductive health outcomes for all.Join UsWith offices in Northern and Southern California, our dedicated staff are leading experts in the field of sexual and reproductive health – as researchers, trainers, health care leaders, and more.About Essential Access Health Mission: Essential Access Health champions and promotes quality sexual + reproductive health care for all Essential Access Health (Essential Access) achieves its mission and advances health equity through a wide range of programs and services including clinic support initiatives, provider training, advanced clinical research, advocacy, and public awareness campaigns. Essential Access operates the Title X federal family planning program in California and Hawai'i and serves as the lead fiscal and program administrator for state-supported funding streams that support access to abortion and birth control for individuals with low-incomes seeking these essential services in California. Commitment to Equity, Diversity, Justice + Inclusion Essential Access was established in 1968, grounded in the belief that everyone has the right to access the health services and information they want – with dignity and respect. Although significant gains have been made in expanding access to essential health services over the past 50 years, true progress cannot be attained without confronting and addressing racism, advocating for equity and justice for all, including the LGBTQ+ community and individuals with disabilities. We are committed to integrating a health equity lens into our policies and broad range of programs and services and taking meaningful action to promote equitable and optimal sexual and reproductive health outcomes for all. job_description: About The TeamThe Zillow Group Talent Management organization drives the overall strategy and execution of learning initiatives for all employees, including but not limited to onboarding programs, professional development and performance, and leadership development. Our team is a talented group of leaders, consultants, facilitators, designers, program operation leads, program managers and learning technology specialists. Together, we work to enrich the career and learning experience of our employees so they can develop personally and professionally in alignment with company goals.About The RoleThe Instructional Designer, reporting to the Delivery Team Manager as part of the Talent Management organization, partners closely with project team members, subject-matter experts, leaders, and cross-functional project teams to integrate learning solutions as the business rapidly moves forward. The Instructional Designer is a contributor to various project teams, and owns design and delivery of learning solutions to ensure our employees have an exceptional learning experience.You will get to:Apply human-centered design principles and contemporary methods of adult learning theory to design and develop high-quality, learning solutions (courses, videos, job aids, and other training resources)Collaborate with Program Managers, Program Operations Leads, trainers, and subject matter experts to understand project objectives, conduct needs analysis, and align solution documents (learning plans, instructional plans, storyboards, etc.)Design and develop assessments and evaluation strategies to measure the effectiveness of training programs and make data-driven improvementsUtilize industry-standard authoring tools, multimedia software, and AI tools to create interactive and visually appealing learning contentParticipate in cross-functional project teams to support a wide variety of business lines and create learning solutions for employees across Zillow GroupWrite observable, measurable, and relevant learning objectivesApply human-centered design principles to reimagine and improve the learner experience and enhance knowledge retentionCreate engaging learning materials, such as presentations, virtual learning solutions, learner guides, facilitator guides, leader guides and toolkits, assessments, and videosDevelop effective instructional exercises and assessments that support the desired learning outcomes and objectivesAdhere to accessibility standards and Talent Management design standardsUpdate, curate, and maintain learning contentHandle multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality training materialsStay up-to-date with industry trends and standard methodologies in learning and development, incorporating innovative approaches to enhance program effectivenessComplete small project requests that are in-scope, but do not need the support of a full project teamThis role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.In California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington the standard base pay range for this role is $81,600.00 - $130,400.00 Annually. This base pay range is specific to California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington and may not be applicable to other locations.In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location.Who you areYou show strength in Google Suite, AI tools, Articulate 360, Camtasia, Vyond, Adobe Creative Cloud, or equivalent rapid eLearning and video creation toolsYou have proficiency in audio editing using tools such as Audacity or AuditionYou have intermediate proficiency in visual design programs such as Photoshop, Dreamweaver, or IllustratorYou have intermediate experience publishing and tracking eLearning SCORM or Tin Can-compliant courses in a Learning Management SystemYou have experience creating scripts, providing voiceovers, and creating closed captions for videosYou are skilled in developing prototypes and storyboardsYou can modify vector graphics and create light artwork when necessaryYou are an exceptional collaborator who prioritizes teamworkQualificationsBachelor's degree in instructional design, education technology, or related field3 years' experience in a learning or talent development roleExcellent written and verbal communication skillsExcellent knowledge and application of adult learning theories and instructional design modelsExperience in publishing and tracking eLearning courses in a Learning Management SystemProficient in video and audio production, graphic design, and facilitating meetings in Zoom or other platformsAbility to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly evolving environmentCollaborative and entrepreneurial mentalityGet to know usZillow is reimagining real estate to make home a reality for more and more people.As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow® and its affiliates help movers find and win their home through digital solutions, first class partners, and easier buying, selling, financing and renting experiences. Millions of people visit Zillow Group sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help make it easier to move. The work we do helps people get home and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making home a reality for more and more people.Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction are supported by a deep-rooted culture of innovation, our passion to redefine the employee experience, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life, and disability coverages as well as parental leave, family benefits, retirement contributions, and paid time off. We’re also setting the standard for work experiences of the future, where our employees are supported in doing their best work and living a flexible, well-balanced life. But don’t just take our word for it. Read recent reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: the 100 Best Companies to Work For, Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index, and TIME 100 Most Influential Companies list.Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at RecruitingAccessibility@zillowgroup.com.Applicants who receive job offers from Zillow Group will be asked to sign a Proprietary Rights Agreement which includes confidentiality, intellectual property assignment, customer and employee non-solicitation, and non-competition provisions. job_description: Peachtree Foods, (Our mission is built around three key points that inspire excellence in everything we do, and our commitment to that mission has driven us to become a leader in the hospitality and commercial foodservice space.To challenge the common breakfast.To create experiences with every new product we develop.To deliver what is beyond expected.No matter a person’s role in our organisation, Peachtree Foods puts its people first by providing a safe and engaging atmosphere where team members can grow professionally and personally. Foodservice and/or hospitality industry experience is favourably consideredStrong phone presence, capable of dialing multiple outbound calls (40+) per dayAbility to multi-task and prioritise your time efficiently & effectivelyCapable of being part of a small, dynamic, and fast-growing teamResults oriented and the ability to develop creative solutions to problemsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsFunctional knowledge of Microsoft Office 365Experience working with CRM platforms (Zoho or similar)Compensation:Base salary plus performance bonusHealthcare, Dental, 401kCompetitive annual leave packagePowered by JazzHR7323mG9OTo

job_description: M&A Development DirectorSão Paulo, BrazilOur client is a multinational company specialized in the corporate service industry, operating worldwide. Based on innovation, ambition, and integrity, it’s an expanding company active in more than 120 countries with over 70,000 FTE´s globally.Due to their expansion, they are now looking for an M&A Development Director (job creation) who will be responsible for identifying and evaluating potential M&A targets that align with North America's strategic goals. Key responsibilities involve market screenings, strategic and financial analysis, negotiations, pre-selection processes, stakeholder management, discussion facilitation, internal collaboration, and senior management reporting.Key Responsibilities:Conduct comprehensive market screenings to identify potential M&A targets in accordance with company objectives and growth strategies.Lead the pre-selection process of potential targets through strategic fit analysis, considering factors such as market positioning, product portfolio, geographic presence, and synergies.Perform initial financial profile analysis of potential targets, including financial statements, valuation metrics, and potential risks.Initiate one-to-one negotiations with pre-selected targets, demonstrating a clear understanding of their business operations, objectives, and value propositions.Develop and maintain relationships with key stakeholders at target companies, including executives, owners, and advisors.Develop and maintain relationships with key industry associations and groups to promote continuous identification of potential M&A targetsFacilitate discussions and negotiations regarding potential acquisitions, addressing concerns, and identifying areas of alignment.Collaborate with internal teams, including legal, finance, and strategy, to assess the feasibility and implications of potential acquisitions.Prepare and present comprehensive reports and recommendations to senior management regarding potential M&A opportunities.Monitor industry trends, competitor activities, and market dynamics to identify emerging opportunities and potential threats.Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and internal policies throughout the M&A process.Manage the one-to-one M&A pipeline for North AmericaQualifications:Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Finance, Economics, or a related field; MBA or equivalent preferred.Strong understanding of financial analysis, including valuation methodologies, financial modelling, and due diligence processes.Strategic thinker with the ability to analyze complex situations, identify opportunities, and develop innovative solutions.High level of professionalism, integrity, and discretion when dealing with sensitive information.This is really a great opportunity for a driven professional that wants to be part of an ambitious organization and highly motivated team, with lots of opportunities for personal and professional growth.Location: Houston, Texas.Powered by JazzHRDXjP84O8zM

job_description: Job DescriptionMergers & Acquisitions AnalystVital role supporting our fast-paced team with critical tasks across the entire acquisition lifecycle. As a Financial Analyst, you'll play a key role in due diligence, financial modeling, integration, and more, gaining exposure to every step of the M&A process.You should have a relevant degree and minimum of 2 years’ experience (ideally in finance, FP&A, or accounting) and possess a sharp mind, a meticulous eye for detail, and a desire to move at a fast pace and learn.In this role, you will:Build financial models for potential acquisitions. Valcourt works on commercial office buildings, high-rise residential buildings, parking garages, stadiums, hospitality buildings, and healthcare buildings.For 35 years Valcourt has grown from a small window cleaning company serving the Washington, DC area into one of the largest exterior maintenance companies in the country. We proudly serve clients from our offices in New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Maryland, Virginia, Georgia, Florida, and Texas.Valcourt Building Services works with building owners and property managers to provide preventative maintenance, repairs, safety consulting, and comprehensive building envelope restorations to extend the life of a structure and protect property value. job_description: We are inviting professionals in high-growth industries who are thinking about their next move or looking for a new opportunity to join our expanding talent pool.The F4S Talent Pool is a pilot project designed to:Help job seekers get discovered by our partners based on their anticipated hiring needs.Provide optional support and resources for job seekers in their career endeavors.Help individuals understand, and bring out the best in themselves and each other.The F4S Talent Pool process:Once you express your interest, you will be asked to complete the F4S work style assessment which measures 48 key attitudes and motivations in the context of work. On completion, you will be automatically added to our growing talent pool and contacted as new opportunities arise.About Fingerprint For Success (F4S)Backed by 20+ years of research, F4S’s revolutionary predictive analytics have achieved over 90% reliability in forecasting personal and team motivations, behaviors, and performance. job_description: Our large, Fortune Technology client is ranked as one of the best companies to work with, in the world. As a global leader in 3D design, engineering, and entertainment software, they foster progressive culture, creativity, and a flexible work environment. They use cutting-edge technologies to keep themselves ahead of the curve. Diversity in all aspects is respected. Integrity, experience, honesty, people, humanity, and passion for excellence are some other adjectives that define this global technology leader.You will be responsible for supporting event management and execution with the goal of deepening relationships and building trust with senior customer decision makers. You will be responsible for supporting the team to deliver a memorable conversation and exceptional events/experiences. Events may be in-person or virtual, host or third party, and be of multiple formats including roundtables, hospitality experiences, executive summits and more. Work on partnering with Sales, Account Based Marketing and Content teams.Required Qualifications3 – 5 years of experience in end-to-end event project management or marketingExperience in marketing, advertising, event marketing, or executive engagement.Vendor and agency management experienceBachelor’s degree or equivalent experienceAbility to travel up to 30% and potentially on weekends.Job ResponsibilitiesWork in a fast-paced environment and execute or support multiple events with competing and ever-changing prioritiesCreate unique event experiences that communicate our key messages. Lead, influence, and collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders, with operational efficiency and a solution-oriented mindset.Perform extensive research on hospitality aspects of corporate events, such as meeting venues, hotels, restaurants, food and beverage, gifts, and transportationHelp drive event planning milestones and ongoing project management scheduleOversees production process for print and digital projects, including managing project initiation, developing effective creative briefs, and communicating status of project to business partner.Takes initiative and can provides business partners with strategic direction and recommendations based on industry best practices.Help plan international executive travel,Demonstrates understanding of marketing and event plan development processCollaborates with extended Marketing, Sales and Customer Success teams strategicallyManages budget allocation and tracking for specific events/engagementsInfuse customized, out-of-the-box ideas and solutions for events. Implement processes, standards and measurements across all events.Prepare and comply with event budgets, negotiation with vendors, and ensure payments & reconciliations take place in a timely manner.Solicit internal and external feedback and manage post event program evaluations to ensure learnings, results, ROI, and areas for improvement are effectively captured.The ideal candidate will have excellent event strategy, collaboration, communication, storytelling and budget management skills. They should be a self-starter who has demonstrated strong prioritization and project management skills and has the ability to navigate complex organizations. They should be highly energetic, adaptable, and have a proven track record of executing at a high level in fast-paced environments – all while interfacing with leadership teams and all levels at the company.

reporting needed changes.Maintain employee confidence and protect payroll operations by keeping information confidential.Prepare reports by compiling summaries of earnings, taxes, deductions, leave, disability, and non-taxable wages.Determine payroll liabilities by calculating employee federal and state income, social security taxes, employer's social security, unemployment, and workers compensation payments.Liaise with HR and accounting teams to maintain payroll data, prepare reports, and ensure proper ledger entries.Cooperate with department colleagues and leaders to deal with human resources related matters.Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, HR, or a related field.1+ years of experience in payroll processing is preferred.Proficient in payroll software (e.g., ADP, QuickBooks Payroll, etc.).Knowledge of federal and state regulations.Strong work ethic and team player.High degree of professionalism.Ability to deal sensitively with confidential material.Strong interpersonal (verbal and written) communication skills.Problem-solving, and analytical skills.Organizational, multi-tasking, and prioritizing skills.About Us:Founded in 2009, IntelliPro stands as a global leader in talent acquisition and HR solutions. job_description: Peachtree Foods, (Our mission is built around three key points that inspire excellence in everything we do, and our commitment to that mission has driven us to become a leader in the hospitality and commercial foodservice space.To challenge the common breakfast.To create experiences with every new product we develop.To deliver what is beyond expected.No matter a person’s role in our organisation, Peachtree Foods puts its people first by providing a safe and engaging atmosphere where team members can grow professionally and personally. As employees of Peachtree Foods, we’re driven by a unifying goal: to build a company that we’re proud to be a part of by continuing to be the best at what we do. We always strive to hire the best employees and empower our team-members to be driven and enabled to succeed.Position: Customer Service Representative - AtlantaSummary:This role is pivotal in managing and supporting our portfolio of existing and newly onboarded customer accounts, with a keen focus on the hospitality sector. Responsibilities encompass the comprehensive onboarding of individual hotels, ensuring exceptional ongoing customer support, efficiently tracking and processing orders, and conducting product training and maintenance troubleshooting via phone. While the position is primarily phone-based, ensuring a high-touch, personalized experience, it strictly excludes cold-calling, as all outbound communications are directed towards our established clientele.Primary duties and responsibilities:Customer Relationship Management: Cultivate robust relationships with customers to foster a positive experience, ensuring high satisfaction and retention levels.CRM and Data Management: Diligently record all customer interactions and maintain comprehensive profiles using Zoho CRM and SharePoint, ensuring data accuracy and accessibility.Compliance and Consultation: Monitor customer product usage and ordering patterns to guarantee adherence to program requirements. Provide consultative support, including strategies and alternatives, to help customers meet or surpass these standards.Order Management: Oversee the complete ordering cycle — from receiving orders, scheduling daily deliveries and pickups, to invoicing and providing shipment tracking. Ensure timely coordination with the warehouse for swift shipping and delivery.Training and Support: Conduct initial product training for Food and Beverage (F&B) teams via phone or video calls. Offer troubleshooting and maintenance assistance, maintaining detailed case files in the CRM for each issue until resolution.Equipment Logistics: Manage the logistics of equipment dispatch and return, ensuring accurate tracking and completion of the process.Accounts Receivable Support: Aid in managing accounts receivable by proactively addressing overdue invoices, ensuring timely payments.Experience/Skills:3-5 years in a customer service or order management role. Foodservice and/or hospitality industry experience is favourably consideredStrong phone presence, capable of dialing multiple outbound calls (40+) per dayAbility to multi-task and prioritise your time efficiently & effectivelyCapable of being part of a small, dynamic, and fast-growing teamResults oriented and the ability to develop creative solutions to problemsExcellent verbal and written communication skillsFunctional knowledge of Microsoft Office 365Experience working with CRM platforms (Zoho or similar)Compensation:Base salary plus performance bonusHealthcare, Dental, 401kCompetitive annual leave packagePowered by JazzHR7323mG9OTo

Responsibilities encompass onboarding of individual hotels, ensuring exceptional ongoing customer support, efficiently tracking and processing orders.

job_description: About The TeamThe Zillow Group Talent Management organization drives the overall strategy and execution of learning initiatives for all employees, including but not limited to onboarding programs, professional development and performance, and leadership development. Our team is a talented group of leaders, consultants, facilitators, designers, program operation leads, program managers and learning technology specialists. Together, we work to enrich the career and learning experience of our employees so they can develop personally and professionally in alignment with company goals.About The RoleThe Instructional Designer, reporting to the Delivery Team Manager as part of the Talent Management organization, partners closely with project team members, subject-matter experts, leaders, and cross-functional project teams to integrate learning solutions as the business rapidly moves forward. The Instructional Designer is a contributor to various project teams, and owns design and delivery of learning solutions to ensure our employees have an exceptional learning experience.You will get to:Apply human-centered design principles and contemporary methods of adult learning theory to design and develop high-quality, learning solutions (courses, videos, job aids, and other training resources)Collaborate with Program Managers, Program Operations Leads, trainers, and subject matter experts to understand project objectives, conduct needs analysis, and align solution documents (learning plans, instructional plans, storyboards, etc.)Design and develop assessments and evaluation strategies to measure the effectiveness of training programs and make data-driven improvementsUtilize industry-standard authoring tools, multimedia software, and AI tools to create interactive and visually appealing learning contentParticipate in cross-functional project teams to support a wide variety of business lines and create learning solutions for employees across Zillow GroupWrite observable, measurable, and relevant learning objectivesApply human-centered design principles to reimagine and improve the learner experience and enhance knowledge retentionCreate engaging learning materials, such as presentations, virtual learning solutions, learner guides, facilitator guides, leader guides and toolkits, assessments, and videosDevelop effective instructional exercises and assessments that support the desired learning outcomes and objectivesAdhere to accessibility standards and Talent Management design standardsUpdate, curate, and maintain learning contentHandle multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality training materialsStay up-to-date with industry trends and standard methodologies in learning and development, incorporating innovative approaches to enhance program effectivenessComplete small project requests that are in-scope, but do not need the support of a full project teamThis role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.In California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington the standard base pay range for this role is $81,600.00 - $130,400.00 Annually. This base pay range is specific to California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington and may not be applicable to other locations.In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location.Who you areYou show strength in Google Suite, AI tools, Articulate 360, Camtasia, Vyond, Adobe Creative Cloud, or equivalent rapid eLearning and video creation toolsYou have proficiency in audio editing using tools such as Audacity or AuditionYou have intermediate proficiency in visual design programs such as Photoshop, Dreamweaver, or IllustratorYou have intermediate experience publishing and tracking eLearning SCORM or Tin Can-compliant courses in a Learning Management SystemYou have experience creating scripts, providing voiceovers, and creating closed captions for videosYou are skilled in developing prototypes and storyboardsYou can modify vector graphics and create light artwork when necessaryYou are an exceptional collaborator who prioritizes teamworkQualificationsBachelor's degree in instructional design, education technology, or related field3 years' experience in a learning or talent development roleExcellent written and verbal communication skillsExcellent knowledge and application of adult learning theories and instructional design modelsExperience in publishing and tracking eLearning courses in a Learning Management SystemProficient in video and audio production, graphic design, and facilitating meetings in Zoom or other platformsAbility to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly evolving environmentCollaborative and entrepreneurial mentalityGet to know usZillow is reimagining real estate to make home a reality for more and more people.As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow® and its affiliates help movers find and win their home through digital solutions, first class partners, and easier buying, selling, financing and renting experiences. Millions of people visit Zillow Group sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help make it easier to move. The work we do helps people get home and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making home a reality for more and more people.Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction are supported by a deep-rooted culture of innovation, our passion to redefine the employee experience, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life, and disability coverages as well as parental leave, family benefits, retirement contributions, and paid time off. We’re also setting the standard for work experiences of the future, where our employees are supported in doing their best work and living a flexible, well-balanced life. But don’t just take our word for it. Read recent reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: the 100 Best Companies to Work For, Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index, and TIME 100 Most Influential Companies list.Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at RecruitingAccessibility@zillowgroup.com.Applicants who receive job offers from Zillow Group will be asked to sign a Proprietary Rights Agreement which includes confidentiality, intellectual property assignment, customer and employee non-solicitation, and non-competition provisions. If you are contacted for a role at Zillow Group and wish to review a copy of the Proprietary Rights Agreement prior to receiving an offer, you may request a copy from your Recruiter.
about_sum: The Instructional Designer partners closely with project team members, subject-matter experts, leaders, and cross-functional project teams to integrate learning solutions. The Zillow Group Talent Management organization drives the overall strategy and execution of learning initiatives for all employees. This role has been categorized as a Remote position.

job_description: Job DescriptionBlueWave is hiring a Scrum Master for a leading enterprise company with headquarters in Orlando, FL 34747. As a Scrum Master, you will coach and guide teams to deliver strategic Data Products enabling an environment and team culture of trust, empathy, agility, and high standards.You will use your knowledge of people skills, agile methodology, & frameworks, coaching, partnering, and influencing to ensure that data products are delivered in a timely, productive, & collaborative manner and be accountable for agile maturity through the measurement of crucial team performance indicators.Responsibilities:Manage each project’s scope and timelinePossessing expert-level knowledge of agile practices; job_description: M&A Development DirectorSão Paulo, BrazilOur client is a multinational company specialized in the corporate service industry, operating worldwide. Based on innovation, ambition, and integrity, it’s an expanding company active in more than 120 countries with over 70,000 FTE´s globally.Due to their expansion, they are now looking for an M&A Development Director (job creation) who will be responsible for identifying and evaluating potential M&A targets that align with North America's strategic goals. Key responsibilities involve market screenings, strategic and financial analysis, negotiations, pre-selection processes, stakeholder management, discussion facilitation, internal collaboration, and senior management reporting.Key Responsibilities:Conduct comprehensive market screenings to identify potential M&A targets in accordance with company objectives and growth strategies.Lead the pre-selection process of potential targets through strategic fit analysis, considering factors such as market positioning, product portfolio, geographic presence, and synergies.Perform initial financial profile analysis of potential targets, including financial statements, valuation metrics, and potential risks.Initiate one-to-one negotiations with pre-selected targets, demonstrating a clear understanding of their business operations, objectives, and value propositions.Develop and maintain relationships with key stakeholders at target companies, including executives, owners, and advisors.Develop and maintain relationships with key industry associations and groups to promote continuous identification of potential M&A targetsFacilitate discussions and negotiations regarding potential acquisitions, addressing concerns, and identifying areas of alignment.Collaborate with internal teams, including legal, finance, and strategy, to assess the feasibility and implications of potential acquisitions.Prepare and present comprehensive reports and recommendations to senior management regarding potential M&A opportunities.Monitor industry trends, competitor activities, and market dynamics to identify emerging opportunities and potential threats.Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and internal policies throughout the M&A process.Manage the one-to-one M&A pipeline for North AmericaQualifications:Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Finance, Economics, or a related field; MBA or equivalent preferred.Strong understanding of financial analysis, including valuation methodologies, financial modelling, and due diligence processes.Strategic thinker with the ability to analyze complex situations, identify opportunities, and develop innovative solutions.High level of professionalism, integrity, and discretion when dealing with sensitive information.This is really a great opportunity for a driven professional that wants to be part of an ambitious organization and highly motivated team, with lots of opportunities for personal and professional growth.Location: Houston, Texas.Powered by JazzHRDXjP84O8zM

job_description: Peachtree Foods, (Our mission is built around three key points that inspire excellence in everything we do, and our commitment to that mission has driven us to become a leader in the hospitality and commercial foodservice space.To challenge the common breakfast.To create experiences with every new product we develop.To deliver what is beyond expected.No matter a person’s role in our organisation, Peachtree Foods puts its people first by providing a safe and engaging atmosphere where team members can grow professionally and personally. We always strive to hire the best employees and empower our team-members to be driven and enabled to succeed.Position: Customer Service Manager - AtlantaSummary:This role is pivotal in managing and supporting our portfolio of existing and newly onboarded customer accounts, with a keen focus on the hospitality sector. Responsibilities encompass the comprehensive onboarding of individual hotels, ensuring exceptional ongoing customer support, efficiently tracking and processing orders, and conducting product training and maintenance troubleshooting via phone. While the position is primarily phone-based, ensuring a high-touch, personalized experience, it strictly excludes cold-calling, as all outbound communications are directed towards our established clientele.Primary duties and responsibilities:Team Leadership and Development: Lead and inspire the customer service team, fostering a culture of excellence, accountability, and continuous improvement. Conduct regular performance reviews and identify development opportunities to enhance team skills and motivation.Strategic Planning and Execution: Develop and implement strategic plans to enhance customer service operations, including the adoption of new technologies, process improvements, and service innovation. Monitor industry trends to keep the service offering competitive.Quality Assurance and Performance Metrics: Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) for the customer service team to ensure high standards of service are consistently met. Implement quality assurance practices to identify areas for improvement and celebrate successes.Conflict Resolution and Escalation Management: Serve as the point of escalation for complex customer issues or complaints, demonstrating problem-solving leadership to achieve resolutions that align with company values and customer satisfaction goals.Budget Management and Resource Allocation: Oversee the customer service department’s budget, ensuring optimal allocation of resources to meet operational needs while achieving financial objectives.Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with other departments (e.g., Sales, Marketing, Product Development) to ensure a cohesive customer journey and leverage insights from customer feedback to drive product and service improvements.Training and Onboarding: Oversee the training and onboarding of new customer service team members, ensuring they are fully equipped with the necessary knowledge and skills to excel in their roles.Change Management: Lead change management initiatives within the customer service department, ensuring changes are smoothly implemented and that the team remains adaptable and responsive to business needs.Employee Engagement: Actively work to maintain high levels of team engagement and morale. Implement initiatives to promote a positive work environment and recognize outstanding team achievements.Customer Relationship Management: Take an active role in managing key customer accounts, building and maintaining strong relationships with strategic partners and stakeholders to ensure long-term customer loyalty and satisfaction.Experience/Skills:Exceptional Communication Skills: Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to clearly convey information and effectively negotiate and persuade when necessary.Analytical Thinking: Ability to analyze data, understand trends, and make data-driven decisions to improve customer service performance and strategy.Customer-Centric Mindset: Deep commitment to understanding and meeting customer needs, with a focus on creating exceptional customer experiences.Leadership and Team Building: Proven ability to inspire, motivate, and lead a team, fostering an environment of growth, accountability, and support.Adaptability and Resilience: Comfortable with change and ambiguity, able to lead teams through transitions and challenges with a positive and solution-focused approach.Organizational and Time Management: Excellent organizational skills, with the capacity to prioritize tasks and manage time effectively in a fast-paced environment.Emotional Intelligence: High level of emotional intelligence, with the ability to build strong relationships, empathize with team members and customers, and manage interpersonal dynamics effectively.Experience: 3-5 years in a customer service management role. Foodservice and/or hospitality industry experience is favourably considered. Experience working with CRM platforms (Zoho or similar)Compensation:Base salary plus performance bonusHealthcare, Dental, 401kCompetitive annual leave packagePowered by JazzHR0Oxo41HtYb

On completion, you will be automatically added to our growing talent pool and contacted as new opportunities arise.About Fingerprint For Success (F4S)Backed by 20+ years of research, F4S’s revolutionary predictive analytics have achieved over 90% reliability in forecasting personal and team motivations, behaviors, and performance. Ultimately, we help people find purpose and fulfillment at work, and help build and scale high-performing teams.Keep in mind, joining our talent pool does not guarantee a job offer. We aim to balance your technical skills with the results of your F4S work style assessment to match the hiring needs of our partners.Your feedback is a gift! Write to us via: to help co-create the future of recruitment, together.Powered by JazzHROccAokLrNN
about_sum: The F4S Talent Pool is a pilot project designed to help job seekers get discovered by our partners based on their anticipated hiring needs. We are inviting professionals in high-growth industries to join our expanding talent pool.

job_description: Job DescriptionGENERAL DUTIES:The Training + Design Specialist will be responsible for developing and delivering sexual and reproductive health training (both in-person and virtual) and technical assistance to health care professionals and other key stakeholders across the country; organizing and facilitating webinars on sexual and reproductive health and justice topics; designing workshops; developing new curriculum, training tools, and e-learning content; and other special projects as assigned. The Training + Design Specialist will be a member of the capacity building division of the organization (The Learning Exchange). This position is based in the organization’s Los Angeles office with a hybrid remote/in-office work schedule. The salary range for this is position $80-85kSPECIFIC DUTIES + RESPONSIBILITIES:Design, develop and deliver in-person and virtual trainings and workshops in the field of sexual and reproductive health (SRH) in both English and Spanish (preferred) for diverse internal and external audiences.Provide support for implementation of capacity building efforts (training, webinars, technical assistance etc.) through developing agendas, coordinating with partners, scheduling trainings, managing registrations, maintaining training records etc.Contribute to the design and production of training materials in English and Spanish (preferred) including participant manuals, visual aids, job aids, tool kits, videos and e-learning modules, etc.Assist in the development, planning and launch and marketing of new Spanish-language trainings, webinars, and resources. Bilingual candidates to assist in the translation and facilitation of Spanish-language trainings and resources.Support division-wide efforts in data collection, evaluation and project planning including review of course evaluation feedback and by implementing quality assurance reviews.Support our annual Sexual Health Update Conference planning team with development of agenda and negotiations with speakers; write bios and workshop descriptions; coordinate and collect presenter materials, handouts and presentation; moderate conference sessions and panels.Monitor project and contract scopes of work, timelines and budgets as assigned.Collaborate with internal teams in the Programs + Strategic Initiatives Department to assist in the development of course content as well as training staff around best practices in public speaking and training facilitation skills.Knowledgeable in the tenants of health literacy in order to convert complex medical information into accessible and understandable content for diverse audiences.Responsible for staying up-to-date on evidence-based best practices in the field of SRH through conference and webinar attendance and regular review of journal articles and new and emerging data.Evaluate, amend and revise division-wide materials with relevant clinical updates, evidence-based approaches and new best practices as needed and on an ongoing basis.Assist with assessment of learner feedback and implementation of improvement plans to address learner needs.Complete assigned reports as required. Support marketing of programs and other LE-related services.Coordinate continuing education reporting for Certified Health Education Specialist (CHES) in conjunction with our agency Continuing Education Committee.Additional duties, as assigned.KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES:To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required to perform this job.Fluent in English and Spanish (preferred).Degree (Bachelor’s or Masters) in public health, health education, nursing, or related field; or equivalent years of experience.2-3 years’ experience in the field of sexual and reproductive health or related field.2-3 years’ experience developing course materials and delivering training for adult learners.Proficient with Zoom platform (meetings, webinars, recordings, team chat, whiteboard, etc.)Experience with course authoring tools (e.g., Camtasia, Storyline, Captivate) and learning management systems for developing and hosting interactive e-learning modules.Proficiency with Microsoft (Excel, Word, Power Point) and Adobe Creative Cloud (InDesign, Photoshop, Acrobat) computer software.Experience developing, implementing and evaluating training programs for adults.Demonstrate independent decision making per scope of work.Work with culturally and linguistically diverse groups.Management of meeting logistics.Ability to create positive working relationships.Excellent written and verbal communication skills.Ability to work independently and/or in a team setting.Excellent organizational skills and adept at working on multiple projects.CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS:A current California Driver’s License, current registration and current automobile insurance coverage is required if you drive on company business. Certified Health Education Specialist (CHES) certified applicant preferred.Company DescriptionAbout Essential Access HealthMission: Essential Access Health champions and promotes quality sexual + reproductive health care for allEssential Access Health (Essential Access) achieves its mission and advances health equity through a wide range of programs and services including clinic support initiatives, provider training, advanced clinical research, advocacy, and public awareness campaigns. Essential Access operates the Title X federal family planning program in California and Hawai'i and serves as the lead fiscal and program administrator for state-supported funding streams that support access to abortion and birth control for individuals with low-incomes seeking these essential services in California.Commitment to Equity, Diversity, Justice + InclusionEssential Access was established in 1968, grounded in the belief that everyone has the right to access the health services and information they want – with dignity and respect. Although significant gains have been made in expanding access to essential health services over the past 50 years, true progress cannot be attained without confronting and addressing racism, advocating for equity and justice for all, including the LGBTQ+ community and individuals with disabilities. We are committed to integrating a health equity lens into our policies and broad range of programs and services and taking meaningful action to promote equitable and optimal sexual and reproductive health outcomes for all.Join UsWith offices in Northern and Southern California, our dedicated staff are leading experts in the field of sexual and reproductive health – as researchers, trainers, health care leaders, and more.About Essential Access Health Mission: Essential Access Health champions and promotes quality sexual + reproductive health care for all Essential Access Health (Essential Access) achieves its mission and advances health equity through a wide range of programs and services including clinic support initiatives, provider training, advanced clinical research, advocacy, and public awareness campaigns. Essential Access operates the Title X federal family planning program in California and Hawai'i and serves as the lead fiscal and program administrator for state-supported funding streams that support access to abortion and birth control for individuals with low-incomes seeking these essential services in California. Commitment to Equity, Diversity, Justice + Inclusion Essential Access was established in 1968, grounded in the belief that everyone has the right to access the health services and information they want – with dignity and respect. Although significant gains have been made in expanding access to essential health services over the past 50 years, true progress cannot be attained without confronting and addressing racism, advocating for equity and justice for all, including the LGBTQ+ community and individuals with disabilities. We are committed to integrating a health equity lens into our policies and broad range of programs and services and taking meaningful action to promote equitable and optimal sexual and reproductive health outcomes for all. Join Us With offices in Northern and Southern California, our dedicated staff are leading experts in the field of sexual and reproductive health – as researchers, trainers, health care leaders, and more.

job_description: About The TeamThe Zillow Group Talent Management organization drives the overall strategy and execution of learning initiatives for all employees, including but not limited to onboarding programs, professional development and performance, and leadership development. Our team is a talented group of leaders, consultants, facilitators, designers, program operation leads, program managers and learning technology specialists. Together, we work to enrich the career and learning experience of our employees so they can develop personally and professionally in alignment with company goals.About The RoleThe Instructional Designer, reporting to the Delivery Team Manager as part of the Talent Management organization, partners closely with project team members, subject-matter experts, leaders, and cross-functional project teams to integrate learning solutions as the business rapidly moves forward. The Instructional Designer is a contributor to various project teams, and owns design and delivery of learning solutions to ensure our employees have an exceptional learning experience.You will get to:Apply human-centered design principles and contemporary methods of adult learning theory to design and develop high-quality, learning solutions (courses, videos, job aids, and other training resources)Collaborate with Program Managers, Program Operations Leads, trainers, and subject matter experts to understand project objectives, conduct needs analysis, and align solution documents (learning plans, instructional plans, storyboards, etc.)Design and develop assessments and evaluation strategies to measure the effectiveness of training programs and make data-driven improvementsUtilize industry-standard authoring tools, multimedia software, and AI tools to create interactive and visually appealing learning contentParticipate in cross-functional project teams to support a wide variety of business lines and create learning solutions for employees across Zillow GroupWrite observable, measurable, and relevant learning objectivesApply human-centered design principles to reimagine and improve the learner experience and enhance knowledge retentionCreate engaging learning materials, such as presentations, virtual learning solutions, learner guides, facilitator guides, leader guides and toolkits, assessments, and videosDevelop effective instructional exercises and assessments that support the desired learning outcomes and objectivesAdhere to accessibility standards and Talent Management design standardsUpdate, curate, and maintain learning contentHandle multiple projects simultaneously, ensuring timely delivery of high-quality training materialsStay up-to-date with industry trends and standard methodologies in learning and development, incorporating innovative approaches to enhance program effectivenessComplete small project requests that are in-scope, but do not need the support of a full project teamThis role has been categorized as a Remote position. “Remote” employees do not have a permanent corporate office workplace and, instead, work from a physical location of their choice which must be identified to the Company. Employees may live in any of the 50 US States, with limited exceptions. In certain cases, an employee in a remote-designated job may need to live in a specific region or time zone to support customers or clients as part of their role.In California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington the standard base pay range for this role is $81,600.00 - $130,400.00 Annually. This base pay range is specific to California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York and Washington and may not be applicable to other locations.In addition to a competitive base salary this position is also eligible for equity awards based on factors such as experience, performance and location. Actual amounts will vary depending on experience, performance and location.Who you areYou show strength in Google Suite, AI tools, Articulate 360, Camtasia, Vyond, Adobe Creative Cloud, or equivalent rapid eLearning and video creation toolsYou have proficiency in audio editing using tools such as Audacity or AuditionYou have intermediate proficiency in visual design programs such as Photoshop, Dreamweaver, or IllustratorYou have intermediate experience publishing and tracking eLearning SCORM or Tin Can-compliant courses in a Learning Management SystemYou have experience creating scripts, providing voiceovers, and creating closed captions for videosYou are skilled in developing prototypes and storyboardsYou can modify vector graphics and create light artwork when necessaryYou are an exceptional collaborator who prioritizes teamworkQualificationsBachelor's degree in instructional design, education technology, or related field3 years' experience in a learning or talent development roleExcellent written and verbal communication skillsExcellent knowledge and application of adult learning theories and instructional design modelsExperience in publishing and tracking eLearning courses in a Learning Management SystemProficient in video and audio production, graphic design, and facilitating meetings in Zoom or other platformsAbility to thrive in a fast-paced, rapidly evolving environmentCollaborative and entrepreneurial mentalityGet to know usZillow is reimagining real estate to make home a reality for more and more people.As the most-visited real estate website in the United States, Zillow® and its affiliates help movers find and win their home through digital solutions, first class partners, and easier buying, selling, financing and renting experiences. Millions of people visit Zillow Group sites every month to start their home search, and now they can rely on Zillow to help make it easier to move. The work we do helps people get home and no matter what job you're in, you will play a critical role in making home a reality for more and more people.Our efforts to streamline the real estate transaction are supported by a deep-rooted culture of innovation, our passion to redefine the employee experience, a fundamental commitment to Equity and Belonging, and world-class benefits. These benefits include comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life, and disability coverages as well as parental leave, family benefits, retirement contributions, and paid time off. We’re also setting the standard for work experiences of the future, where our employees are supported in doing their best work and living a flexible, well-balanced life. But don’t just take our word for it. Read recent reviews on Glassdoor and recent recognition from multiple organizations, including: the 100 Best Companies to Work For, Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, Bloomberg Gender-Equality Index, Human Rights Campaign (HRC) Corporate Equity Index, and TIME 100 Most Influential Companies list.Zillow Group is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please contact us at RecruitingAccessibility@zillowgroup.com.Applicants who receive job offers from Zillow Group will be asked to sign a Proprietary Rights Agreement which includes confidentiality, intellectual property assignment, customer and employee non-solicitation, and non-competition provisions. If you are contacted for a role at Zillow Group and wish to review a copy of the Proprietary Rights Agreement prior to receiving an offer, you may request a copy from your Recruiter.
about_sum: The Instructional Designer partners closely with project team members, subject-matter experts, leaders, and cross-functional project teams to integrate learning solutions. The Zillow Group Talent Management organization drives the overall strategy and execution of learning initiatives for all employees. This role has been categorized as a Remote position.

job_description: M&A Development DirectorSão Paulo, BrazilOur client is a multinational company specialized in the corporate service industry, operating worldwide. Based on innovation, ambition, and integrity, it’s an expanding company active in more than 120 countries with over 70,000 FTE´s globally.Due to their expansion, they are now looking for an M&A Development Director (job creation) who will be responsible for identifying and evaluating potential M&A targets that align with North America's strategic goals. Key responsibilities involve market screenings, strategic and financial analysis, negotiations, pre-selection processes, stakeholder management, discussion facilitation, internal collaboration, and senior management reporting.Key Responsibilities:Conduct comprehensive market screenings to identify potential M&A targets in accordance with company objectives and growth strategies.Lead the pre-selection process of potential targets through strategic fit analysis, considering factors such as market positioning, product portfolio, geographic presence, and synergies.Perform initial financial profile analysis of potential targets, including financial statements, valuation metrics, and potential risks.Initiate one-to-one negotiations with pre-selected targets, demonstrating a clear understanding of their business operations, objectives, and value propositions.Develop and maintain relationships with key stakeholders at target companies, including executives, owners, and advisors.Develop and maintain relationships with key industry associations and groups to promote continuous identification of potential M&A targetsFacilitate discussions and negotiations regarding potential acquisitions, addressing concerns, and identifying areas of alignment.Collaborate with internal teams, including legal, finance, and strategy, to assess the feasibility and implications of potential acquisitions.Prepare and present comprehensive reports and recommendations to senior management regarding potential M&A opportunities.Monitor industry trends, competitor activities, and market dynamics to identify emerging opportunities and potential threats.Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and internal policies throughout the M&A process.Manage the one-to-one M&A pipeline for North AmericaQualifications:Bachelor’s degree in business administration, Finance, Economics, or a related field; MBA or equivalent preferred.Strong understanding of financial analysis, including valuation methodologies, financial modelling, and due diligence processes.Strategic thinker with the ability to analyze complex situations, identify opportunities, and develop innovative solutions.High level of professionalism, integrity, and discretion when dealing with sensitive information.This is really a great opportunity for a driven professional that wants to be part of an ambitious organization and highly motivated team, with lots of opportunities for personal and professional growth.Location: Houston, Texas.Powered by JazzHRDXjP84O8zM
about_sum: M&A Development Director (job creation) will be responsible for identifying and evaluating potential M&A targets. Key responsibilities involve market screenings, strategic and financial analysis, negotiations, pre-selection processes, stakeholder management, discussion facilitation, internal collaboration, and senior management reporting.

job_description: Job DescriptionMergers & Acquisitions AnalystVital role supporting our fast-paced team with critical tasks across the entire acquisition lifecycle. As a Financial Analyst, you'll play a key role in due diligence, financial modeling, integration, and more, gaining exposure to every step of the M&A process.You should have a relevant degree and minimum of 2 years’ experience (ideally in finance, FP&A, or accounting) and possess a sharp mind, a meticulous eye for detail, and a desire to move at a fast pace and learn.In this role, you will:Build financial models for potential acquisitions. This includes forecasting synergies, analyzing risks, and valuing targets, contributing directly to deal evaluation.Manage data rooms, ensuring secure and organized information exchange during the due diligence process. Think of yourself as the conductor, keeping the flow of vital documents seamless throughout the deal.Keep the decision-makers in the loop: Prepare concise and informative reports for leadership, tracking progress and highlighting key findings from due diligence. Your insights will directly inform critical deal decisions.Assist in post-merger integration tasks like organizational realignment, licensing, system harmonization, and cultural integration.Assist with the formation of new business entities for asset purchase transactions. You'll be involved in the legal and financial intricacies of deal structuring.Draft and develop presentations to senior management.Conduct industry research and competitor analysis.Engage with business unit leaders throughout the company.Assist with special projects in support of the various company's business units.Requirements:Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, business, or a related field2+ years of work experience, preferably in finance or accountingStrong analytical and problem-solving skillsExcellent attention to detail and accuracyHigh proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)Ability to work independently and as part of a teamStrong communication and interpersonal skillsPreferred Qualities include:Familiarity with financial modeling toolsExperience with data room softwareUnderstanding of M&A processes and ValuationCompany DescriptionValcourt Building Services works with building owners and property managers to provide preventative maintenance, repairs, safety consulting, and comprehensive building envelope restorations to extend the life of a structure and protect property value. Valcourt works on commercial office buildings, high-rise residential buildings, parking garages, stadiums, hospitality buildings, and healthcare buildings.For 35 years Valcourt has grown from a small window cleaning company serving the Washington, DC area into one of the largest exterior maintenance companies in the country. We proudly serve clients from our offices in New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Maryland, Virginia, Georgia, Florida, and Texas.Valcourt Building Services works with building owners and property managers to provide preventative maintenance, repairs, safety consulting, and comprehensive building envelope restorations to extend the life of a structure and protect property value. Valcourt works on commercial office buildings, high-rise residential buildings, parking garages, stadiums, hospitality buildings, and healthcare buildings. For 35 years Valcourt has grown from a small window cleaning company serving the Washington, DC area into one of the largest exterior maintenance companies in the country. We proudly serve clients from our offices in New Jersey, Pennsylvania, Maryland, Virginia, Georgia, Florida, and Texas.

job_description: Join us as a Virtual Travel Booking Assistant, where your main task revolves around ensuring travelers have a seamless and memorable journey. Embrace remote work and utilize digital tools to assist clients with their travel arrangements.Responsibilities:Client Engagement: Interact with clients via email, phone, or chat to grasp their travel requirements. Tailor personalized recommendations and itineraries to suit their preferences.Research and Planning: Dive into extensive research on destinations, accommodations, transportation, and activities to craft bespoke travel plans. Stay informed about travel trends and restrictions.Booking Services: Secure reservations for flights, hotels, rental cars, tours, and other travel services, always aligning with the client's preferences and budget.Travel Documentation: Aid clients in obtaining essential travel documents, visas, and insurance. This position will also assist with developing marketing material to promote equipment sales.This position will also work with Parts, Service, Rental, and Used Equipment Sales to develop a fully rounded dealership and dealer network. Dealer network will require warranty, technical support, parts support, and distribution, etc. Position will be supported locally by Atlanta Fork Lifts, Inc., and Internationally by our manufacturer, Kärcher Municipal North America (KMNA) who is headquartered in Canada, and Boston, MA.Work Experience/RequirementsBachelor’s degree in business related field preferred5+ years’ experience in Material Handling Equipment or Industrial SalesSkills·3+ years’ experience in managing/mentoring others.3+ years’ experience in managing/mentoring others.Extensive knowledge of Industrial Floor Cleaning & Street Cleaning EquipmentDemonstrate good leadership and decision-making skills.Work effectively and interact with multiple levels within our organization.Ability to read and interpret financial reports.Excellent oral and written communication, organization, and presentation skillsGood knowledge of Microsoft Business ProgramsGood driving recordAbility to work in a fast-paced environment.Competitive spiritCompany DescriptionToyota Material Handling Systems is a Family owned business that was founded in 1973. We represent Toyota Industrial Equipment, the world’s largest forklift brand. We pride ourselves on providing world-class service to our customers at four facilities in Georgia.
