job_description: Job DescriptionOur client is an established and fast-growing global manufacturer of hydraulic accessories serving various industries in which hydraulic equipment is used (construction, agriculture, manufacturing, industrial, etc.). The Company offers an extensive product portfolio including ready-to-install standard products and custom applications for end users, as well as a strong OEM business. Our client maintains an extensive global presence with over 40 subsidiaries across five continents and more than 5,000 employees.TH Bender has been retained to search for a sales-focused, hands-on, proactive CEO to lead the US subsidiary, directing all aspects of the company’s activities in the USA, including sales, business development, and key account management, as well as corporate development and operations.The location of this role is in the Houston, TX-area.Key Responsibilities:Provide leadership and vision to the US organization and participate in the development and execution of mid- and long-term plans.Review the existing sales and organizational structure; develop and refine processes and structures to increase the company’s market share, sales revenue, and profitability.Drive sales and strategic targeting of key markets and clients and leverage existing connections in the industry for business growth opportunities.Actively engage in the acquisition of new key customers while maintaining relationships with existing clients and partners.Initiate, lead, and manage the implementation of action plans to grow existing markets and penetrate new markets.Effectively manage the U.S. subsidiary’s P&L and provide guidance and leadership to the US team.Promote effective communication on all levels of the organization and regularly evaluate processes to drive improvement initiatives.Maintain a positive team-based environment to achieve optimum results. Ensure efficiency, quality, service, and cost-effective management of resources.Interface regularly with the global headquarters and its international channels and cooperate closely with the colleagues of the global sales management team.Represent the organization in important external business relationships with major clients, joint venture partners, and the public.Support and participate in local and global trade fairs, conferences, etc.Perform other duties as assigned.Key Qualifications:Several years of leadership experience in sales management, business development and/or key account management coupled with a general management capacity.An extensive background or experience in the hydraulics industry (or related) is required, ideally with suppliers of hydraulic accessories.Strong knowledge of the targeted markets and applications and an existing network of industry contacts in relevant industries would be desirable.Excellent sales-related skills set, including knowledge of sales process, ability to develop and execute effective sales strategiesProven track record managing a branch, business unit, group or company with P&L responsibility, ideally within a medium-sized organization.Show success in maintaining and establishing new business, negotiating contracts, and closing deals.Direct experience working across diverse business cultures with previous experience working for foreign-owned companies is considered a clear advantage.

job_description: Job DescriptionWe’re looking for a motivated, self-starter to take part in the development activities of our custom software platform responsible for managing and analyzing data using the PostgreSQL database system working alongside our internal and with outsourced offshore engineering teams. This role involves designing, implementing, and optimizing SQL queries, as well as ensuring the integrity and security of the PostgreSQL databases. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand data requirements and provide valuable insights through data analysis.You’ll have the opportunity to witness your ideas come to fruition quickly and observe the impact of your decisions firsthand. You’ll also be able to engage in meaningful conversations with passionate individuals, and build lasting relationships with your team. Working with a small and dynamic global team and a fast-paced business operation, no day will be the same. If you’re passionate about the intersection between automotive and technology, this position may be an excellent fit for you.Your ResponsibilitiesDatabase ManagementDesign, implement, and maintain PostgreSQL databases.Optimize and tune database performance for efficient query execution.SQL Query DevelopmentWrite and optimize complex SQL queries to extract, transform, and analyze data.Create and modify stored procedures, functions, and triggers.Data AnalysisPerform data analysis using PostgreSQL tools and features.Generate reports and visualizations based on data insights.Data IntegrationIntegrate data from various sources into PostgreSQL databases.Implement and manage ETL processes to move and transform data.Data ModelingDevelop and maintain data models specific to PostgreSQL databases.Collaborate with stakeholders to understand and implement data requirements.Troubleshooting and MaintenanceIdentify and resolve database issues and errors in a timely manner.Implement backup and recovery procedures for PostgreSQL databases.DocumentationDocument PostgreSQL database processes, procedures, and best practices.Maintain data dictionaries and metadata information.SecurityImplement and maintain security measures for PostgreSQL databases, including access controls and encryption.This role will be in-office and located at Armatus HQ in Hunt Valley, MD.Who You AreYou have a versatile set of skills, particularly in project coordination and understanding development lifecycle, quality assurance, and some understanding of the technical details of software development. You’re a highly motivated self-starter with the ability to work both independently and within a team context. You have strong communication and interpersonal skills, and are able to quickly build trust and relationships with team members. You have strong analytical skills, and take a data-informed approach to decision-making.QualificationsEducational BackgroundBachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field.Technical SkillsProficiency in SQL with a focus on PostgreSQL.Experience in managing and optimizing PostgreSQL databases.Familiarity with PostgreSQL-specific features such as JSONB, hstore, and full-text search.Analytical SkillsStrong analytical and problem-solving skills.Ability to interpret and analyze complex data sets within a PostgreSQL environment.Communication SkillsEffective communication skills to convey technical information to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.Collaborative mindset to work effectively in a team environment.Attention to DetailMeticulous attention to detail to ensure data accuracy and integrity.AdaptabilityAbility to adapt to changing business needs and priorities.ExperiencePrevious experience as a SQL Analyst with a focus on PostgreSQL or similar relational database systems.Other Useful Skills:Awareness of AWS, Angular, NodeJS, CI/CD, Generative AI.Company DescriptionArmatus Dealer Uplift is a rapidly growing company in the Retail Automotive vendor space, and by far the industry leader specializing in retail warranty reimbursement submissions. job_description: Job DescriptionSigning bonus after your first 90 days!APEX InvestigationAPEX Investigation is a leader in Insurance, Workers' Compensation, Liability and Human Resource Investigations. Our experience investigating thousands of cases, and our ability to adapt to the ever-changing laws impacting our clients gives APEX the leading edge in defending frivolous, exaggerated or fraudulent claims.Role OverviewAs a Surveillance Investigator, you'll embark on a dynamic journey where each day offers fresh challenges and opportunities. You'll play a pivotal role in gathering critical information, capturing clear and steady video footage, and delivering comprehensive reports. This involves both stationary and mobile surveillance where your investigative skills will be tested as you employ pretexting techniques to unveil more information.Surveillance Vehicle RequirementsTo ensure you blend seamlessly into your surroundings, you will be required to drive a company-approved vehicle, defined as a nondescript vehicle that does not attract attention or can be easily forgotten. Prohibited vehicle colors are red, yellow, orange, maroon, and other vibrant shades. Additionally, convertibles, pickup trucks, and electric vehicles are strictly prohibited. Hybrid vehicles are generally acceptable; however, approval is contingent upon evaluating gas mileage versus electric miles. Aftermarket wheels, loud exhaust, personalized license plates or license plate frames, and stickers on the bumpers or windows are also prohibited. All surveillance vehicles must have approved window tinting in compliance with state law. The vehicles must be safe and in good working condition, with investigators bearing the responsibility for maintaining their vehicles in optimal working order.Key Responsibilities and Role Expectations:Discreetly monitor both stationary and mobile subjects, utilizing your own nondescript vehicle.Capture high-quality video footage that not only meets client requirements but also adheres to court evidence standards.Prepare and submit meticulous and timely summaries of case activity on a daily basis.Deliver professional, expedient, and legal investigative services tailored to the specific needs and requests of our clients.Conduct comprehensive case reviews to define objectives and verify critical information, including addresses, phone numbers, vehicle details, and other pertinent data.Utilize cutting-edge online case management system to prepare concise, precise reports that comprehensively detail the progression of each investigation.Maintain consistent, clear communication with management to relay real-time updates on case activities.Candidate Requirements and Qualifications:Must own or have access to a discreet and mechanically reliable vehicle (Large SUVs, trucks, and bright colored vehicles are not suitable; earth-toned vehicles preferred)Demonstrated ability to work a flexible schedule, including overnight travel, weekends, and holidays, to meet the demands of the jobMust have a valid credit card for covering travel and gas expenses, with reimbursement providedPossession of a valid driver's license with a clean and safe driving recordPreferred degree in Criminal Justice or a related fieldPreferred experience working in Loss PreventionVeteran-friendlyBilingual in Spanish is a strong advantageOwnership of a Windows laptop computer with an up-to-date operating system.Proven ability to work independently with minimal supervision, demonstrating self-reliance and resourcefulness.Capable of working in extreme weather conditions, travel, and long hours in the car as the job demands.Why Join APEX?Autonomous Work Environment: Enjoy the freedom to work independently.Rewarding Travel Opportunities: Receive compensation for your travels and mileage, ensuring you're fairly rewarded for your efforts.Explore California: Embark on a journey across the diverse landscapes of California, expanding your horizons while fulfilling your investigative responsibilities.Team Collaboration: Join a dynamic team of Field Investigators, fostering a supportive and collaborative work environment.Path to Professional Growth: Earn valuable hours towards obtaining a Private Investigator License, opening doors to exciting career prospects.Competitive Compensation: Benefit from competitive pay that reflects your skills and dedication to the profession.Guidance from Experienced Leadership: Benefit from the mentorship and guidance of a seasoned manager who will support your professional development and success.Hourly Rate: $19.80 - $26.40 per hourJob Type: Full-timeBenefits Offered To Full-time EmployeesMedicalDentalVisionPTOFSASimple IRA PlanMileage and Travel Reimbursement for Surveillance and Claims positionsEqual Opportunity EmployerAll qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their race, creed, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, age, religion, Vietnam era Veteran’s status, political affiliation, or any other non-merit factor.After making a conditional offer of employment, the company will conduct a job-related background check. A comprehensive background check may consist of prior employment verification, motor vehicle records, professional reference checks, education confirmation and/ or criminal record and credit checks. Third-party services will be hired to perform these checks. Employer will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the requirements of the ordinance.After an offer is made and accepted, the employer will comply with the Immigration and Nationality Act I-9 requirements to establish your identity and employment eligibility.Company DescriptionWelcome to APEX Investigation, a trailblazing force in the realm of Insurance, Workers' Compensation, Liability, and Human Resource Investigations. With an extensive track record of probing thousands of cases, our team's unparalleled expertise and agility in navigating the ever-changing laws impacting our clients empowers APEX to stand at the forefront of safeguarding against baseless, overstated, or deceitful claims. Join us in our mission to build lasting relationships through trust, integrity and quality investigations.Welcome to APEX Investigation, a trailblazing force in the realm of Insurance, Workers' Compensation, Liability, and Human Resource Investigations. job_description: Job DescriptionThe Virginia State Bar is searching for a digital content specialist to perform a broad range of activities supporting a public-facing website and comprehensive communications program. Working collaboratively with a team of internal and external clients, this position utilizes a content management system to add, update, and edit website content, ensuring accuracy, relevance, and consistency of style. The ideal candidate will monitor and track website analytics. They will also create enhancements such as interactive forms, graphics, maps, charts, and user-friendly interface designs to optimize website functionality, accessibility, and user experience. Responsibilities include back-end work to run reports and mailing lists through a query-building tool within the membership database and resolve technical website problems in partnership with the IT Department. In addition, this position will assist with mass-market emails, social media, and other communication projects, as assigned. This position is required to work in the Richmond office. Employees are eligible to telework one day per week after six months.The successful candidate will have the following qualifications:Bachelor’s degree in marketing, communications, or a similar field; or an equivalent combination of education, training, and experienceExperience working with content management systemsExperience with HTML, CSS, JavaScript and/or other web-oriented technologiesFamiliarity with SEO best practices and experience with Google AnalyticsProficiency using Adobe Creative Suite and Microsoft Office SuiteExcellent written and verbal communication skillsStrong analytical, critical thinking, and problem-solving skillsStrong attention to detailAble to work independently and collaboratively in a team-oriented environmentA positive attitude and willingness to learn and practice new tasksVideo editing, digital marketing, photography, and graphic design skills a plusSuccessful completion of a criminal background checkCompany DescriptionThe Virginia State Bar (VSB) was created in 1938 by the General Assembly as an administrative agency of the Supreme Court of Virginia. The creation of the agency unified Virginia's lawyers in a mandatory State Bar. The mission of the Virginia State Bar is to protect the public; regulate the legal profession of Virginia; advance access to legal services; and assist in improving the legal profession and the judicial system.The Virginia State Bar (VSB) was created in 1938 by the General Assembly as an administrative agency of the Supreme Court of Virginia. The creation of the agency unified Virginia's lawyers in a mandatory State Bar. The mission of the Virginia State Bar is to protect the public; regulate the legal profession of Virginia; advance access to legal services; and assist in improving the legal profession and the judicial system.

dict.job_title: Assistant Director for Regional Recruitment (Richmond/Tidewater, VA)
job_description: Shenandoah University’s Office of Admissions is accepting applications for an Assistant Director for Regional Recruitment (Richmond/Tidewater, VA). This is a full-time benefited position.The Assistant Director for Regional Recruitment manages all activities necessary to recruit students to Shenandoah University from the Richmond and Tidewater regions in Virginia, in order to meet individual and team enrollment goals. Regional admissions representatives must have or acquire substantial knowledge about their territory, exercise discretion and independent judgment in developing recruitment strategies for their designated territories and provide a high quality of service to prospective students and families throughout the recruitment, application, and acceptance/enrollment processes. An ideal candidate will live in the Richmond or Tidewater region of Virginia and will work remotely. The regional admissions representative will often be the prospective student's first contact with the university and must recognize the importance of building a relationship based on the professional, correct, and timely exchange of information. The admissions representative is also a liaison between prospective families and the faculty and staff of other university departments. In this role, the admissions representative will be responsible for the general recruitment of all academic programs. While this is a fully remote position, the Assistant Director for Regional Recruitment will be required to travel heavily for off-campus recruitment events, and occasionally travel to Shenandoah University’s main campus in Winchester, VA to assist with on-campus recruitment events. The ability and willingness to work among a team, independently, and until the task is completed successfully, is essential.Primary ResponsibilitiesWorking collaboratively as a member of the First-Year Recruitment team, the admissions representative will be expected to utilize past and current data to analyze the impact, progress, and effectiveness of prior recruitment strategies and events within their designated territories, and then exercise their discretion and independent judgment to create, implement and execute individual recruitment strategies for the upcoming season within their designated territories.Counselors will propose and make adjustments to prior years' recruitment strategies and events schedules, including discontinuing, modifying, or relocating previously held events. Counselors also will be expected to develop special outreach campaigns and new events, that will pique the interest of prospective students in the territory (and/or their parents). Counselors will be responsible for planning, implementing, and executing their campaigns and events, and selecting which high schools to visit and which college fairs to attend.Responsible for developing innovative approaches to increase awareness and develop interest among groups within the designated territory. These groups include but are not limited to, prospective students and families, school counselors and administrators, school and community organizations, private instructors, and independent education counselors.Reviewing applications, and then exercising discretion and independent judgment, including their knowledge of factors contributing to student success, to determine best-fit candidates for admission within their designated territory. Counselors are also responsible for notifying applicants of their admission decisions.Additional Responsibilities Include, But Are Not Limited ToEnthusiastically and professionally representing the university at off-campus recruitment events.Working in coordination with the Admissions Welcome Center Coordinator, assisting in the planning and executing of campus visits for prospective students, families, and school/community groups. This requires collaboration with other university departments, most commonly academic faculty, student life organizations, and athletics.Giving admissions presentations to large and small groups during daily campus visits, virtual visits and coordinated group visits, as well as providing main campus tours and special tours of other buildings, as needed. Fully participating in on-campus recruitment events that occur throughout the year, including, but not limited to, Open Houses, Student Shadow Days, Interviews, and Auditions.Independently managing a series of Saturday Visits throughout the fall and spring, which will be distributed equitably among the members of the First-Year Recruitment team.Maintaining student records and communicating with prospective families.Other responsibilities and duties as assigned by supervisor(s).QualificationsRequired SkillsBachelor's degree is required2-4 years of experience in admissions, sales, customer service, advising, counseling, or related field strongly preferredOutstanding interpersonal skills are essentialExcellent communication skills; both oral and writtenBilingual (Spanish/English) preferredFamiliarity with Apple computers and software, as well as Microsoft software, including Word and ExcelExperience with various admissions technologies, including Slate CRM, preferredAttention to detail, ability to prioritize and complete tasks, and meet deadlinesAbility to adapt to, and utilize, numerous technology applications appropriatelyA basic understanding of how to use data in order to accomplish a goalAbility and willingness to work evenings, weekends and to travel within designated territory. Additionally, periodic trips to campus will be required for training and to support on-campus recruitment programming. Adhering to university policies and procedures regarding travel is required.Must be able to lift 50 lbs. into and out of a vehicle.Valid driver's license with a good driving record and ability to pass a driving background check.Required ExperienceHow to Apply:The complete application will include a cover letter, resume, and contact information for three professional references. The review of applications will begin immediately and continue until a qualified candidate is selected.Shenandoah University is committed to enriching its educational experience and culture through the diversity of its faculty, administration, and staff. All candidates are strongly encouraged to include a statement in their cover letters addressing ways in which they may be able to contribute to that commitment.Note: A pre-employment background check will be required and a satisfactory driving record may be required as a condition of hire.Shenandoah University values the unique and diverse perspectives of individuals and communities locally and globally and seeks to foster mutual understanding in an inviting community where individuals are welcome and respected. The university does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, physical, or mental disability, genetic information, veteran’s status, or on any other basis protected under applicable law.
about_sum: Shenandoah University’s Office of Admissions is accepting applications for an Assistant Director for Regional Recruitment (Richmond/Tidewater, VA). This is a full-time benefited position. An ideal candidate will live in the Richmond or Tidewater region of Virginia and will work remotely. The regional admissions representative will often be the prospective student's first contact with the university.

Private travel, FBOs, and plane coordination.Collaborate with the CEO’s Chief of Staff, Security Program Manager, Air Operations Team, and Personal Assistant to ensure proactive communication and alignment for all schedules and travel - both business & personal).Proactively anticipate the Executive’s needs throughout the day, remain ahead of developing issues, and demonstrate problem-solving skills through teamwork and collaboration across the firm.Possess and consistently deliver a high degree of professional maturity, focus, discipline, and values alignment (Humility, Integrity, Responsibility, Excellence) while engaging with CEO, and working with Office of the CEO personnel, executives/employees, and all persons within the CEO’s professional and personal network.Effectively handle multiple deadlines, navigate competing priorities, and be assertive with the CEO and other leadership members to ensure the team adheres to deadlines while managing short and long-term priorities.Work with household staff to seamlessly integrate personal life and work life in coordination with the Personal Assistant.Qualifications10+ years of experience in an Executive Assistant role supporting senior-level executives, preferably in a venture or similar environment.Possess outstanding verbal and written communication skills.Highly focused and results-oriented. Ability to support complex, deadline-driven operations while also being able to identify goals and priorities and resolve issues.Expertise in travel booking for both domestic and international travel. Be a reflection of the CEO and the firm in every action you take while engaging with both personal and professional networks, as well as the internal and external community.Please Note: Your application will be considered for all open positions. dict.job_title: Chief of Staff to Founder at YC AI Startup

You will support multiple facets of the company such as People Ops, Technical Ops, and Revenue Ops. Establish and streamline sustainable processes and act as an advisor and coach to the team on projects. Previous experience in an operational role, working cross-functionally in a startup environment is required. This is a hybrid role, 3 days/week in-office based in San Mateo. 140-180K+ DOE + equity, benefits, 401k, unlimited PTO.ResponsibilitiesWork across all aspects of our business to support the operations team as well as our engineering, product, sales, and finance teams.Initial focus will be on streamlining Technical, People, and Revenue Operations, diving in where needed.Establish and manage ongoing, sustainable processes and help maintain our strong company culture as we scale.Provide operational support for our technical programs as needed.Assist in recruiting, interviewing, and hiring additional teammates to our rapidly-growing team.Create your own role after identifying what our organization needs and prioritizing your initiative creation / process development accordingly.Qualifications3+ years working in an operational or similarly highly cross-functional role.Comfortable working in a busy, ever-changing environment and helping bring order to chaos.Strong reasoning and analytical abilities.Extremely organized and detail-oriented.Ability to handle multiple tasks at once and prioritize accordingly.Strong communication skills.Available to work full-time in their San Mateo office.Please Note: Your application will be considered for all open positions. You do not need to apply for multiple roles.

dict.job_title: Senior Director, Programs, Liberty Hill Foundation
job_description: Position Title:Senior Director, ProgramsReports to:Chief Program OfficerPosition:Full-TimeLocation: Hybrid-Remote; Los Angeles, CaliforniaSalary:$133,000- $166,300About Liberty HillAt Liberty Hill Foundation, we are at the forefront of social change, championing social justice and equity by supporting grassroots movements in communities most affected by systemic oppression. Our mission is to transform lives, communities, and policies, building a more equitable future for all. We are a dynamic team of passionate changemakers, committed to supporting community organizing through our programs: grantmaking, training and capacity building, and alliance building.Our staff represent a dedicated community of people who are committed to social justice and improving the material conditions in which we live. At Liberty Hill, we’re also committed to our organizational values of Justice, Equity, Diversity, and Inclusion (JEDI).We embrace the differences and characteristics that make us all unique, and we encourage collaboration as an essential element of our mission to reach our north star goal—to achieve justice and equity by building power in communities most impacted by systemic oppression.The RoleLiberty Hill is seeking a Senior Director of Programs. This is a vital member of our foundation's leadership team. Our focus is on creating impact, influence, and infrastructure, and your leadership will play a key role in integrating these elements into our programs.You will guide a talented team of Program Directors who share your dedication to our north star. Your objective is to elevate our programs, ensuring they align with our mission and effect tangible, measurable change.You're not simply overseeing the work; you're infusing integrity, vision, and inclusive innovation into every facet of our program delivery. Reporting directly to the Chief Program Officer, you'll be the point person for ensuring smooth project implementation and execution, meeting deadlines, and adeptly addressing challenges.We seek a leader who can mentor staff, foster connections, and propel our team forward while embracing the diverse voices that strengthen our mission. You serve as the guardian of our guiding principles, ensuring each program contributes to our overarching goals.Impact AreasStrategic Leadership:Proven ability to develop and lead program strategies aligned with Liberty Hill's mission in Los AngelesExperience mentoring and guiding teams across diverse program areas, fostering excellence in initiatives like Grantmaking, Housing Advocacy, Environmental Stewardship, and Public HealthStrong track record of innovating systems and processes to enhance program effectiveness and efficiencyFundraising and Financial Management:Demonstrated success in setting and achieving fundraising targets, providing support and oversight to program directorsProficiency in budget management, ensuring strategic allocation of resources for program successCommunication and Collaboration:Effective collaboration with communication teams to craft and disseminate compelling narratives, showcasing program impact and challengesStrong interpersonal skills to cultivate and sustain relationships with stakeholders, fostering partnerships to advance program goals in Los AngelesMonitoring and Evaluation:Experience in designing and implementing monitoring and evaluation frameworks to assess program impact and progressAbility to analyze data and address challenges to ensure program milestones are met and outcomes are effectively communicatedLeadership and Advocacy:Demonstrated leadership in representing Liberty Hill and advocating for programmatic initiatives, internally and externallyCommitment to fostering a culture of collaboration and inclusivity, promoting growth and development within the team and across departments in Los AngelesRequirementsSkills, Knowledge, and AbilitiesExperience:Minimum of 8 years of experience leading teams towards excellence and meaningful impact, preferably in social justice or related activism; experience in program management or a related field, particularly within the nonprofit sector preferredSkills and Qualities:Dedicated ally for social and racial justice, committed to fostering diversity, equity, and Strong leadership and management skills, including the ability to inspire, motivate staff, and promote inclusivityExcellent communication and interpersonal skills and penchant for building relationships and collaborating with diverse stakeholdersExperience in strategic planning, program design, monitoring and evaluation, and/or capacity building is highly valuedTechnological Proficiency:Proficiency in Office365 and personnel management tools like Paylocity and Culture Amp is desiredFamiliarity with project management platforms such as Teams, Slack, and Asana is preferredLandscape Familiarity:Knowledge of the Los Angeles organizing landscape and an understanding of the social, political, and economic factors impacting the communities served by Liberty Hill are advantageousCore CompetenciesLeading People:Inspire and guide the team with purposeful leadership and insightful supervision.Personal Resilience:Embrace a wide array of responsibilities with enthusiasm and adapt gracefully to unforeseen challenges.Problem Solving:Develop strategic plans and navigate towards solutions, anticipating challenges before they arise.Strategic Thinking:Lead with foresight, instilling a visionary mindset within the team.BenefitsComprehensive coverage for employee healthcare, vision, and dental at 100%Employer contribution and match for 403b retirement savingsStipend to support remote work10 Days of paid vacation time the first year, and 58 hours of sick timeGenerous benefit of 22 paid holidays2 dedicated Volunteer DaysFridays off throughout AugustSummer Break is the first week in July, and Winter Break is the last two weeks of DecemberLiberty Hill operates in a hybrid remote environment with a dedicated coworking space in downtown Los Angeles. While in-person elements vary by function, key elements of this role revolve around face-to-face mentorship, in-person meetings and events, and other components that require physical presence and participation.Physical AsksAbility to engage in a hybrid remote work environment in our shared downtown co-working space or working remotelyMust live in Los Angeles County and be available for face-to-face collaboration when necessary.How To ApplyLiberty Hill has retained the services of Charity Search Group to coordinate the search for this position. To apply, please complete this online application. If you have questions or need accommodations, please contactRanata Reederatranata@charitysearchgroup.comor visit www.charitysearchgroup.com.Liberty Hillis an equal opportunity employer and is committed to having a workforce that reflects diversity at all levels of the organization. We recognize the importance of not viewing individuals based on a single identity, and we thrive on being equitable in our recruitment process as well as in our efforts to be inclusive of all employees.
about_sum: Liberty Hill Foundation is seeking a Senior Director of Programs. This is a vital member of our foundation's leadership team. Your objective is to elevate our programs, ensuring they align with our mission and effect tangible, measurable change.

job_description: Are you a highly motivated car enthusiast with a strong desire to contribute to a team? Are you a meticulous individual who loves working behind the scenes to keep things organized and on track? Have you been waiting for the right opportunity to align your passion for order management, logistics, and customer service with your love for the Motorsports community? If so, we have an exciting opportunity for you here at Apex Wheels.Apex is a leading provider of high-performance automotive wheels and accessories, catering to the motorsport and performance car enthusiast community. Our mission is to provide wheels that deliver real and measurable performance and to protect consumers from a misleading industry full of fashion-focused wheels through exciting technical education.This is not a warehousing position - you won’t be working on a warehouse floor. Instead, you will becoordinating and orchestratingfrom the comfort of your remote workspace at home. This position is aboutkeeping orders and returns flowingand ensuring that all parties who need to be keptinformed of order statuseshave all the information they need.As our Order Processing & Fulfillment Specialist, you’ll play a vital role in bridging the gap between our 3PL Warehouse and our Production, Customer Services, Sales, and Purchasing teams toefficiently and accurately fulfill ordersand electronically process returns. Your ability tomaintain good relationshipsacross departments, with our third-party partners, and with our customers is key. We're looking for someone who is passionate aboutgetting things right the first timeand is in the habit ofdouble-checking work for quality and accuracy.Yourcustomer-facing soft skillswill contribute to an excellent customer experience, especially whenresolving order issuesthat impact our customers. You’ll need to be able to deliver information to customers, verbally and in writing, in a concise, digestible, and compassionate manner, empathizing with the frustrations that can come from shipping delays or other unexpected order issues.This is a remote position that can be done from anywhere in the contiguous USA and work hours are 8:30 AM and 5 PM PST.How to apply:To be considered for this position, include the following in your cover letter: Tell us how your ability to collaborate with team members has contributed to your success in previous positions. Then, tell us about your interest and background in Motorsports. If you have none, let us know why you’re interested in Apex!ResponsibilitiesDirect to Customer Order Management: Act as a liaison between our contact at 3PL, Production, Customer Service, Sales, and Purchasing teams to provide updates on order status and product issues so that the teams can proactively communicate changes. Review backorders with the goal of providing customers alternative solutions that meet their needs and desired timelines. Review orders suspected of fraudulent activity in the early stages and take appropriate action under the guidance of the Customer Experience Manager. Manage open invoices for accurate recordkeeping and action when needed. Generate invoices and bill orders fulfilled each dayWholesale Order Management: When orders are ready for fulfillment, enter them into ShipStation, fulfill Netsuite orders to be Shipped, and coordinate freight dimensions to and from our 3PL partner. Partner with customers who have prepared freight shipments to provide dimensions and schedule freight pickup. Electronically prepare international freight orders for our international customers. Handle wire payment processing for our various partners. Support order processing for customers who did not pay at the time of order. This includes identifying SKUs that are ready to ship, quoting freight, preparing commercial invoices with freight and customer notifications, and entering payment receipts into NetSuite to begin order fulfillment. Manually process orders with customer-supplied shipping labels via FedEx, UPS, DHL, or via freight and process them into ZendeskFulfillment: Handle aging orders in ship station and coordinate with 3PL to track down missing products - this includes inbound and outbound shipments. Partner with 3PL to ensure that Apex products receive adequate inspection when requested by the Customer Experience team.Warranty Processing and Returns: Provide input to 3PL regarding the return of damaged products and recycling. Ensure RMAs and warranties are checked in on time, and processed, and the status is communicated to the customer. Help clear and sell the blemished inventory by establishing an eBay storefront to list and sell blemished inventory products. Partner with 3PL to obtain photographs for use on the eBay store. Record and communicate blemishes/defects to engineering.Develop Standard Operating Procedures for all responsibilitiesOther responsibilities as neededRequirementsAssociate's degree; preferably in manufacturing, supply chain, warehousing, business or another relevant area3 years of equivalent//relevant work experience is preferredStrong attention to detail, organizational skills, a customer-focused mindset, and a proactive approach is requiredExcellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to de-escalate sensitive customer scenariosFamiliarity with wheels, tires, fitments, and general automotive aftermarket space.Proficiency in Gmail, Sheets/Numbers/Excel, or other spreadsheet applicationsStrong experience with logistics, international shipping and customs, and small package shippers like UPS, Fedex, DHL, etcExperience in ERP systems (such as Netsuite), logistics systems (such as ShipStation), and demand planning systems (BlueRidge) is preferredWe will give strong preference to candidates who reside in the following states: CA, CO, FL, GA, NJ, OH, OR, PA, TX, WABenefitsFull-time position $19 - $25 per hour depending on experience, with wiggle room for a rockstar100% Apex paid employee Medical, dental, and vision benefits with buy-up optionsCompany contributions towards dependent medical benefits401k with employer matching after 6 monthsAccrue 2 weeks of vacation in your first year, with increases as you grow and at key anniversariesPaid sick leavePaid holidaysSupport your track addiction with reimbursements for HPDE and autocross event registration feesEligibility for the SEMA college grant and loan forgiveness programCasual environment where T-shirts, jeans, and shorts are welcomeEmployee discounts and freebies on Apex products and schwagParticipate in company activities including karting, spectating at races, track days, and more
about_sum: Apex Wheels is a leading provider of high-performance automotive wheels and accessories, catering to the motorsport and performance car enthusiast community. As our Order Processing & Fulfillment Specialist, you’ll play a vital role in bridging the gap between our 3PL Warehouse and our Production, Customer Services, Sales, and Purchasing teams.

job_description: Paceis a leading international art gallery representing some of the most influential contemporary artists and estates from the past century, holding decades-long relationships with Alexander Calder, Jean Dubuffet, Barbara Hepworth, Agnes Martin, Louise Nevelson, and Mark Rothko. Pace enjoys a unique U.S. heritage spanning East and West coasts through its early support of artists central to the Abstract Expressionist and Light and Space movements. Since its founding by Arne Glimcher in 1960, Pace has developed a distinguished legacy as an artist-first gallery that mounts seminal historical and contemporary exhibitions. Under the current leadership of CEO Marc Glimcher, Pace continues to support its artists and share their visionary work with audiences worldwide by remaining at the forefront of innovation. Today, Pace hassevenlocations worldwide, including a European foothold in London and Geneva; two galleries in New York; Los Angeles; Hong Kong; and Seoul, as well as offices in Beijing and Berlin. In spring 2024, Pace will open its first gallery space in Japan in Tokyo’s new Azabudai Hills development.The Client Relations Manager will report to the Head of Client Relations to support the activities of the department – including, but not limited to, events, gifting, mailings, client research and development – with the ultimate goal of understanding, stewarding, and growing our client base while achieving our artist goals globally. The candidate should have strong administrative and organizational skills, a high level of discretion and respect for confidentiality, and an interest in data analysis, research, business development, and customer service.What You’ll Be Doing:Maintain, monitor and develop client records both in the CRM and in spreadsheets used for physical mailings and event invitationsEnhance client records using sales data, event lists, physical mailing lists, and online prospect researchCapture detailed non-transactional information about client and other contacts’ (tastemakers, curators, etc.) preferences and lifestyle to enhance databaseTrack event engagement and participation, and tag recipients of initiations, mailings and gifting in the CRMMaintain up-to-date museum contact information in the database by keeping tabs on key institutions and leadership changes, and updating records accordinglyReference sales data to customize lists across department functionsWork with the dealer teams to create guest lists that serve the Pace Gallery events and track engagement and participationCollaborate with the Sales, Communication, and Artist Management teams to ensure there is a consistent upkeep of records in the CRMWork with dedicated internal contacts to deliver a consistently high level of support by understanding client and artist needs while demonstrating a comprehensive level of technical knowledgeResearch targets for client engagementProvide excellent client service to ensure artist and client satisfaction and qualitive standards by the gallery are maintainedAssist with gifting for artists and clients globallyWork closely with the events team on guest list, invitations, RSVP schedules and reporting, face sheets, and seatingAttend and assist at events as neededRequirementsWhat You’ll Bring:Bachelor’s degree in art history or a closely related field3+ years of experience in a donor / client relations or business development role at a non-profit, museums, art fairs, private membership clubs, universities, or luxury fashion brandsExperience with CRM platformsExperience with EventsImpeccable verbal and written communication skillsSuperior research and project management skillsStrong follow-up, organizational and stakeholder management skillsKnowledge of or interest in contemporary art/artistsProficiency with MS OfficeForeign language fluency is a plusBenefitsHealth Care Plan (Medical, Dental & Vision)Retirement Plan (401k, IRA)Life Insurance (Basic, Voluntary & AD&D)Paid Time Off (Vacation, Sick & Public Holidays)Free Food & Snacks

The Client Relations Manager will report to the Head of Client Relations to support the activities of the department. The candidate should have strong administrative and organizational skills, a high level of discretion and respect for confidentiality.

job_description: At Allego, we’re on a mission to redefine the future of modern sales enablement. We are a rapidly growing SaaS technology company in the metro Boston area, with sustained double-digit growth every year in our 10+ year history. Our Allego Modern Revenue Enablement Platform is AI-driven and seller-centric, with the power, agility, insight, and ease organizations need to drive better sales results in a hybrid world—all in a single app. We’ve been recognized by prominent analyst firms such as Gartner and Forrester as a market leader, with our platform approaching 1 million users in 65 countries across the globe.Our customers span one quarter of Dow Jones Industrial Average companies, 5 of the 15 largest U.S. banks, 5 of the 8 largest U.S. insurance companies, 4 of the 5 largest global medical device companies, 3 of the 5 largest global pharmaceutical companies, 6 of the 10 largest U.S. wealth management companies, 5 of the 5 largest global asset management companies, and many other global enterprises. Not only are we growing quickly, but The Boston Business Journal, The Boston Globe, and Inc. Magazine have all named us as a top place to work.Role Description:This is an outstanding opportunity to enter a high-growth company and make an immediate impact on its success. Our goals are aggressive, our market is growing rapidly, and we’re looking for a seasoned yet scrappy, creative, and motivated individual to take our website to the next level — continuously driving and reinforcing Allego’s market leadership position.Reporting to the VP of Marketing, the Director of Website & Digital Properties is tasked with aligning our website, App Store listings (iOS, Android), and Peer Review Sites (G2, TrustRadius, Gartner Peer Insights) with our marketing strategies and promotions. In this pivotal role, you'll champion our web strategy, expertly balancing paid and organic tactics to bolster demand generation, with a focus on making our website the premier channel for driving engagement. You'll lead a cross-functional team to optimize our web presence to support growth targets. Your role will involve leveraging analytics to demonstrate the digital marketing programs' impact, improving website experience and conversions. Working in partnership with growth marketing, product marketing, content, and external partners, your efforts will be central to advancing our online footprint. This position is perfect for individuals skilled in orchestrating an effective web strategy, eager to drive innovation and execution in Allego's dynamic, digital-first environment.How you’ll make a difference in this role:Develop and lead a focused strategy using the website to drive pipeline growth, increase conversions, and boost ARR, emphasizing Allego's core capabilitiesMonitor and analyze site performance to identify improvement opportunities and implement data-driven strategiesBuild a compelling online presence that highlights Allego's leadership in revenue enablement, guiding prospects through their decision-makingManage web projects with clear priorities and efficient communication, ensuring timely and impactful deliveryOversee external agencies and service providers to support strategic web initiatives effectivelyCollaborate with marketing and communications teams to ensure web strategies support broader business goalsWork with Marketing Ops to enhance site usability and conversion through A/B testing and personalization strategiesDirect CMS management, ensuring the site remains fresh, engaging, and reflective of Allego's value propositionLead SEO strategy to increase global visibility and attract a targeted audience, sharing key achievementsEvaluate and optimize the web tech stack to ensure a cutting-edge online presenceRequirementsThe ideal candidate will have:8+ years of website management experience, preferably in a B2B SaaS settingProfound expertise in CMS (Wordpress) digital marketing (Google, LinkedIn, G2, TrustRadius) and marketing automation platforms (Hubspot), encompassing various features like landing pages, forms, workflows, etcAdeptness in data analytics, reporting tools like HubSpot, Salesforce, Google Analytics, and the acumen to convert data into actionable strategiesStellar project management abilities, juggling multiple projects effortlesslyAn analytical thinker with an innate curiosity for digital innovationsExceptional communication skills, with the ability to foster collaboration across various departmentsAbility to think creatively and innovatively, while maintaining a data-driven approachA result-driven approach, infused with a passion for digital excellenceCertifications for Google Ads, LinkedIn Ads and SEO are a plus.BenefitsCulture and values:Our core values, better known as Allego’s Operating Principles, are at the heart of our business. They are the fabric of our culture and central to our approach to work, our customers and with each other. Take a look here!Benefits:Allego offers a comprehensive and competitive benefits program that enables employees to choose the benefits that best fit their needs and the needs of their families. Full time new hires are eligible for most benefits on the first day of employment:Medical/dental/visionUnlimited vacationPaid parental leaveHealth Reimbursement Account (HRA)Flexible Spending Account (FSA)401(k) with matchingShort & long term disability, AD&D, life insurance

job_description: Workable makes software to help companies find and hire great people. We get recruiting and its role in building healthy workplaces — which is why we're proud more than 20,000 teams around the world use Workable to do exactly that.At Workable, you'll find smart people who have fun, learn and innovate, and help others do the same. We brainstorm, we laugh, and, occasionally, we party (there's a lot to celebrate), but we also appreciate people's need for quiet time and focused work. We respect everyone, we hire the best, and make sure every experience is special.We are looking for an Account Manager in Boston. Account management responsibilities include developing strong relationships with customers, connecting with key business executives and stakeholders to drive customer renewals and identify new business opportunities among existing customers. You will drive customer engagement and adoption throughout the customer lifecycle, prioritizing activities and outreach based on account health and operational data. Working closely with Sales and Customer Support you'll use your product expertise and consultative skills to provide a superior customer experience.If you are familiar with account management software (CRM), have a flair for client communication and understand consumer behavior, we'd like to meet you. Ideally, candidates for this role will know how to meet ambitious individual and team-wide sales quotas.Ultimately, a successful Account Manager should collaborate with our sales team to achieve quotas while keeping our clients satisfied and engaged with our products and services in the long-run.RequirementsExperience as an Account Manager, Key Account Manager, Enterprise Account Manager, Sales Account Manager, Junior Account Manager, Customer Success Manager or relevant client facing roleExperience as a Recruiter (either an in-house recruiter or a staffing agency recruiter) a plus.Have a deep understanding of the recruitment lifecycle and key recruitment objectives within enterprise level businesses.Demonstrable ability to communicate, present and influence key stakeholders at all levels of an organization, including executive and C-levelConsultative approach when working with customers/clients and ability to focus on the long term partnership goalExperience working with enterprise level customers with complex and lengthy internal processesTrack record of building strategic relationships within key accounts to expand reach and develop new businessSolid experience with CRM software (e.g. Salesforce, Zoho CRM or HubSpot) and G-Suite (particularly Google Sheets)Experience delivering client-focused solutions to customer needsProven ability to juggle multiple account management projects at a time, while maintaining sharp attention to detailExcellent listening, negotiation and presentation abilitiesStrong verbal and written communication skillsThis is a Massachusetts based roleResponsibilitiesAct as a dedicated contact for assigned customers, answering questions, handling objections, providing best practice guidance while maintaining a high level of customer engagement.Work closely with a portfolio of enterprise level customers, build and maintain strong, long-lasting client relationshipsNegotiate contracts and close agreements to maximize profitsNurture customers in high growth segments in order to capitalize on account expansion and upsell opportunitiesEnsure the timely and successful delivery of our solutions according to customer needs and objectives, working closely with our Solutions Consultants, Engineers and Product team.Clearly communicate the progress of monthly/quarterly initiatives to internal and external stakeholdersDevelop a deep understanding of customer recruitment goals, foresee any potential issues/ product limitations and provide alternative solutions through a consultative approach.Develop new business with existing clients and/or identify areas of improvement to meet sales quotasForecast and track key account metrics (e.g. quarterly sales results and annual forecasts)Identify areas of improvement in terms of recruitment KPIs for customers and work closely with them to improve best practice e.g. reducing time to hire.Conduct quarterly reviews with customers and track improvement across key metrics/initiatives.Assist with challenging client requests or issue escalations as neededWork with our internal sales team and onboarding team to ensure alignment on customer goals.BenefitsOur employees enjoy benefits that make them more productive and contribute directly to the development of their professional skills. We want to be able to attract the best of the best and make sure they keep getting better. On top of an exciting, vibrant and intellectually challenging workplace, we offer:Health & Wellness BenefitsRetirement PlanGenerous PTOMobile PlanApple gearWorkable is most decidedly an equal opportunity employer. We want applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender, religion, national origin, ancestry, disability, age, sexual orientation, or any other characteristic protected by law.

job_description: We are looking for ambitious individuals with a strong work ethic to join our management training team in the new year! We bring on a carefully selected group of individuals who share our values and passion for building an exceptional company. We provide structured training and individualized development feedback that allows everyone to grow at their own pace.We start every new manager in our training program because we recognize faster growth if given clear development objectives and constant individual development feedback. So, if you’re looking for a long-term rewarding (and fun) career and not just any old job, you are in the right place! Help us accelerate our pursuit of building the best management team on the planet!The primary purpose of this position is to learn all aspects of operations. As our clients’ demands grow, so does our need for exceptional management. Our goal is to go above and beyond expectations. The management trainee is entry-level, so it is required to undergo our training process with our outstanding management staff.You will be responsible for:Manage a team of 10-15 individuals: Coaching, and motivating your team to drive sales that deliver exceptional customer service, developing sales and marketing strategies, hiring and developing new employees, and reviewing ongoing performance assessments.Successfully negotiate his/her way through our rigorous and highly selective training program with an emphasis on customer service and salesMaster the business on the front line Ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction by being knowledgeable on all products offered, increasing incremental revenue and building a loyal clienteleRecommend appropriate corrective action when necessary holding yourself and team accountable for production and qualityFull knowledge of appropriate systems and proceduresRecognize and respond to performance flaws with honest and direct communicationQualifications:1-2 years of leadership and management experience1-2 years Customer service or sales experienceMust enjoy training, developing, mentoring, and motivating others.Ability to manage time effectively, multi-task, and prioritize responsibilities in a fast-paced environment.Active listening skills and the ability to be resourceful and versatile to adapt quickly to all types of individuals.High-levels of integrity, strong work ethic, responsible, and positive outlookWe provide:Continuous career growth and development enhancing professional skillsTraveling opportunities in and out of the USBonuses, incentives, and competitive compensationCommunity involvementDiverse company cultureOver the past year our firm took deliberate steps to elevate our marketing and communication strategies, tighten our company culture, and successfully expand our client portfolio. Because of these improvements, we are now looking to hire a Marketing & Promotions Assistant to start immediately. Our Marketing & Promotions Assistant will partner on our client projects and work alongside mid and upper-level management.We put an intense focus on providing you an initial orientation, comprehensive hands-on training, and pairing you with one of our top Marketing & Promotions Assistant employees for further guidance.As the Marketing & Promotions Assistant, you would...Act as the liaison between client and consumerBuild and maintain collaborative relationships with team members in order to produce a high-functioning, collaborative, and creative environmentProject coordination and strategic planning for the designated marketing campaignHelp develop effective sales materials, including pitch, training content, and onboarding material that is focused on supporting the development of the Marketing & Promotions Assistant s DepartmentsDevelop strategies that are continuously looking to optimize the customer experienceAttend campaign meetings with Management to discuss the designated market, expected production goals, and other related topics as they come upWhat you can expect to receive working here as a Marketing & Promotions Assistant ...A genuine interest in your future and a promise that you will never be considered or treated like “just another employee.”A defined career path in line with your professional goals and personal development. No one likes to stay in the same place for too long - we get that and we act on it.Training, training, and more training! There are always new skills, new markets, and new strategies to learn. You’ll either learn from a trusted expert OR you will be the one teaching the designated department.Full support & encouragement from management to present and explore any ideas that you have. Especially if they improve productivity, increase revenue, and improve team camaraderie.The kind of work environment where you actually like to be around your coworkers no matter if you are in the office or catching a sports game.Competitive Compensation structure paid weekly along with bonuses, planned team nights, and quarterly networking events.We are looking forward to receiving your application!Powered by JazzHR4mgiDzrL98

job_description: An amazing non-profit organization is in search of a Director of Development in Los Angeles. The Director of Development holds primary responsibility for the development of Major Gifts & Individual Giving Programs, with oversight of events, corporate and community strategic partnerships, and marketing and communications. The Director of Development provides strategic input into the annual Development Plan with a focus on identifying, cultivating, soliciting, and stewarding annual donors at all levels, and reports monthly on related progress and outcomes.The Director of Development implements and coordinates a comprehensive donor engagement plan which includes cultivation and stewardship of major donors and annual giving campaigns, partnering with the Executive Director, Board of Trustees, and development committees. The Director of Development is a versatile frontline fundraiser whose contributions are critical to the successful operation of the organization.Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following:In partnership with the Executive Director, lead implementation of an integrated fund development plan across all revenue sources with strategies, goals and objectives that meet overall revenue goals and forward the mission of the charity and ensure long-term sustainability.Develop cultivation & stewardship plans that create a high-quality donor experience - regular correspondence, thoughtful donor engagement & invitations, professional proposals, mailings, and acknowledgments.Build development team prospect portfolios, ensuring the flow of prospects into the giving pipeline from identification through solicitation.Manage a portfolio of assigned individual donors, including family foundations and organizations, employing strategic moves management to secure annual commitments.Use cultivation tools, including donor site visits, meetings and materials, to introduce, engage and inspire new individuals to partner with the organizations mission.Plan and execute salon fundraising events as well as cultivation/donor appreciation events, managing all aspects of event operations & logistics, including managing invite, RSVP lists, and working with host, venue and vendors.Ensure that all individual and major giving fundraising activities are of the highest quality in order to enhance the program's name, reputation, and visibility. Track current data against established benchmarks to measure program success.Supervise the Sr. Development Manager to ensure objectives, goals and outcomes are accomplished, including but not limited to, portfolio management, corporate and community strategic partnerships, and execution of special events.Work with Sr. Development Manager to maximize donor and board cultivation and engagement.Work with Sr. Development Manager to support Volunteer & Community Engagement Manager, ensuring their objectives, goals and outcomes are accomplished.Supervise the Development Associate to ensure objectives, goals and outcomes are accomplished, including but not limited to, portfolio management, crafting family foundation LOI’s and proposals, KPI dashboards are accurate and monthly financials reconciled.Supervise the Marketing & Communications Coordinator in all aspects of digital media content and creation, e-blast campaigns, and print communications such as collateral and special event pieces.Supervise the Administrative Coordinator ensuring timely and accurate database entries into Raiser’s Edge system along with preparation of gift acknowledgements, check requests and financial batches, mailing lists, Raiser’s Edge queries and reporting.Assist Executive Director with preparation of annual budget and collective revenue goals.Participate in chapter-wide leadership and professional sector activities to maintain a high-level understanding of fundraising climate and best practices.Partner with Programs Manager on family/mission-focused and program related marketing and communication items, along with program funding opportunities such as transportation, food insecurity etc.Attend community-sponsored events and speaking engagements.Provide day-of support at LARMH fundraising special events.Demonstrate ability to work with other staff, volunteers, and houseguests in a collaborative and compassionate manner.Act as a brand steward, upholding Global brand standards and consistency in all projects.This position has a lucrative compensation and benefits package. Amazing leaders, employees, and culture environment.Powered by JazzHRxPpzH2qTgh

job_description: Position starting: 8/9/24FTE: .5ongoing contractHiring Manager: Karie Cooperemail: kcooper@alpinedistrict.orgphone: 801-610-8725CertificationElementary 1-8Elementary K-6Art TeacherPosition PurposeTo develop students' interest, abilities, talents and skills for artistic expression and creativity in the visual arts, as well as aesthetic understanding and appreciation by implementing district approved curriculum; documenting teaching and student progress/activities/outcomes; developing lesson plans; modeling the necessary skills to performing assigned tasks; providing a safe and optimal learning environment; and providing feedback to students, parents and administration regarding student progress, expectations, goals, etc.Essential FunctionsDevelops and administers school art curriculum consistent with school district goals and objectives.Develops lesson plans and instructional materials and translates lesson plans into learning experiences so as to best utilize the available time for art instruction.Teaches knowledge and skills in art, including crafts, drawing, painting, lettering, design, commercial art, art history, and three-dimensional art to secondary pupils, following the course of study adopted by the Board of Education, and other appropriate learning activities.Provides instruction by which pupils develop aesthetic concepts and appreciation and the ability to make qualitative judgments about art, art appreciation and what constitutes art.Conducts ongoing assessment of student skills and learning in artistic techniques and expression, and modifies instructional methods to fit individual student's needs, including students with special needs; conducts individual and small group instruction as needed.Demonstrates techniques in activities such as drawing, painting, and modeling, using standard and teacher-prepared instructional aids.Develops instructional plans and organizes class time to provide a balanced program of instruction, demonstration, and working time.Instructs pupils in proper care and use of tools and equipment used in art classes.Evaluates each pupil's performance and growth in knowledge and aesthetic understandings, and prepares progress reports.Plans and presents art displays and exhibitions designed to exhibit pupils' work for the school and the community. May sponsor exhibits from outside.Continues to acquire professional knowledge and learn of current developments in the educational field by attending seminars, workshops or professional meetings, or by conducting research.Organizes and maintains a system for accurate and complete record-keeping, grading, and reporting for all student activities, achievement and attendance as required by district procedures and applicable laws.Encourages parental involvement in students' education and ensures effective communication with students and parents.Ensures that student conduct conforms to the school's standards and school district policies, and establishes and maintains standards of pupil behavior needed to achieve a functional learning atmosphere in the classroom.Coordinates with other school professional staff members, especially within grade level, and participates in faculty meetings and committees.Selects and requisitions appropriate books, art materials, instructional aids and other supplies and equipment and maintains inventory records.Knowledge, Skills And AbilitiesKnowledge of current art instructional teaching methods and educational pedagogy, as well as differentiates instruction based upon student learning styles.Knowledge of art curriculum and concepts.Knowledge of applicable federal and state laws regarding education and students.Ability to use computer network system and software applications as needed.Ability to organize and coordinate work.Ability to communicate effectively with students and parents.Ability to engage in self-evaluation with regard to performance and professional growth.Ability to establish and maintain cooperative working relationships with others contacted in the course of work.
